This size sensor is used in almost all compactcameras and they simply can't produce good quality images at lowlight levels.Note that although the 12 Megapixel 300HS has 4 times a manypixels as my previous 3 MP camera, the sensor is the same sizeand so each pixels gets 4 times less light.  This makes for morenoisy images.  The camera processes the image to try to hide thenoise but a side-effect is that the picture gets fuzzer.I tried to filter out the luminance noise in a raw image savedusing the CHDK firmware.  The result had less noise but also lostdetail. The result was arguably no better than the camera's JPEGoutput.  My conclusion is that, not surprisingly, the cameraalready does the best possible job at removing image noise.There may be specific situations where you could do a better jobmanually, it would quickly get tedious if you tried to do it forevery photo.You can find many examples of photos taken with this camera usingflickr.com's "Camera Finder" feature.  The image noise is clearlyvisible in full-size (3000x4000) images shot at high ISO.  Butmost of these pictures look just fine when reduced to fit thescreen which is why most reviewers are happy with the imagequality.Going to a 1/1.7" sensor as used in the better compact cameras(S95 or LX5) would help a bit (about 1 f-stop), and so would awider lens (another f-stop for an f2 lens).  But more improvementwould require a larger sensor.  Unfortunately, a larger sensoralso means a larger lens.  Interchangeable-lens cameras areeither too large to fit in a pocket or their lenses leave outimportant features such as zoom and image stabilization.I spent some time trying to get the best image quality. Here'ssome guidelines I found useful:- White Balance: set the white balance manually or use the nifty  custom white balance feature.  The AWB setting often fails;  perhaps it gets confused if it can't find something in the  picture to calibrate itself with.- Saturation & Contrast: set custom color to "Positive Film" or  use a custom color setting with increased RGB levels and  contrast - the default modes are under-saturated and have too  little contrast- ISO:  for stationary objects: set a fixed ISO that is as low as  possible while keeping an the shutter speed at 1/8s or faster.  This assumes you can hold the camera steady enough for the  image stabilization to do its job.  The automatic ISO settings  are too aggressive and set needlessly high ISO values.  Once  the ISO climbs above about 400 it's probably worth using the  "Handheld Night Scene" which reduces noise significantly by  automatically taking four shots and combining them.  for people and other things that move: set the ISO to Auto.  The camera may choose very high ISOs and produce noisy images  but at least you'll get your picture.Note that the sample photos for the ELPH 300HS on Canon's website use manual white balance and ISO 50 (which is strange sinceISO 100 is the lowest manual setting).There is an alpha version of CHDK available for this camera andperhaps the HDR and raw modes could, with post-processing, beused to compensate somewhat for the limitations of this camera.I had also expected the smaller size of the 300 HS to be anadvantage but, actually, it's too small!  The smaller size makesit harder to handle and operate the controls and yet doesn't makeit any more likely that I'll bring it along with me.The camera does take excellent HD videos and has lots ofinteresting modes if you're into tinkering.  But in the areawhere it matters most -- image quality -- this camera is astinker.I returned the camera and am looking at other compact cameraoptions.

Reviews.Title: So far, amazed
Reviews.Author: Eric Mars
Reviews.Content: Got it today. Taking pictures & video in low light. I'm very impressed - this is MUCH better than your camera phone, will make you forget Flip Video forever, and is tiny, tiny, tiny. Macro photos in low light, obscenely good. In twilight, flash off, snapped a photo of my computer keyboard, and saw an eyelash on my "option" key (that's "alt" key for Windows folk).Let me say it again, in low light this camera is amazing.Build quality is excellent, buttons are large enough for western fingers, and it's undeniably cute. Adorable even.My goal was to get something pocketable that would do better than my iPhone 4 for still pix. Check for sure. Replace my Flip HD. Check (and then some).I have a Canon G10 which takes awesome photos in good light. And shoots raw. And my rm has a Sony NEX5 which is even better. But the G10 is heavy, so I don't bring it. And the NEX5 isn't mine.I've bought other compact digicams in the past, but they have been so BAD compared to bigger ones. This one is quite amazing, a tiny bit of a compromise, but not by much. I'm finally happy with a compact digicam. You can slip it in your pocket just like a cellphone.

Reviews.Title: Another nice compact Canon
Reviews.Author: Big Dawg "Big Dawg"
Reviews.Content: Got this for the wife, we've had 2 previous Canon PowerShots SD300 and SD450, and they still work great! But we wanted to  upgrade to this for the wide angle view, and this camera does it! Super wide angle to catch everything. At its widest, I see a slight fisheye effect that can be a bit annoying when taking photos of people, but landscape shooting, its awesome!We really wanted to get the S100, but it was too pricey so this one fits the build just fine.

Reviews.Title: Best buy for your money
Reviews.Author: Nicnae
Reviews.Content: I purchased this after doing a lot of research and even returning the Elph 310. I decided that the "upgrades" from the 300 to 310 weren't worth anything. Also, the 300 has a wider angle lens, which is more desirable. This is so small I take it every where with me, and can always snap a shot of my little one. It is even comfortable to hold, but I do have small hands. It takes great shots for a point and shoot. The only thing to know is that it does have its limitations. In low light(like inside a house) sometimes I have to stabilize it well or else I get blurry pics of my toddler. But the camera does warn you if that is going to happen. Still, the convenience of having it when I want it outweighs any negatives. The five stars is for this price range. Obviously a digital SLR will take much better pictures.

Reviews.Title: great little camera - but cheaper elsewhere
Reviews.Author: L. Chakrapani
Reviews.Content: A compact camera that does a great job, with a 5X zoom lens, which is fairly fast at it's wide end (f/2.7) a great wide angle for indoor shots and very good low light performance. The only thing I did not like is the sometimes choppy zoom control. I really liked the metal body with a rough finish that allows us to maintain a good grip on the camera. Another plus is the dedicated video record button and e zoom automatically skews down when you go to video mode.One thing to note is that this is priced $30 less at my local big box store. Even with sales tax it beat the $167 price on Amazon - and I am a Prime customer who buys lots of things from them.

Reviews.Title: LOOOOOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: D. Collins
Reviews.Content: I had an older canon powershot. It was heavy, big, and it was slow, the video was poor quality. So upgraded to this and I love it! It's so small I keep it in my purse all the time for unexpected picture moments. I use my camera phone, but when I want to take a lot, and even better quality pictures I use this. It turns on fast. The quality is excellent for a point and shoot and the pictures are not blurry. Outdoor pictures are excellent and it takes great pictures in low light situations.The video is awesome! I used to have a different camera to take videos and a different one for pictures. WIth this, I have only one for both purpose.One charge of the battery can take hundreds of pictures. I can't say enough about this. I just love it as an everyday camera. Great for vacation/travel. I have a DSLR but really, it's too big to bring around on vacations.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for shooting on the go
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Took this with me to California and I was able to get the feel of it relatively quick. The low-light setting was impressive and the features are easy to manipulate without fussing with a lot of menu options. Great idea with the sandpaper exterior - helps keep a tight hold on it.It's so small and compact that I'm sorry to say I've misplaced it...deciding whether or not to go with this again or the Canon PowerShot S95.For the price, this camera is a MUST-HAVE!Update: Found it! Phew. Still amazing pictures. Just be careful when using the Vivid mode - not everything looks great vivid.

Reviews.Title: LCD Image Brightness and Flash Too Bright
Reviews.Author: H. Friedman
Reviews.Content: After reading most of the reviews, I decided that this would be a great gift for my sisters birthday. The price was affordable and there did not seem to be much of a huge difference upgrading to the newer models. In addition, I was looking for a simple point and shoot camera that would take quick shots, to avoid that "oh please take that damn shot" moment, as you wait. The specs state 1.5 seconds, which is very respectable... until you use the flash. More on this below.This camera is very compact and easy to store in your pocket. The video is pretty clear and easy to record. The buttons are located in good locations and the color Red was very well received, making it easy to locate.Now for the problems:1) IMAGE BRIGHTNESS ON LCD SCREEN: The major problem, at least with the camera we received, is that the image brightness displayed on the screen does not match to those you will see on your computer. Of course, this is not a surprise, since the lcd on the camera only shows a small amount of pixels but the problem is not the clarity or color, but that of brightness. Photo's taken in low light situations with no flash will look bright enough on the camera's display but once you transfer to your computer, they are very completely dark and extremely grainy. Likewise, photo's taken with a flash look washed out on the screen but once transferred, look not as bright. Decreasing the screen brightness on the camera did nothing to elevate this issue. Defective screen?2) FLASH TOO BRIGHT:The flash is too bright and not controllable in either automatic or manual modes. This results in photo's that look too flash exposed and too many highlights in the face. Luckily, if the ISO setting is low enough, the photo's can be corrected in any photo editing software.3) AUTO ISO TOO HIGH & GRAINY: Although automatic mode is indeed handy for people who do not want to or know how to adjust settings. The flaw here is that the Auto mode decides which ISO setting to use, which in most situations is exceptionally high (i.e ISO 400 with Flash, ISO 1600 without). The higher the ISO the more grainy the images will be and the less pixel brightness information you have for photo retouching or correcting.The fix for this is to use manual mode and change the auto ISO to a value of 100 or 200. Make sure that your flash is set to auto or OFF, and this should result in a much better quality looking image with no pixel grain. When the flash goes off, you might get an overexposed image that is too bright, but since you have a lot of pixel information, you will most likely be able to adjust that in any photo editing software.4) TOO SLOW WITH FLASH: Although photo's taken without a flash are taken at an impressive 1.5 seconds, once you include the flash, that time dramatically increases to 3-4 seconds, where your models have to wait patiently with there frozen smiles that turn to grins.IMPROVEMENTS NEEDED (likely by purchasing another model):1) ISO Max, this way you can guarantee that the camera won't select such a high setting of ISO 1600. ISO 400 should really be the high limit.2) Flash brightness control. This would eliminate the need to correct for this in a photo editor. Auto Flash brightness based on ISO would be ideal.3) Ability to reuse last auto setting for next photo. This way, the camera does not need to recalculate focus, red eye, settings, etc all over again.4) An LCD that displays correct brightness of photo's taken (if my camera is not a defect).NOTE: In my defense, I should have been more aware that taking photo's in low lighting would result in a high AUTO ISO setting of 1600. I actually didn't notice that ISO until the day after. However, when I viewed this through the camera's lcd screen, they looked quite bright (even the darks were bright enough) and overexposed when using a Flash. Being very impressed with the low lighting photo's, I decided to avoid using the flash for more than half the photo's..... BIG MISTAKE.

Reviews.Title: Good for baby pics
Reviews.Author: Majka
Reviews.Content: We had an older digital camera that was just not keeping up with our baby. By the time it focused, the moment was over. And that's not even talking about flash photos. Indoor shots were a mess, grainy or blurry. I did some serious research and we bought this camera. WOW! What an improvement. I'm yet to take it out of AUTO mode and we've got a lot of great photos already. I'm not a huge photography buff, I just wanted a point and shoot camera that performed well indoors. Well, I got that and more. I can take better photos indoors without flash with this camera than the old one took with flash. The time it takes to focus and take a shot is very fast - fast enough to catch a super active baby before he moves on. And the color balance is pretty darn tooting good to boot. Yes, it takes a few days to figure out how to get it to focus on the right thing so you have a few blurry pics at first. Yes, you can sometimes hear a little vrrrrrr sound when you are zooming out in the movie mode (never yet zooming in, hmmm). But I didn't get the camera to take movies (though I've ended up taking a bunch and the quality is better than from our Flip video camera) and the still photos are great. Battery lasted about a week of daily intermittent use. One feature I love - you don't have to turn the camera on (get the lens to come out) in order to review your photos, so it protects the sensitive lens from grubby little hands.

Reviews.Title: One of the best Point and Shoot in my mind
Reviews.Author: Ravi Prakash
Reviews.Content: I am not going to go into a lot of technical details but here are a few things i wanna share:-Pros:- Great quality pictures: even in low light (not at night but "low light" specially when you dont want flash and pics are dark otherwise)- Excellent wide-angle lens: This means if you are on a beach this lens will capture a major part of ocean :) or you can even use it to capture redwoods- sturdy: have dropped it 2-3 times it still works awesomely (just saying)- lot of preset modes- excellent HD moviesCons:- the bottom is slightly curved so hard to balance for self-timer pics- wide-angle: as weird as it may sound but its true. coz remember for portraits either you would have to stand too close or zoom in (aka quality loss)Overall, i would totally recommend this to anyone thinking about point and shoot.Also, i would suggest buying a 16GB card even if it costs little more mainly to take as many pics as you can without worrying about space.Happy Clicking!

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: Murph
Reviews.Content: Coming from a family of professional photographers, I cannot get away with just using my camera phone to take our pictures.  I wanted something small and easy to use that had good color range and takes good pictures.  This camera is all of those things, obviously not top of the line but the price is indicative of that.  Takes great beach pictures and fits in the wifes purse or my front pocket very easily so it works well for us

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Excellent Price
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift for Christmas even though I picked it out myself.  I spent days looking at different cameras on the internet and reading all of the different reviews and I just kept coming back to this one.  I did go to the stores and look at them after I had it narrowed down.  Everything I read about it is pretty much dead on, its a great point and shoot.  It is small, but I think I like that about it.  I am still able to easily operate the camera and it doesn't have take up much space in my  pocket.  It is very quick in startup and in between shots.  It takes excellent pictures and video.  Don't worry about all of the different reviews you read that try and point out flaws in the pictures, the picture quality is excellent (I am displaying on a brand new 27" MAC) and I really see no issues.  It does have a lot of cool features that are kind of buried in the menu system, but I don't think I have used anything except the auto mode to this point.  Also, I was able to get it on sale on here for $120.  So, if you need a digital camera that takes great pictures and video and you aren't looking to invest in an SLR camera, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: G. Greene "greenegs"
Reviews.Content: I recently had to replace my wife's camera.  She wanted an easy to use compact as she was shooting a lot of our great-grandchild.  After researching all the options I ordered this one even though I am a dyed-in-the-wool Nikon lover.  I have to say I am extremely impressed with its easy of use, quality of picture, very compact size and the fact that the wife has bonded with it easily and quickly.

Reviews.Title: 2nd Canon ELPH
Reviews.Author: Jason J. Sidel "Jason"
Reviews.Content: This is our second Canon PowersShot ELPH and it is great.  Good zoom and video features.  Takes great pictures; even better than our old one.  Only replaced the 10mp one due to dropping it one too many times and having some broken casing on it.  Smaller and lighter than the old version.  Real nice for vacation or an outing with the family without lugging around a large camera.

Reviews.Title: Simply amazing!
Reviews.Author: someone
Reviews.Content: I have previously owned two Kodak point-and-shoot cameras (one purchased in 2003, and one in 2006), and was a bit hesitant to purchase a non-Kodak camera, but I am so pleased that I chose this camera. I only heard about this camera because my cousin has it, and she was raving about it and I had the chance to play around with her's before purchasing one for myself. This camera takes amazing pictures. I also love playing around with the settings in the programmable mode. I have used "stitch assist" to take panoramic pictures that look professionally done once I use the "PhotoStitch" program that comes with the camera. One of the biggest upgrades from my previous Kodak cameras is how fast this camera takes pictures; pressing the shutter to the time this camera takes the picture is so quick, which makes it easy to not miss a shot of action.I decided to purchase the black one since I like the rough surface that makes it easier to grip. This is the smallest camera I have owned, and it takes some experience to get used to holding it.I am a college student who loves taking pictures of both people and still-life, and I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: pretty good camera
Reviews.Author: jango_mo
Reviews.Content: This camera gives u good bang for ur buck... its got quite a few settings which might take some time getting used to, but overall a very good buy.... picture clarity is excellent...

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Anadem
Reviews.Content: I considered many cameras before settling on the Canon 300.  I wanted a pocket camera for everyday use but with good quality.  I have had Canons in the past and felt comfortable buying another.  One thing I find annoying is the ever-expanding megapixels in small cameras. Sucks up room on the computer, makes them harder to upload or email. Just not necessary for snapshots. My last camera was a 6 and did the job just fine.  It is several years old and showing some loss of quality, so I wanted to upgrade a little.  I use my camera for general grandma snapshots, simple scenic photos and at work to record visitors for Facebook.  I am really happy with the results.  Work is particularly challenging because the lighting is very bad.  Photos were excellent if I turned off the auto flash.  The size and weight are perfect for me.  Easy to put in my pocket when taking the dog to the beach,etc.  Or can keep handy on my desk.  I found it very slippery at first, dropped it right out of the box (on carpet, luckily)so now I am careful to use the wrist strap.  Haven't had a chance to test it on grandchildren yet, but Christmas is coming!Can't say anything about the video.  Haven't used it and am unlikely to use it much.  Clearly, not a pro - but this is a great camera for the typical snapshot taker.  I set it on auto and rarely change.  Easy to use with great quality.  Highly recommended to grandmas everywhere.P.S. It was a struggle to get all four grandchildren to look adorable at the same time.  Must be the darn camera!  :-)

Reviews.Title: Good alternative to SLR
Reviews.Author: Harvey West
Reviews.Content: Very easy to use out of the box.  Clear bright viewing screen.  Surprised by the clear, sharp photos with the telephoto settings and in low light without the flash.  Fits comfortably in the shirt pocket and palm.  I was looking for a simple, easy-to-carry, point-and-shoot camera providing good quality images.  This one certainly provides value for money.

Reviews.Title: Best Camera @ this price point.
Reviews.Author: Senior Notty
Reviews.Content: Awesome camera with quick easy to manage interface.  Has so many photoshop like features integrated into the camera such as cropping, color balance, rotation, etc...

Reviews.Title: A compact photographic marvel to have in your pocket daily or night out,...portable, intelligent - it delivers.
Reviews.Author: AgogoLive
Reviews.Content: Amazing performance & value for point & shoot category - a particular bonus is its low light white balance feature & HD video, previously available in higher end models only.Purchased this recently for my 84yo mum who decided she wanted a camera to take some photos for her scenic cruise.This fits the bill perfectly. It you don't want to have to think or tinker too much with the camera, this little marvel will do all the work for you surprisingly well.+s==It's simplicity - ease of use is a key consideration for beginnersSUPER intelligent auto sensors ensure consistent quality images are achieved each time for a wide range of scenarios.AMAZING low light performance - allows quality evening/ concert/ nightlife shots - the biggest plusAn 24mm ultra wide angle lens for scenery capture is another big plusReasonably fast capture (scenery & poses) though can't compare with the DSLRs (better for candid ppl shots)Optical stabilizer alleviates any shakeSlim, lightweight portability ideal for travelHD video recording for capturing time-s==Ironically though, its slim build and the smoothness of the Silver finish lacks grip, hence some ppl with stiff fingers may find it slippery & encounter problems gripping & operating it. Esp so for large knobby hands.Plastic shutter button not as definitive in feel - esp during pre-shot focusing - however not a dealbreakerSome hv reported the problem of some shaking during video zoom between 3.8-4.8x but I doubt mum will be using that feature! [Update: Ive just seen the video clip on "the shake" - be good to fix this though it is not as bad as I had envisaged, probably forgivable for beginners, as the audience will probably think it's the cameraman and not the camera.For most ppl, this camera will have more than enough.  Which explains why it tops the charts.An additional consideration:  If grip is important, then the black textured finish may be a better option. However I have also read that the textured finish tends to pick up lint along the way and may be difficult to keep clean, plus tends to get snared in one's pockets (the good out of this is that it doesn't drop out nor gets pick-pocketed as easily).  It is interesting that colour choice could have such large implications. Perhaps the product description should state the textural differences as I'm sure it was intentionally different to provide choice in taste & functionality.I, OTOH buy most things in silver, in this case I was beginning to wonder if I had made the right choice as I had bought it for an elderly person with a little arthritis - she had found it rather slippery and I had subsequently read about the black casing providing better grip.  Well ... at least this clears it up. I would loathe having to try and remove lint from its sandpaperish surface.  Hopefully over time, grip could come with a little practice.

Reviews.Title: Canon 300HS or 310HS
Reviews.Author: Moviefan
Reviews.Content: I thought I'd write this review for those of you who were considering either of these cameras. I did a lot of research as I always do when considering purchasing anything and this was no exception. After selling my Canon 40d, I wanted a simpler camera that I could take everywhere. I boiled it down between the 300, 310 and 510. I pretty much crossed off the 510 after seeing it had only an f3.4 lens coupled with the potential short battery life with the touch screen and the fact that someone said "this is not like your iPhone screen". So it was between the 300 and 310. I bought the black 300 that a major yellow tag big box store had in a package with an battery, case and card for a great price. After getting it home and doing a little follow up research regarding possible issues of these that were made in China, I found that mine was made in China so I went back and bought a red one made in Japan. So far so good. And I love the red over the black. I couldn't get used to the texture on the black one plus after seeing how bad the floor model look of the black one, I could just imagine how bad mine would be after continued use.So after using it for a week and loving it, I had the chance to check out the 310 in person when it arrived in the stores and decide if I should return the 300 or not and get the 310. The screen was bigger on the 310 and of slightly better quality but what made the final decision for me on which camera to keep was the placement and moreover the size of the menu and auto/program buttons on the side. Why they did this I have NO idea. If you have fingers bigger than that of a 5 year old then good luck manipulating the switches; especially the top one (I think it's the auto mode one). That alone sealed the deal. As I mentioned in a comment to one of the reviews on the 310, I would have to carry a paper clip or toothpick with me at all times to flip that switch--and I have narrow fingers. So all in all I am VERY happy with the 300 and love the many features it has. I was too much of a pixel peeper and that's why I bought the 40d but after hardly using it and taking so-so photos because I was not too savvy with it, I just gave up and sold it. I wanted a pocket camera that took good pictures that was easy enough for my wife to use and small enough to take anywhere. I found it in the Canon 300HS. No regrets!

Reviews.Title: Found the best with custom setting
Reviews.Author: P. Veerakamolmal "Joe Lin"
Reviews.Content: Canon 300 hs is a delight to use.  After reading several user forums, I have found a setting that works best for most of my needs.  Pictures come out best with 'P' mode.  Set it to Vivid or Positive Film - I prefer the latter.  Positive Film only makes red, blue, green more attractive; whereas Vivid makes yellow too pronounced for me.  A user also commented that you can set exposure to -2/3.  I am trying -1/3 for now.  Having used the camera for ten days I am happy to give the camera a five-star.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: CMM "CMM"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome and fun to use.  It's really fast, i.e., you shoot one picture and the next one is ready, particularly when not using the flash.  There are many shooting modes, i.e., ultra slow video, kids, vibrant color, etc. that are both a lot of fun and useful.  The camera is really small so I keep it in my side cargo pocket pretty much all of the time so I'm ready to shoot the kids, but it would easily fit into a breast pocket.I read where the battery life is poor, so I got these extra batteries on Amazon,3 PACK Lithium-ion NB-4L NB4L Battery For Canon Camera but I actually haven't found the battery life to be poor.  The camera does a good job of warning you when the batteries are getting close to the end.I also purchased this GTMax 3pcs Black Pouch Case+USB Memory Card Reader+LCD Screen Protector for Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS,ELPH 100 HS,SD1400 IS,SD1300 IS,SD940 IS,SD1200 IS,SD780 IS,EX-Z16,Nikon COOLPIX S3100,S4000,S3000,S220,S230,S620,S210 case which came with some other goodies that I use, like the screen protector and memory card reader.  I also purchased this Transcend 16GB Class 10 SDHC Card (TS16GSDHC10) card for the camera and it has so far performed flawlessly (I shoot a lot of the 1080p video which really tests the limits of a card).

Reviews.Title: Amazing image quality
Reviews.Author: Dmitry Goldenberg "Dmitry"
Reviews.Content: I have several cameras ranging from this small camera that I bought to replace a damaged IS300 to D30 SLR.  I must say that I purchased the small camera to bring with me when I go on trips, the SLR was for everything else as the image quality was much better.  This new camera changed all that for me.  After trying some of the cheaper small cameras that produced horrible images, I got this and never looked back.  The images are so good that I find myself not using my DSLR much at all.  The camera even does great evening/night shots.  I was amazed.  The video is simply amazing as well.  To be able to take 10 minutes of HD video that is optically stabilized is simply unreal from something this small.Anyway, If I had known it would be this good, I would have happily paid much more, especially after trying several cheaper ones.I could not recommend a camera more that I recommend this one.  Buy it, enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Simple Camera That Takes Good Pictures
Reviews.Author: Jdsteven
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a month ago to replace an aging Olympus Point-and-shoot, and so far I've been pretty happy with it. It takes pretty nice pictures and it's really small and light so it's easy to take everywhere.Pros:Very small and lightHas a nice grippy texture so it's not so easy to drop itHas a lot of different built in modes that make it easy to get good pictures in any situation.Shoots Full HD video that looks pretty goodHas a nice wide angle lens.Cons:It has no manual modes available to control things like aperture, shutter speed or focus (this is a personal preference; you may not mind)The super slow motion movie mode (which is pretty cool) has low resolution (320x240 @ 240 fps or 640x480 @ 160 fps)The buttons are kind of small if you have big fingers- I frequently push buttons i didn't mean toThe on-camera menus are kind of confusing.All in all it's a great little camera, and it takes great pictures indoor and out. I think that, as of this writing, it's definitely the best all around compact camera in the price range and you won't be disappointed in it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Movie Buff
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I have owned a few Canon cameras and this one rates among the best. Great low light and night shots!

Reviews.Title: First Reaction
Reviews.Author: D Wood
Reviews.Content: The Canon ELPH300 was an update from our older Canon SD700, which we were very happy with. Just received the ELPH yesterday, and put it through its paces yesterday at a school play.  So far, we love this camera. Perfect size, user interface couldn't be easier, and the picture and video quality are stunning for a point-and-shoot.  We've had a string of cameras that have lasted us through about 10K photos each, and this one looks to be another in that line.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Little Camera
Reviews.Author: gunar.
Reviews.Content: Pros: absolutely fantastic photos in low-light scenes like clubs, parties, and concerts; lots of fun features to keep you entertained (slow motion movies, miniature effect); records detailed 1080p video; fast, always ready, instant on; low noise, especially for a point and shoot; sharp pictures with punchy colors; HS system isn't marketing fluff, it works; teeny.Cons: jell-o effect (rolling shutter) in HD movies, which isn't the camera's fault, it's the nature of CMOS sensors; weird autofocus box tracking thing in auto; scratches like a bitch; screen could be higher resolution; the lens sits in this little ring that protrudes a tiny bit from the front of the camera, and dust collects in this ring like crazy, I have to use a tooth pick to dig it out; flash recycle times aren't incredibly fast.In short, if you need a camera that fits in your pocket (it's smaller than my BlackBerry) and can keep up with your life, get this. There's a few little things you could nitpick, but I dare you to find a better camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Traded in my Sony DSC-TX5 for this. Couldn't be happier!
Reviews.Author: V. Bachmutsky
Reviews.Content: I just sold my Sony DSC-TX5 because I was not happy with the image quality. I've played with the new DSC-TX10 and the image quality is pretty much identical to my DSC-TX5. The Sony is a fairly highly rated compact camera but about 40% of the images turned out somewhat blurry, simply lacking sharpness, even in bright light conditions. The Sony does have a lot of nice features such as the 10 feet waterproof, panorama, and low light mode, but what's the use if you have to delete 40% of the pics you take??Getting back to this camera, I am indeed very impressed with it! Images are crystal clear. This is true even when I take side shots while rollerblading! Hand-held night shots are pretty impressive too. Video is great quality (although it eats card space fast). Camera is fast, responsive, and very compact (fits in your jeans no problem). Love the textured coating! I had the Canon SD790IS before and I was looking for something that could give me the same quality of pictures but perhaps smaller and with a wider lens. This is it!Only drawback is that sound quality in video is not great. The microphones seem to be very sensitive and even when you're recording in silence, there's a constant sound of static in the video. I suspect, it would fail miserably in a club setting. All in all, a solid Canon product! Got mine off BestBuy actually (made in Japan!)

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: mountain
Reviews.Content: I was interested in the Flip HD pocket video camera or the Kodak Playsport. Then I came across a Youtube video by "The World According to Jon" where he argues against purchasing a pocket video camera. Instead he recommended buying a *real* digital camera with video capability. I followed his advice, and after several days of painstaking research, I finally decided to buy a Canon Elph 300 HS.Size:I went to a brick and mortar store, and was shocked to know how tiny this camera really is. It is almost like the size of a credit card, and almost as thin as a smartphone. It is very light and very pocketable.Build:I bought the black unit. It has this anti-slip, gritty feel to it. I appreciate this tiny nuance to avoid accidental slippage. The camera body is metal and not plastic. It feels good in your hands and it looks pricy rather than cheap. It looks very stylish and hip too.Features:I'm amazed how Canon was able to squeeze tremendous features into a camera this tiny. It has features available only to more expensive and larger digital cameras.Price:This camera is way *UNDERPRICED* ... but don't tell Canon about it. BTW, I got mine on sale at BB for $20 off retail.Performance:I ordered two 8-gigs SDcard from Amazon which has not arrived yet. So, I used an old Sandisk 2-gigs, class 2 SDcard. I used the Smart AUTO function and took pictures in low light (only the light from my computer monitor in a darkened room). The quality of the pics was very good. I took a few seconds of 1080p video hoping that my Canon won't choke. I was amazed that the Canon took a 1080p video although the quality was a little bit grainy (in very low light). I took several pics underneath flourescent lighting in the gym, and the pics were excellent. Flesh tones were true and not saturated.One of my favorite features so far, is the Movie Digest. If you select this feature, this little Canon will take a few seconds of video before it takes a picture. So at the end of the day, you can stitch together a full-length video show out of the few seconds of video snippets. Simpy amazing !!!!!I'm still exploring the various features of my tiny Canon. I'm like a kid playing with a new toy I just unwrapped under my Christmas tree. It is Christmas in April.Conclusion:If time is priceless, then this camera is a good investment because it captures and freezes moments extremely well that would have otherwise been lost forever.I have absolutely no regrets with this purchase. It is money well-spent and the ROI is mind-boogling. This little camera is way beyond my most optimistic expectations.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: Paul Noble
Reviews.Content: Beautiful product quality and excellent functionality in an amazingly small and very attractive package, all at an exceptionally low price considering. Picture quality is very good, surprisingly close to the Leica D-Lux 4 (Panasonic LX3) and the Olympus XZ 1 that I compared it against. The best and best value compact point and shoot on the market for sure. I haven't yet tried its full HD / stereo recording (one can use the zoom too), but reviews are glowing. Bravo, Canon!

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy this Camera
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: The photo quality of this camera has been extremely dissapointing, particularly since it is a top of the line compact from Canon.  Nearly any brightness, even indirect will creat a haze across the entire photo on Auto or any other setting.  I have been into photography for 40 years and have owned 5 high end small format digital cameras, including 2 Canons and purchased this to replace a great Lumix model that expired.  The Lumix did much better as does my spouses Lumix.  When we both shoot on travel, the photos from hers put the Canon's to shame.

Reviews.Title: The only camera a person needs (outside of pros)
Reviews.Author: K. Geddings
Reviews.Content: I have to say this really is honestly the only camera youd really need unless you are a professional photographer.  It is small enough to carry around anywhere and not have any excuse not to bring it with you when you go places and it takes good quality pictures that dont look like they were taken with a cheap consumer camera right away if framed properly.  Not only that but the video quality of the camera is as good as if not better then most consumer HD camcorders out there.  Now at first you may think well such camera would be useless for good videos because it being so small there is no way to really keep the video steady. Thanks to optical image stabization the camera stays very steady even handheld.  Its image stabilization is actually superior to my Canon HD camcorder which i paid 3 times as much for.  This is wonderful as it means you can have one device thats small enough to take anywhere that can take good pictures and excellent video and the video is at 24 frames per second which is rare for a consumer small camera that is the same rate as film so you can get a nice cinematic look.The camera has a very nice wide angle lens that really stands out as you can get more stuff in the shot like people and enviroments (is also great for taking pictures of indoor things like rooms in your house or places you visit) compared to my mothers kodak easyshare camera the view that it capture is significantly more.  It also is great for video too as was the problem with my older camcorder i felt i had to back up most times to get things in the shot.I have used a Digital SLR and dedicated HD Camcoder (that used tape) and i must say this is a real joy to have. I had not been using my SLR and Camcorder that much as having an ipad now i just didnt feel like carrying them all around and switching back and forth.  (the Powershot also has better auto white balance then the SLR i used) for a pro you might want a more advanced camera but for the average user this is a wonderful camera to havethe only downside i saw is that sometimes apparently the battery cover may come off, but thankfully you just snap it back into place with no problem. Also battery life is a bit on the low side as if you are out on a trip or out and about for like a day and taking a lot of video and pictures the battery will not last all day , my suggetion would be to to get a spare battery from amazon and then have both so you are set!a 16 gig memory card will net you about 1 hour of HD video or about 6,000 photos (photos are only around 1 meg each ish so dont take up a ton of space which is nice)If this thing was out 6 years ago at the price it is now i would have gotten this instead of paying $2,000 for the camera and camcorder i got.  It really is a great little camera (it also does non-HD slow motion video which is a neat bonus too!)  the video quality is superb and picture quality is very good as well.a great camera expecally for around christmas.  Yeah most cell phones have cameras now days but most cell phone cameras are so so at best this wuold easily in my opinion beat any cell phone camera and the video expecally would beat any cell phone video (or even the iphone/ipad2 video)and this in my opinion also beats the flip video devices you can get. as this camera offers more steady shots (which in my opinion is absolutely essential with HD video the steadier the video the better it is)great product! Having it means theres no excuse not to capture great pictures or video!

Reviews.Title: Pictures in bright light are BAD
Reviews.Author: Silicon Valley
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for "AUTO" mode only. I am great fan of Canon and have several Digital camera/ Video cameras. I have used this camera over 3 months.When I take pictures in bright sun light in "AUTO" mode, the pictures are so bright, they look bad. I am not an expert but it seems that either it has over-exposure or higher ISO problem. I wouldn't recommend this camera.One odd thing to note is although pictures are not good but video quality is excellent in this camera which is surprising as it should have better picture quality than video!!My five year old cameras give better pictures than this. Don't buy this camera.

Reviews.Title: I'm sharing not-so-common notes about this camera.
Reviews.Author: Leo C
Reviews.Content: - I was debating between this camera and the sony cybershot wx9 for an average joe like me. Both are great options and besides price, nearly identical so you can't go wrong with either one. My decision to go with the 300HS came down to a few things that might help others choose a camera.- The sony wx9 captures 1080i AVCHD video @60fps which looks great...until I read that that file format is difficult to edit. I planned on making a lot of videos for youtube/facebook and didn't want to hassle with having tons of videos in a difficult file format to edit and share. To test this, I downloaded several AVCHD videos from torrents and sure enough, it took me a while to find a video player that would consistently play it smoothly without crashing. The canon 300HS uses .mov files which are easy to edit with just about any video editing software. This was the biggest deal breaker for me.- Although the canon 300HS's video quality is 24fps and not 60, for my non-professional use, I think it looks fantastic! I have recorded videos @ 1080i, uploaded them to youtube, and watched them through an internet connected TV at a best buy store that has 120hz or 240hz motion plus enabled and the video is EVEN BETTER! Smooth as butter! That made me realize I didn't need 60fps. Go to youtube and search for 'canon 300HS test video' and see for yourself. Then watch the same video on high end TV or monitor. You see? You don't REALLY need the extra FPS and bigger file size for your boring video :)- I was worried that limited maximum video length would be annoying, but honestly, I never record anything longer than 10 minutes. Moreover, stopping recording, and starting to record a new video takes 3 seconds. After buying the camera, missing 3 seconds is not a deal breaker as I once thought it would be.- About the camera and windows XP: My only gripe is that when I have the camera connected to XP, I can't browse the content of the memory card through 'My Computer'. I have to browse through it via the canon software. However, using the canon software is FASTER than through windows XP! If I have a folder with hundreds of pictures and hundreds of .mov files, the canon software FLIES while browsing it and it even shows thumbnails of videos. XP only shows a generic icon. Finding a video and switching between one video and the next is INSTANT in the canon software, but takes AGES thru XP! My PC is no slouch either.- About the canon software: I honestly had zero expectations. I thought it would be slow, bloated, sluggish, featureless, and painful to use, but I was actually impressed! I found it to have everything I needed to handle hundreds of pictures and videos, browse, sort, delete, rename, and have them ready to share with friends without pulling my hair out. In fact, the built-in option to upload straight to youtube was a nice surprise, because that's what I intended to do A LOT and made me glad I made this purchase. Sidenote, there is no option to upload to facebook or twitter with the canon software. I didn't read this in other reviews.- Here's my biggest retrospective point and lesson learned. I obsessed over which camera to buy based on specs and reviews and sample images and recordings. It got to the point where I was scared to buy ANYTHING. In the end, I realized, I just needed a simple point and shoot camera to take pictures of my friends and I hanging out and occasional video that only WE would care about. This camera met and exceeded my expectations. I am 100% satisfied with my purchase and I get compliments about my camera and my pictures all the time and I don't even try. The camera does all the work for me!- Canon sells a waterproof cover for this camera on their website. I have not tried or tested it. Canon does not make these housings for all their models. I did not read this is in other reviews.- I bought a $10 plastic shield for the LCD screen like the types you would put on an iPhone and used a blade to trim to size. Now I'm not afraid to put the camera down on the LCD side on rough surfaces like rocks or wooden picnic tables. I didn't think of this for a while when I first bought it, but glad I did before I incurred any damage to the screen. Did not read this in other reviews either lol.- You can edit your videos straight from the camera! Trim the begging, trim the end, or both, then save the slimmed down video as a NEW file straight to your camera, or overwrite the existing file! This is an AWESOME time saver when you are on the go! It frees up memory too! I use this ALL THE TIME and didn't think about looking for it as an option in a camera. I'm glad its there!- The automatic panoramic picture mode in Sony's camera is impressive and EASY to use. You just shoot and turn the camera and you're done. With the canon camera, you have to go through a confusing and complex set of steps that its faster and less stressful just to take sequential pictures yourself than to try and use the canon's menu system. I honestly couldn't figure out how to take panoramic pictures with this camera. It's very confusing, but I don't care. I never take panoramic pictures.- When I plug in my camera with an HDMI cable to my TV, I can use my TV remote to control the camera menu on my TV! I can browse, edit videos, and more sitting on my couch across the room! Did not read this in other reviews and an AWESOME way to share videos and pictures at your friend's house. I don't know if only certain TVs let you do this, but for what its worth, I have a Samsung LED TV from 2010. Way cool! Wish I figured this out sooner hehe!- Battery life: Kinda sucks if you take a lot of video (because you forget how many times you re-watch it and fail to take that into account). However, lots of my friends have canon cameras and they (not all) have the exact same battery so I often borrow theirs instead of buying a spare. Like asking around for a phone charger in a clutch. Whodathunk? Not me, until I realized tons of ppl have canon cameras. :)- I love the slow-mo capture mode! The quality is crappy but the effect is always fun! My friends always want to play with this! I wasn't expecting to use this as much as I do! Kind of an unexpected ROI!- Cliff notes: Excellent camera for daily use!! You and your friends will be impressed!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: T. Morris
Reviews.Content: This camera does what it is supposed to. It produces very good quality photos in a small, somewhat rugged package. The video quality and stability are great. The pictures I've taken all over Hawaii have come out fantastic. Settings are limited, but it's a point and shoot camera. I am very happy with mine.I don't like that most of those that knocked this camera start off by saying what other more expensive camera they have. It doesn't fine tune this or that the best, blah, blah, blah. If you're a photography snob or perfectionist then use your expensive camera and be done it.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed with the quality and user interface
Reviews.Author: A.N.
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Canon.  I have ventured out and bought Pentax and Fuji cameras, but in comparison, the Canons are always better.  Until now.  I bought this camera to replace my previous one that was going on the blink.  I don't blame canon for the longevity...I use and abuse my cameras, so I need to get a new one about once/year.  However, the 300HS is a disappointment.  I thought the "HS" technology would give me amazing picture quality...but I honestly don't see much of a difference.  They have also made a bunch of changes to the interface that make it more difficult to use.  They did stupid things like bury the erase function in the menus (rather than just being a physical button).  I feel the slow-motion video is probably the only differentiating feature with this camera, but the image size is so poor it's only for amusement.The only reason I gave this camera 3 stars rather than fewer, is that it's image quality is average and the slim shape with rounded corners slips into your pocket nicely.I bought mine for $299, and have now seen them for $229.

Reviews.Title: nice little camera with one MAJOR FLAW
Reviews.Author: milt
Reviews.Content: it has no dedicated delete button. sounds like a mere trifle until you want to delete bunches of selected images, and then you have to go through a menu>selection process with the obligatory confirms that total 6, count em, 6 clicks to delete one image.everything else is great.addendum. delete function found. no delete button however it is a"function" option. make that 3 clicks...much better

Reviews.Title: Incredibly powerful camera for video
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I shoot DSLR videos and have been looking for a nice compact B camera and someone mentioned this camera to me. I was leery at first but after doing some research on it it sounded like a nice one. I bought the black one because it has a little bit more grip to it whereas the others have a very smooth finish and it can get slippery if you have sweat or any moisture on your hands when shooting. This camera is very durable. While shooting low shots at the beach a wave went over the camera and besides getting wet poured sand all over it. I quickly took it out of the water, dried it off with my shirt and it was ready to keep shooting. The video quality it puts out  is wonderful and blends in great with my Panasonic GH2. I did a full video review on it and showed samples on my YouTube channel at [...]  Over all I love this little camera and find more and more uses for it. It would be the perfect B camera if it had a swivel and swing out screen like my DSLR does.

Reviews.Title: Good Cámara .
Reviews.Author: juan
Reviews.Content: The good: The Canon PowerShot Elph 300 HS is a fun-to-use ultracompact with excellent photo quality even if just left in auto.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera but deleting is really annoying
Reviews.Author: Sea Duck
Reviews.Content: It takes several steps to delete a photo. To me, that's a real pain in the neck.  Kept looking at the instructions and on-line thinking I had missed something, but no.

Reviews.Title: My Favorite Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Donga "ten miles out to sea"
Reviews.Content: I take photos daily and I like this point and shoot camera the best.For its slim, small size it packs a lot of fun effects, good quality photos and a handy instant button for videos (instead of wading through function options).You give up a little with only 5x zoom but the macro photos come out superb. I don't use night/flash settings much so I can't comment on that. For me its been a great camera to have clipped to my belt (in its case), it responds fast when turning it on, focusing and shooting, no annoying delays. Takes great wide angle scenic shots for its size, portrays nature scenes crisp and true to color.cons: sometimes video has trouble focusing, wish it had more zoom, little lens doors started to jam after 2 yrs (but keep in mind I use it every day over and over and its lasted a yr longer than any other pocket camera I've abused), hard to handle one handed because its so smallFavorite: Color Accent Function - pick a color to keep and it turns everything else black and white (See my photo of irises). Easy function navigation and great battery life.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: It's the same camera I bought the last time, and it functions amazingly.  My last camera was dropped, and I was devastated.  It is amazing at stabilization and providing a great picture every time.  I'm so glad they haven't changed it!

Reviews.Title: Good camara for the price
Reviews.Author: P. Zeller
Reviews.Content: We tend to utilize both a stand-alone camara and the camara in our cell phones in our picture taking habits. Since I am not a professional photographer and can not currently see dropping > $700 for a good SLR, I was in the market for a camara that would take better quality pictures than what you get with cell phone while not being overly complicated to use and being reasonably priced. This camara has fit that bill very well so far.Picture quality has proven excellent, a definitely step up from what you typically get with a cell phone. The camara does a good job managing lighting in AUTO mode and making simple mode changes has proven reasonably easy. This does bring me to one sticking point: the camara menu takes practice to get used to finding everything quickly. It is not as intuitive as it should be. However, it is still reasonable. The LED screen works fairly well. It can get overwhelmed a bit in heavy, direct sunlight. However, even then, it tends to do a better job than most any other portable electronic device I have owned with an LED screen. It would be nice if it had a seperate view finder for those circumstances. However, no one seems to be doing that in this price range anymore.Canon's image stabilization system in its recent camaras has proven very effective. We have had previous versions of Canon, Olympus, Kodak, Samsung, and Sony point-and-shoot camaras (yes, I have had some relability issues with some of these in the past, especially Olympus, Samsung, and Sony - not with this camara so far!), but this one provides us with consistently better, clearer shots. The camara works very well (for the price range) in low light, much better than any previous point-and-shoot I have owned. The camara out performs our smart phone picture quality as well, which is really the whole point of owning a seperate point-and-shoot.Batterly life has proven good for this camara as well; we seem to get between 250 - 400 pictures (many using the flash) before needing to switch battaries. I purchased two third party batteries and routinely swap them out so that battery life is not an issue. The third party batteries do not last quite as long, but still allow us to manage the camara very well.Finally, file transfer to a computer is very easy with the Canon software provided. Can move 1000+ pictures (purchased an 8 MB flash card when I bought the camara) to my PC in about a minute or less through the included USB cable.Bottom Line: great little camara for the price. Definitely step up from using cell phone camaras. Nice filler camara between the cell phone and a good SLR, especially for the price. Could use a better menu layout and a seperate view finder. However, you likely won't do better without paying 3x or more for a camara.

Reviews.Title: power and lens problems
Reviews.Author: Claire Bartos
Reviews.Content: It seems that this particular model has two major mechanical problems: the power might turn off in the middle of a session and the lens might not be properly retracted. Shame on Canon!

Reviews.Title: No wonder the newer model is cheaper
Reviews.Author: Canonicus "Canonicus"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera on all fronts.  Excellent results in low light (I mean EXCELLENT--this is the surprise with this little camera).  High quality HD movies.  Wonderful wide shots with the 24mm end.  Quality is stunning on a 42 inch display Neo-Plasma TV.  Build quality is solid and the LCD is bright and contrasty, even in bright daylight.  To sum it up--notice how the price is soaring as the newer version is dropping?  This is classic--ought to buy another as back up!Forget the S100 or S110.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, Compact, Great Photos
Reviews.Author: tbro4033
Reviews.Content: This is a great compact camera. Bought it for my father, who is about as good with gadgets as the Amish. I looked around (in stores) to find a digital camera that didn't have a million unnecessary options and buttons. This camera is very easy to use. It only took my dad about 2 uses to really figure out how to use it in the most basic form (turn it on, take pictures, change flash, view pictures, load pictures onto computer). He says it's by far the best camera he's ever owned (which includes previous digital cameras). According to Consumer Reports, this is one of the higher rated digital cameras. I've borrowed it a few times, so I can vouch for that. The pictures it takes are clear with great, true-to-life colors. I am not a photographer, but with this camera, I feel like I can take some pretty good pictures. It's very compact and fits quite easily into a pocket. The zoom is pretty powerful as well. Although it is easy to use, it's not lacking in features either, and can stand up against the feature set of more expensive cameras. I would definitely recommend this camera, especially if you're not a photo-buff and need something simple to use.

Reviews.Title: Just what she wanted
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my teenaged daughter a couple of months ago.  She has a DSLR and is becoming quite the accomplished photographer, but she wanted a new pocket camera to take with her on a daily basis that would replace the Canon power shot SC 1100 that she has used ubiquitously over the last 3 years.  This camera has met and surpassed all of her expectations, which is saying something.

Reviews.Title: mess up withing six months
Reviews.Author: Pamela Hamm
Reviews.Content: i really like the canera but with in six months the lens cover would open or shut completely. i am trying to find out if the warranty covers it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: Just loved it. The quality of this camera is great, it takes very nice photos, it is small and very portable, the manual mode is also very good (tough I must say that I'm an amateur photographer).I've saw some complaints regarding the battery life, but for me it is totally ok (I bought an spare battery just in case).The only con for me is the camera texture, didn't like it that much.

Reviews.Title: Nice & Small
Reviews.Author: Simmick
Reviews.Content: Quite a quick and small camera. Has many features which I haven't fully explored yet. Color balancing is another story though, as I'm getting tones and colors which quite differ from the true colors. I can tweak and get closer, but it's still not professional.Anyway, remember it's a small digital camera and does not compete to the heavier DSLR. I have an older Canon XT, and the speed or color rendering (even without tweaking) is not to compare to this ELPH 300. There is no shutter lag on the XT, while this ELPH 300 has a relatively short shutter lag when not using the flash, but with flash is a disaster.Overall, the camera is small, easy to carry around and still OK to handle, relatively fast, and I'm very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Seems like the perfect "every day, go-to" camera!
Reviews.Author: J. Sherlock
Reviews.Content: OK, I have been browsing digital camera options for months now. After comparing all of my research, I opted for this camera and model and I am glad I did. The picture quality is VERY good. I have not had a chance to capture video with this thing, but I am sure it will be good enough for my purposes. I am mainly using this camera to take pictures anyways, I've got an actual video camera for taking "serious" video. The menu and navigation seem to be pretty easy, as I was able to perform tons of different tasks quickly after reading through the instructions. Seriously read through the manual one time completely, it's only like 20 short pages and you will have a very good idea how to operate the camera's basic functions. If you are looking for an affordable digital camera that will not be obsolete in a few years, I'd recommend this camera for sure. It is ranked so highly everywhere for a very good reasons in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Daniel Hill
Reviews.Content: Great camera, Canon's updated interface makes settings easy to access and change.  Burst mode is cool.  Video quality is great for a point and shoot.  Though I just bought an HTC EVO LTE...and that makes this camera obsolete/duplicative.  A great camera for those who don't want to use a smartphone!

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: Had this camera about a month. As with all powershots, it takes great pictures and easy to use.  The black one has a bit of a rougher texture than my wife and I weren't expecting, but its really not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Great Pictures
Reviews.Author: Rocker Chick "Aquarius6"
Reviews.Content: Thank God for customer reviews.  I read for hours looking for the perfect hand held point and shoot camera, and came across this Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 Black Digital Camera.  Lots of good reviews on this camera from professionals who understand cameras.  I decided to go with this nice-looking Canon PowerShot in Black.I used it the first time at a concert and found it easy to program.  The pictures were great in low-light setting.  This camera is small and thin, and the outer casing has a semi-rough exterior (its really nice) that keeps it snug in your hand.  Im no professional when it comes to cameras, but I can tell you that this one is easy to use and works great.  ~Super Clear Pictures~Isn't that was we all want in a point and shoot camera anyway?

Reviews.Title: Loved it.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: After my last camera's lens broke my boyfriend bought me this camera as a replacement. Honestly, it took stunning pictures and loved all the options available. My big piece of advice would be to DEFINITELY use the wrist strap. At a party this camera was knocked out of my hand and fell to the ground (roughly a two foot fall). The lens system was jammed inward so it couldn't come out anymore and was unfixable. Ignoring that, I truly loved having this camera.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: J. MACIEJEWSKI
Reviews.Content: I bought mine yesterday from my local big box electronics retailer for $129 after many weeks of researching alternatives. For what it's worth, mine is made in China and thus far exhibits no evidence of the zoom motor noise that other reviewers have reported. Recording in a silent room the sound of the motor was nearly imperceptible throughout the optical zoom range.I will update this review as time goes on. For the time being I just wanted to add my own experience to the Made in Japan vs. Made in China debate.Given some of the reliability problems documented by reviewers (e.g., lens errors, LCDs going blank), I do plan on buying a Square Trade 2-year warranty; I consider it a fairly inexpensive insurance policy.June 20, 2012After a week of taking photos and videos I can offer some additional observations:* The camera is very small, which I love. It will fit into any pants pocket and you don't even know it's there. But with its small size comes the likelihood of inadvertently pressing the on/off button, which is not something you want to do when trying to stuff it into a case as I did at Best Buy when looking at a Lowepro Sorrento 10 case. The case was a snug fit and I mistakenly pressed the on button with the camera in the case and got a "lens error" which scared the daylights out of me. Bottom line: Small is good, way good, but be careful!* Some pieces of the camera seem cheaply made, like the battery door for instance. It's made from flimsy plastic. As one who appreciates engineering, I think that using plastic for this piece was unavoidable, but some people may be put off by how cheap the door feels and looks. The auto/program auto switch is another example. The switch wobbles a bit; but every camera I looked at in the store had a switch that did the same thing. Bottom line: It's not built like a Leica or a Breitling watch.* Regarding the texture: Calling the finish "like sandpaper" is, to me, an exaggeration. To anyone who is familiar with it, it feels smoother than 1000 grit wet/dry sandpaper. I like it myself. It helps make the camera feel good in the hand.* The photo and video quality are great for a point and shoot. In photos taken in my first week, the colors seemed nicely saturated and the white balance seemed largely on target, although most shots were taken outside. To take advantage of the camera's speed during continuous shooting, it seems you do need a class 10 45 mb/s SD card. I've been using a class 6 Transcend SD card and it seems to make the camera lag a bit during continuous shooting. Bottom line: It takes great photos and videos, but consider using a high speed SD card to optimize the camera's features. I plan on buying a new high speed card soon.More thoughts to come. After my first week with the camera, I'm thrilled with it. It takes great pictures, great video, is a pleasure to use and is an example of great industrial design. I'm coming from a Panasonic Lumix DMC-FZ35, which I sold to KEH, that was bothersome to lug around. This Elph 300 HS seems to take photos and videos that are as good if not better and is much, much easier to carry. Granted, it doesn't have the 18X zoom that the Lumix had, but the wide angle on this camera is remarkable and seems as though it will offer me some compositional choices not possible with the Lumix. Bottom line: This camera rocks.

Reviews.Title: Canon Elph 300 HS
Reviews.Author: HR
Reviews.Content: Bought at the time it was just coming out, and thinking I was upgrading from my Sony w290, and going to Canon, I had very high expectations. I remember the 'wow' factor was not there at first use.Now, over a year has passed and feel its a good camera. The performance in low light is very good and by far the best improvement I had over my last camera. But I see colors are a little more dull on this camera's photos than the ones my Sony produced (in daylight).The HD video looks great and you have the ability to zoom in/out. Overall this is a great camera and for the price now is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Poor low light photos
Reviews.Author: M. Eide
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for a SD600 6 megapixel canon elph that was 6 years old.  Taking photos outdoors and in good natural light were comparable to the old camera.  photos taken indoors when the sun was beaming through the windows were yellow in color and not nearly as vibrant as the old camera.  I tried experimenting with the settings for a little while then gave up because the "automatic" setting should work without having to read the manual (just like the old camera).  In my opinion canon missed the mark with this camera.  I've already returned it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: L R Shaw
Reviews.Content: This is the best camera I have ever owned - being an average photographer. It is easy to use, I can upload pictures from the camera to my computer with ease; it takes sharp, clean pictures, and is excellent for carrying in my small purse! The only issue would be re-charging the batteries - seems to charge down in a shorter time than I would prefer. I have only had the camera for approx 2 months and have already charged it twice and I don't use it everyday. Other than that, it is GREAT, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Light, small, amazing pictures.
Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: Me and my mom went on a trip to New Zealand and I wanted to make sure that I took a lot of pictures, and I sure did. This is a great camera, the picture quality was shocking, this thing can take some really beautiful shots. I have one set as my wallpaper on my 24 inch mac and the detail and the richness of the colors is very impressive for such a small camera( or any camera I have owned). I had it in my pocket the whole time, its smaller then my wallet so it's very portable. I was turning it on and off the constantly as photo opportunities kept coming up and never had a problem with the battery life ( we weren't able to charge it that much because of the electric inputs they used there and didn't have the right converter ). It also has alot of features and effects, a few of I used, they were kind of cool but I can't say they were a game changer, your basic stuff, the zoom never let me down on capturing the things I was unable to reach. Over all, if your looking for a compact light camera that will not fail you on quality this is your camera, and for the price it's a no brainer.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a casual camera user
Reviews.Author: E. Amez
Reviews.Content: I have owned two Canon digital cameras in the past, and they've both been good to me.  When I was using them in my college years, let's just say those late nights were not always easy on my cameras, but they both lasted and were quite durable.  This time around, however, when I decided to purchase a camera, I was looking for better image quality.  I'm now taking pictures of my best friends getting married and nieces and nephews as opposed to random nights in random places.  Admittedly, I don't have a particular knack for photography, but I have several friends who do, and seeing their photos made me want a camera that could capture quality images without my needing to be an expert, without me having to lug around a huge camera, and without it costing me an arm and a leg.  This one fit the bill.  I've had the camera for over six months now.  It seems to have the same Canon durability that I've grown accustomed to (I've dropped it onto concrete a time or two now).  The image quality in daylight and well-lit areas is wonderful.  I get compliments all the time on photos taken on sunny days.  In low light, this camera does better than any other camera I've owned before.  That's not to say the low light pictures are perfectly sharp, but they're much better than average.  I appreciate the size, quality of the images, and durability of this camera and it's a great option at this price point for a casual non-photographer.

Reviews.Title: Great Point-&-Shoot, like all PowerShot Elphs
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "trikeboss"
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  Produced great shot after great shot during a two week vacation.  Very slim and fits easily and unobtrusively in a pocket.Canon's DIGIC image processor does a fantastic job producing great pics.Hard to go wrong with Canon PowerShot Elphs.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: melinda
Reviews.Content: I was in need of replacing my point and shoot. I have been well-pleased with Canon products. This camera is a good value for the quality and price. I don't have much specific to review. I shoot a lot of photos with my Canon SLR, but I enjoy having a nice point and shoot to put in my purse to take quick photos. I use it a lot for the HD video too. The macro feature is nice too. On my old Canon, I would have to manually set it to the macro setting to get close-up shots, but this one does it automatically. I recommend :)

Reviews.Title: Great little pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Elkmeister "Inquiring Mind"
Reviews.Content: This camera is proving to be perfect for my needs.  Those needs are for a small, relatively inexpensive camera that I can take with me in the car on the bicycle, motorcycle, kayak- you get the idea.  I have a great Nikon DSLR and a drawer full  of lens but it is too ackward to pack everywhere not to mention the concerns of dunking two grand plus in camera and lens..  But this little camera is more than just portable, it takes some excellent shots.  It has about 200 test shots on it now of panoramas, wildlife and some semi macro shots.  I must admit my camera elitism is suffering as this little thing has taken amazing shots.  As with any of these small sensor and lens cameras it does suffer in the extremes of its capabilities like fast movement and low light.  Even in those conditions it is surprisingly sharp and certainly acceptable for the price.  One thing I always do with cameras is mess with the controls before I read the manual to see how intuitive they are.  This is the easiest to operate camera I can recall.  The controls and menus just make sense.  I would think even without much photography background you could master these quickly.  Latter reading the manual in detail I was pleasantly surprised to see a lack of overly sophisticated controls on a simple camera.  Just enough flexibility to let you use the camera to its limits.I don't take many flash shots or use the video feature other than to test them out.  Both seemed very good but again that is not my area of expertise.Minor thing of note.  This camera is not small it is tiny.  If you have large fingers the controls can be a little tough to avoid hitting multiple controls at once but no big deal.Additional plus-  my black one has a textured, rough finish.  I love this.  Much easier to grip and none of that hockey puck problem on slick services.In summary- for the $149 I paid this is a great second camera, outdoor camera or even a first camera if you don't have extreme demands.

Reviews.Title: Auto focus? No focus!
Reviews.Author: Irene
Reviews.Content: Pros:  This camera performs better than my Panasonic ZS5 in low light indoor conditions, but that's where it's benefits end.Cons:  Lots of blurry and not sharp pictures in normal light situations  - where you would think camera should perform "great".  Also, it's auto focus is the worst: you might want to take a picture of a walking person or moving object, but it will focus on a fence, you will want to take a picture of a building - but it will focus on a branch of a nearby tree. You can tweak the settings, force infinity mode - but nonetheless, after my smart Panny the performance is extremely frustrating (keep in mind that they are selling for almost the same price nowadays).  Macro shots - look decent, but the ones coming out of Panny still have more details and are more sharp.I also feel that there is a lack of scene settings: they have added some "extra" modes - like miniature effect and fisheye - but i really think it's pure BS - wish they have concentrated on features that are truly usable.After playing with this cam and comparing pictures to my old one, i'm returning this one - dont want to wait until it becomes totally unusable.

Reviews.Title: Compact, Clear pictures, nice video, good manual functions
Reviews.Author: Sgrigs
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera so i could have something to carry in my pocket on hikes and skateboarding and just whenever.  The quality of the picture is really good for a compact camera and the HD video is very clear.  The camera has a good amount of manual functions which I like to play with but also the auto does a good job of creating a quality image.  I also like the grippy texture on the outside, it makes it easier to handle.  I haven't owned it for long so I can't say anything about the durability but definitely a nice camera. I initially had issues with the video not saving right, so make sure you have an SD card class 6 or higher for the HD video and that you format the card (settings then format on camera).  The only downfall is the very wild angle lens.  I like the wide andle for some shots but sometimes it makes close up images a little weird (people have big heads and little feet)  This is not usually a problem and can provide cool effects and widen the shot which is good for indoors.  However, if your shooting outdoors i feel it limits some shots, for the most part you can solve this problem by zooming in a little.overall great camera for the value

Reviews.Title: Not so much a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: OK I know everyone has their own opinion but i will give you mine anyways. This is a great little camera to use everywhere. I have tried the auto setting and did not care for it so I use the program setting most of the time. I set the colors the way I like it along with the sharpness and contrast. I also change the ISO when needed(sometimes the camera chooses ISO higher than I would like) and have tried all the other settings with wonderful success. I just came back from Mexico and all my pictures were very good.Sometimes the picture The picture come out great if you use the camera correctly and know how to use the settings.The battery life is pretty good with almost lasting a full day of shooting and with changing a few things within the camera, it is also quick to take a picture. Overall this has been a kick-*** camera. Oh and the video is great also. So far no lens error but I also baby it. I purchased the canon case and it has been the perfect match. Having it on my belt and it being so small you along everyone else does'nt even know it is there. For the price unbelievable. Good luck and so far so good!!!

Reviews.Title: Got it for $139
Reviews.Author: voltron512
Reviews.Content: Just an FYI, but if you act quickly Walmart is selling these cameras on a "rollback" promotion for $139.00. You have to actually call the store for availible stock, but I was able to get 3 yesterday,3-4-2012. Worth checking out if you're still in the market. I purchased it because I found that I was being lazy about carrying my Nikon DSLR.
