Now only if I would ever transfer the pics from my SD card, I've got a year worth of photos and vids on 5 various cards. Just pitiful!!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the normal individual
Reviews.Author: j novs
Reviews.Content: When I began my search for a digital camera I wanted something that could fit in my pocket and take great video. This camera is ultra compact and stylish. The 1080p video is fantastic and great for those who want to take videos good videos and not have to lug around a video camera. The pictures are very good and would probably surprise you. Good camera for those of us who aren't obsessive over the minute details but still want high quality.

Reviews.Title: I couldnt ask for more.
Reviews.Author: Nilsybear
Reviews.Content: My family has been big in photography for as long as i can remember. MY mom owns a Canon EOS-1Ds Mark III and between her and i using it, we have filled up almost 50gigs of just pictures on my computer. The only problem is it is big and heavy, and we need a backpack just to carry it and its lenses around. That's exactly why i wanted just a simple point and shoot that i could take anywhere with me, so i went ahead and bought this camera, and here's what it's about.This camera does EXACTLY what i want it to do and what it should do. I didn't buy this camera for the purpose of the best shots possible, at a relatively low cost, and in a small camera that I can take anywhere with me. For the purpose of my review, I'll be relating the quality of this camera to what you payed for it, not to the Quality of the EOS-1Ds Mark III. That being said, i couldn't ask for more out of this. This camera has plenty of features, takes great pictures, especially at low light, takes good quality video, and is really fun to mess around with the high speed video mode. Although the high speed may not be the best quality, and requires a good amount of light, it is fun and interesting to use. Anyways, im not going to get into the technical stuff with this camera, but i will say that it has gone beyond my expectations. I didn't really research many cameras before i bought this one, i just went to a camera store and asked them to hook me up with a decent point and shoot, and this is what i got, and man can i say I am so happy that this was the camera that they gave me.To address some issues about this camera that other people had, the black paint is textured... SLIGHTLY. Its not bad and is never irritating to touch. At least for me, i like the feel of the paint. And as for the sound in the high speed video mode, you dont need sound. When was the  last time you saw an extremely slow motion recording with the sound? and if there was sound, there's some really high tech stuff that has to go into that.And for the only con that i can find about this camera... would be battery life?? its not that bad, but iv had other cameras that last longer. And the only other bad thing about this camera is that i just dont find myself taking my EOS-1Ds Mark III anywhere because this camera is so simple, and so great.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for vacation
Reviews.Author: William Cunningham "Reggie"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera so that I wouldn't have to lug my Canon Powershot SX100 around.  I love the SX100 because it takes incredibly good pictures and video.  However, it is a big camera and I have to carry it in a camera bag around my shoulder.  I finally decided to get something that was small, inexpensive, and could take really good pictures and video.  The ELPH 300 was highly recommended by a camera buff who I worked with.  Another thing I really liked about the camera is that the battery lasts a long time.  I have only charged it once and have used it several times taking video and pictures.  My powershot SX100 eats the like out of the batteries rather quickly (though I do think something is awry with it and may need repairs--I dropped it once).  The Powershot ELPH 300 has a long battery life relatively speaking.I am glad that I purchased this camera.  It takes great pictures and videos.  It is small and I just stick it in my pocket.  It has simple controls too.  If you want a simple and inexpensive camera that takes very good pictures and good video then this is a sure thing.

Reviews.Title: Small but mighty
Reviews.Author: Suzanne
Reviews.Content: I wanted a small lightweight camera that I could easily take with me, but I was concerned that the controls would be hard to maneuver.  This camera is easy to use.  The controls feel good in my hand.  I am impressed with the pictures taken in a large  classroom setting as they show details of the room yet still a clear picture of a person a long way off.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: karen c "kmchild"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!  It takes such great pics and has alot of scene modes and fun things to play with on it.  Picture quality is great too!  My husband is a professional photographer and he thinks this takes good pictures too.  This camera is perfect for me to carry around and get snapshots of my kids.  For a compact camera, this is a great buy!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Floridagal
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site were helpful to me in choosing the Canon PowerShot Elph 300 to replace my old camera. So far, I'm very impressed. I use it a lot for business under not always ideal conditions. The picture and video quality even in low light is great. I ordered a couple of cheap replacement batteries so I always have a back up. It's tiny but powerful. I haven't explored all the bells and whistles yet but I didn't really need the manual to get started using it. The controls are pretty intuitive if you've had a digital camera before.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point N' Shoot! ( Elph 300HS, Black)
Reviews.Author: Marc Jordan "Marky Da'  Saint"
Reviews.Content: I really can't say very many  more positive things about this amazing camera that have not been said already. It takes amazingly vivid and detailed pictures outdoors, low light, and even no light! Test it out in a completely darkened room, and you will be shocked at the resulting image. I purchased the black model, and I have to say that the people who describe the finish as being like sandpaper are exagerating a bit. Most big box stores carry this model now, so you can finger it yourself before you buy it there or here on Amazon. I think it adds a solid grip to this camera and makes it a little more rugged looking and feeling. As of this month,Jan. 2012, The Canon Elph 110HS is now out, with all the features of this Canon Elph 300HS and more, so on paper, The Elph 110 is a better camera, as it has Digic 5 sensors and this one has Digic 4, It is 16.1 Megpxl.s and this has 12.1 and unlike it's predesesor, The Elph 100, can zoom while in 1080p video. Oh, and it's $20 dollars cheaper! Amazon has it, but you will have to directly type it into the search. Bigger LCD screen, as well. I would also point you to Youtube, as there are many video reviews of The Elph 300HS and 310HS posted there. The 310HS is essentially very simmilar to The 300HS, but has a larger LCD, and 8X's zoom and The 300HS only has 5X's zoom but utillizes it well and does pretty good a little beyond optical zoom, but this time there is a $55 dollar increase with The 310HS. As I said, The Powershot Elph110 is a better camera on paper, but it is so new, there are not any reviews on it yet, so I would still stick with The 300 HS or 310 HS or even The SX230... if a little more size isn't an issue, because it has 14X's zoom and that's finaminal. My girlfriend has The SX230HS and it takes SLR quality shots, almost. Each 1x increment in zoom is a huge improvement in flexabillity and quality. More megapixles really dosn't mean much, most times. I hope I haven't overwhelmed you guys, but just stick with The Canon HS models and you won't go wrong! Update: Purchased some cool goodies last week for this camera. They include: The Case Logic TBC-302 case, The Pedco Ultrapod tripod, The Amazon Basic A to C Type HDMI Cable("Mini" to HDMI), and a $5.00 twin pack of spare batteries from Eforcity, and a 16gb Class 10 SD Card. I will review these items to, as I use them.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: ~joy~
Reviews.Content: I bought this one ($150 at Fred Meyer) after returning a Nikon S9100 (which was horrendously disappointing).  The gal at the counter suggested the Canon, she was preferential as that was a brand she used routinely.  She was great enough to demo the model on display, and it has amazing capabilities.  The traditional zoom is wonderful (see the pictures I've included of the living room versus the read door), and the macro zoom is impressive as well (see all the other pictures I posted).  I'm not a professional photographer, I was just looking for something to replace my older, bulky digital camera, and this thing is a joy to use.  It's slim when not in use, and takes exactly the type of pictures I want.  The video feature is nice, easy to use, though the microphone on it isn't great.  Keep that in mind; if you're planning on taking lots of video, it's heard to hear people if they're speaking in a normal voice when they're more than 4 feet away.  It isn't a problem for me, as that wasn't my primary purpose, but I can see the advantages in having it as a feature.  Might look into whether there is an exterior microphone option if we use it more in the future.  Take a look at the sample photos.  Again, I'm not a pro., and those were taken right after taking the camera out of the box, no instructions/manual used.  I highly recommend this camera- seems to be a great value.

Reviews.Title: Met all my expectations
Reviews.Author: Cloud
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera new about 10 months ago (in 2011)...This is the best ultar-compact digital camera I have owned, and it has met all my expectations.- Ultra compact- Great picture quality- Easy connection to PC and TV (includes HDMI connection)- Takes great video- My favorit feature is the "Burst" mode with rapid shots

Reviews.Title: Easy to use!  great little point 'n' shoot!
Reviews.Author: Dante "Pi or Tau?!"
Reviews.Content: This camera is super stylish and easy to use.  You literally open the box, put the battery in, and start shooting amazing pictures that are vibrant and clear!  The camera is thin so it fits in your pocket or purse - I like putting on the strap right away so that i don't accidentally drop it.I've had great success with Canons and I haven't had any reason to switch!  If you're on the fence, you don't have to worry about getting a poor quality product!

Reviews.Title: First Digital Camera and I love it!
Reviews.Author: dukeacem
Reviews.Content: At 27 years old, I finally bought a camera to film for my youtube series.  Everything about it works well including the microphone, the zoom, the video recording (full HD), and the battery life.  The only feature I do not like is the video limit being 10 minutes.  After 10 minutes, you have to stop recording and start a new video.  However, for the price and the quality, this is an excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Good little camera, lots of features
Reviews.Author: C
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a Christmas gift and really enjoy the range of features it has. I don't expect anything near perfect from a compact camera (that's what my dSLR and arsenal of lenses is for), but this camera takes pretty good pictures and is quite fun to play with. I find the menu to be fairly intuitive (I never even opened the instruction book). I received the red version of the camera, which I wasn't crazy about at first, but guess what I haven't misplaced  yet! It is also very light and compact, which offers a bit of a catch-22: it's easy to carry around anywhere, but I'm constantly afraid I'm going to drop it if I don't have the wrist strap on simply because there's no curve or girth to hold on to.The only two things that drive me somewhat nuts about this camera:1) The flash is located right above the lens, which creates a shadow in almost any picture you take up-close while using the flash. Also, as a lefty I normally have my left index finger on top of the camera to steady it; however, the flash is so close to the top of the camera that my finger sometimes cuts off part of the flash - and I have tiny fingers!2) There's no view-finder (although I've found this to be a problem with most recently made compacts). Personally, I don't always like holding my camera more than a foot away from my face and looking at an lcd screen. Sometime's it's nice to put my eye up to a camera to take a picture. Plus, this means I can't turn off the lcd screen to conserve battery life.Overall, I am satisfied with this camera and do recommend it for the average to moderately advanced camera user.

Reviews.Title: Great Gift
Reviews.Author: PTP
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my teenage grandson.  Arrived quickly.  He loves it!  Small size (fits in his shirt pocket) and it takes great video.  Very good clarity - hard to look at my grandma face!  He wanted it to take videos for Youtube and he's happy with the gift of course, he picked it out. Price was good for me.

Reviews.Title: amazing value
Reviews.Author: Lynn E. Mccarthy "Forestville Girl"
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect small but high quality camera.  I used it in low light for some holiday photos that came out great and then used it outside for scenic shots and low light sunsets.  All came out great.  Very easy to use.  Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: The Canon HS300 is a great little camera. It's very slim and compact and can easily be carried in one's pocket. Canon can't be beat for the quality of it's sensors. The image quality is very very good. This camera also produces great video output.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kwaid
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon Powershot ELPH 300 HS about 2 weeks ago and have been using it nonstop. I've been using it all the time, and still have not had to recharge the battery. So the battery life seems pretty great to me. Also I like the fact that there is a tab type thing where the battery goes, so when you open the cover, the battery will not fall out. Which is pretty ingenious considering breaking the battery would be a big deal, since it has its own special battery. Not AA's or anything standard like that. I got the black color, since it was on sale at the time, and it has a kind of texture on the back of the camera, so holding onto it isn't a problem at all.Bottom Line: I would recommend this camera to anyone who likes to take pictures of family and friends. It does great in low-light. And the pictures come out AMAZINGLY clear. The 12 megapixel isn't as many as some cameras, but I think it is plenty for this camera. It seems to be able to take in enough light to make the pictures clear, without needing the extra 2-4 megapixels (I hate flash with a passion and use it only when i absolutely have to).

Reviews.Title: Absolutely the BEST. Will never buy anything but Elph again.
Reviews.Author: Edmund W. Cheung
Reviews.Content: I have always had the Canon Elph series of point and shoot cameras since it was on the strange APS film Format.  Must have gone through 5 different Elph formats.  They have ALWAYS been excellent - easy to use - compact - great quality cameras.  I will NEVER switch brands again.  This 300HS is absolutely the best.  Just buy it and enjoy with NO regrets or worries.However, Last year I veered off course and bought a Nikon s8100 Camera with 10x Optical zoom lens.  BIG MISTAKE.  Do not get me wrong, the photos and video were good from the Nikon, but the interface and usability was AWFUL.  I just could not get used to the camera and my wife absolutely HATED it.  I read through the Nikon manual over 6 times and I still can not get the hang of the camera (I consider my self a Techie and very savvy with mechanical or electronic things.)  Also the Flash on the Nikon was just too much so all the photos were almost always washed out.  This Nikon was twice the price and takes lower quality photos compared to this 300hs Elph.Just had to switch.  So I just purchased this Canon Elph 300HS and took 60 photos and 10 mini videos today.  WOW. What a MARVELOUS improvement.  I did not even read the manual and just used the camera.  All the buttons and controls are laid out nicely and easy to use and intuitive.  I especially love the small switch from auto to manual in the top right corner.  Absolute genius whoever thought of this = no more silly dials or obscure minuscule figures to figure out.The photos came out perfectly balanced both indoors and especially outside.  What is especially GREAT is that the lower light photos used to come out "grainy" with this HS sensor = WONDERFUL detail with MINIMAL to NO graininess.Videos in .MOV formal are sharper and clearer than my 3 year old HD video camera.  The only slight negative comment is that the microphone is very sensitive and picks up wind rubbing noises easily.  Very small compact and easy to pocket camera.  100x better than my iPhone 4s for both photos and video. GIven how portable this camera is, I am going to carry it around everywhere from now on.Just go for it.  You can NOT beat the price for quality and functions for this camera.  ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT!!!

Reviews.Title: Canon camera is easy to use.
Reviews.Author: boomer
Reviews.Content: While browsing in stores trying to select the perfect camera for myself, a professional photographer was also looking for a camera for herself.  She explained she just wanted a camera for everyday use and not one that would require her to change lenses for different pictures.  I told her I wanted a good camera with quality pictures, but needed a "camera for dummies", since I have difficuties figuring things out!  She said this camera was one of the best I could buy--easy to use and great pictures.  Then another person said order it from Amazon and get it at a more reasonable price.  I did, and I am most satisified.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300HS
Reviews.Author: Dirk
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Shoots high quality resolution photos considering size (easily fits in shirt pocket).Some shots can be difficult in lighting requiring flash but this is expected with this size of camera.Video capabilty impressive also for size.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: joyjoy
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! The picture quality is outstanding! I also love how compact the camera is. I carry it with me everyday in my purse so that I can capture any unique moment.

Reviews.Title: What I was looking for...
Reviews.Author: fgsj
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera for my mom as a Christmas present. She's happy with it. It's a very simple camera, has all the functions she need (it does everything automatically). I just recommend this kind of camera for those people who just want to take pictures as simple as they are.

Reviews.Title: I prefer this then my 600 dollar Canon
Reviews.Author: R. sandoval "tvlookplay"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my girlfriend for her birthday 2 months ago, i tend to use it a LOT more then her because this little camera is more then amazing! Although i personally haven't tried all the features this camera has but the Auto and the HD work wonders! My GF did try them out and she liked them all. I dont know much about battery life on point and shoot cameras, but i was shootin hd videos all day and it lasted so im pleased with that.The only problem i have with the camera is that when i take a picture i have to wait a few seconds before i can take the next one.Other then that i recomend this camera to anyone! its so small, and its capabilities are great!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Mcchesney
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my father. He was able to start using it immediately and really likes it. Nice camera, not very expensive and fits in a shirt pocket. I'm very happy with my choice of a gift..

Reviews.Title: Pure Awesomeness
Reviews.Author: SockaJamma
Reviews.Content: I have a great super zoom bridge camera and sometimes I just don't want to carry it around with me because of the bulk factor.  So, I was shopping around for something I can stick into my pocket, but I also wanted performance.  I bought this at a higher price than what it is now, and all I can say is that it does not disappoint!  I took it to San Francisco while visiting my mom in the bay area, and took fantastic pictures outdoors and indoors with the upgraded CMOS sensor.  I don't think I'll be going back to CCD because of the pure speed CMOS offers.  Digic 4 produces the colors very well!  24mm wide angle helps a great deal in certain situations because there was one huge church and if I didn't have that I wouldn't have gotten all of it!  It records great video on a touch of the dedicated button, just make sure your SDHC card is fast enough.  Go for the silver or red one because the black one has a rough texture on it and it can scuff, while the others have smooth metallic finishes which make the camera look and feel better.  For me, the only con if you can call it that is the LCD screen resolution.  My bridge camera has 921K, and I would have liked at least 461k.  But, I wouldn't take a star away for that since everybody looks at their pictures on the computer anyway.

Reviews.Title: Brilliant little camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Got this about 3 weeks back & absolutely love it.Low light on this is amazing for a p & s.Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Great Little Point & Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Workin' Mom
Reviews.Content: This camera takes great pictures, is so handy to carry and I love the quality of finished pictures.  There are so many menu options I highly recommend taking the time to read and learn about what it can do.  If that's not your style, the auto mode works very well.  I carry it in my purse so I have it everywhere.  It does use the SDHC card which seems to  be the new normal with the higher resolution cameras.  Battery lasts very long between charges. I totally recommend this camera for novices or intermediate photographers that want something easy to carry around.  Takes much better pictures than most smart phones.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Elph
Reviews.Author: Rita C Masanz
Reviews.Content: The camera is very nice. I was impressed with the low light photo quality and other features like the 5x optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised.
Reviews.Author: J. Durand
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for work so top specs were not a major consideration but it needed to be decent. However after using for a little while and looking at the pictures on screen at 100%, I must say that this is a surprisingly good camera. The camera is very small and portable and the fantastic rough texture of the black paint makes it very easy to hold on to.  The camera is also made out of metal and is very sturdy. There is no noticeable flex or deflection on any surface even if pressed or gripped strongly.  The lens barrel and surround also appear to be metal and look like top quality parts.  Overall I was really surprised at how "quality" the camera appeared and felt in terms of construction at this price point. Especially when you compare it to comparable PS cameras in the same price range that are made mostly out of plastic.The menu system is easy to use but it does have the new "rolling" menu interface. I prefer the old Canon menu style but this one is easy to get used to after a while. I use the camera mainly on Program and not on Auto. The auto function seems fine but it is constantly "searching" for the right setting and updating its choices on screen. I found it to be "busy" and slow down the camera.  I will only use it on Program mode.  It has a lot of the usual Canon camera settings including the popular "miniature setting".  Picture quality, considering the size of the sensor, is also surprisingly good. I compared pictures from this camera to the same pictures taken by a Panasonic LX5, which has a larger sensor and brighter lens, and unless you are pixel peeping and looking at things very critically, the pictures taken by this Canon can hold their own.  Sure the Canon has to go to higher ISO settings due to its slower lens (not F2.0) and the pictures are not as tack sharp and color saturated as the Panasonic but noise is extremely well controlled for a camera in this price range. Color noise was particularly well controlled and, although some may disagree with me, at times better controlled than the LX5. Also color is typical Canon, in its rendering, which in some cases was better than the Panasonic.So if you consider that this camera is now around $150 and less than half the cost of the LX5 (remember the LX5 was originally close to $500 at one point) and a heck of a lot more portable, it is a very good performer and in my opinion one of the best camera values I have seen. Other reviewers have opined that unless you need the manual controls of the Canon S95 that this Elph would be all that one would need.  I do not have the S95 so I can't back that statement up personally but based on what I have seen so far I can see why they would say that.  The flash is small and typical of an ultra compact so I would not expect it to be a top performer but the camera does well without a flash so it's not that big of a problem. I have not used it for video and will probably not often so this is not a consideration for me.

Reviews.Title: Very Small and Very Good
Reviews.Author: Travinsky
Reviews.Content: Amazon had a sale and I could not resist getting this camera. My previous pocket camera was a Canon A540 and I loved it for several years until I dropped it and it did not recover from the trauma. There isn't much I can add to what all others have said before me. So after owning dozens of cameras since the 1970s ranging from Minolta SLR film, then a few dSLR models, Bridge and a myriad of pocket cameras...I have enjoyed the Canon brand best. Everything is simple, intuitive, and my photos are very good (8.5/10). Not perfect, but still very good.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Camera
Reviews.Author: Jesus Reyes "Jesus Reyes"
Reviews.Content: excelent product, i use it for my every day photos family and bussiness, is fast excelent quality even in low light moments.

Reviews.Title: amazing little camera!
Reviews.Author: amy cameron
Reviews.Content: this camera is amazing!! we have had so much fun exploring it and seeing all the things it can do.  i would recommend it to anyone- it is easy to use and takes great pics and videos.

Reviews.Title: Superb point and click camera
Reviews.Author: Darvell R. Harrison
Reviews.Content: I have owned many cameras over the years,  and this is by far one of the best quick shooters ever.  I have never really been a fan of using a camera in auto mode as I always feel the need to tinker with the settings to get the right shot, the right lens speed, exposure, etc.  But this truly is the first camera that i have owned that I flick the switch to auto and am perfectly satisfied with the output.  The biggest down side for me is when you are shooting video the zoom is agonizingly slow so if your subject starts to move after you have zoomed in for a shot its best to just stop filming otherwise you will get a good 10 seconds of background while you try to zoom out and find it again.  I take lots of pics of my dogs and while the single click shutter speed isnt mind blowing there is a pets setting that in combination with the burst mode makes my work SO much easier.I originally got this camera for my wife, but the last few times I didnt really feel like dragging out the rebel and all the glass so I grabbed this instead!

Reviews.Title: Fits in your pocket
Reviews.Author: Bonnie N
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for camera that will fit in your pocket or small purse. This is the camera to buy. Very good picture quality. Tons of features. No more carrying around the bulky camera. This camera is 24/7.......

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Sam Comer
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a few days before a trip to wine country in California. I normally would use my DSLR for such trips, but I wanted something more pocketable. This camera really impressed me with the quality of still and video. Got some amazing shots of the Golden Gate Bridge covered in fog. The panorama stitch feature came in very handy for that one. The lens is sharp, the color is fantastic, and the features are abundant. My only complaint is that the menu system is a little convoluted, making it difficult to change settings from one to another. I'd give it a half star off for that. Since I can't rate half stars, I'll still give it a 5.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: KELLY LYNNE Overstreet
Reviews.Content: i GOT THIS CAMERA AS AN EARLY CHRISTMAS GIFT AND HAVE HAD IT FOR ABOUT THREE WEEKS NOW AND I LOVE IT! I STILL DISCOVER THINGS ON IT I DIDNT KNOW IT DID. THE DIFFERENT SHOOT STYLES IT HAS UNDER THE PROGRAM SELECTION ARE GREAT. YOU CAN TAKE ALL SORTS OF PICTURES, WE ARE USING ALL THE DIFFERENT STYLES TO MAKE UNIQUE PHOTOS AND GIVING THEM OUT FOR CHRISTMAS GIFTS TO THE PARENTS AND GRANDPARENTS! IT IS LIGHT WEIGHT AND EASY TO CARRY AROUND EVEN IF U ARE HOLDING A SMALL CLUTCH BAG (FOR THE LADIES). I RECOMEND THIS PRODUCT AND IT IS SO MUCH CHEAPER ON AMAZON THEN IN THE STORES.

Reviews.Title: Nice Piece of Work
Reviews.Author: mg 4 zp
Reviews.Content: Purchased in the US for travel as I have grown fed up with poor performance of phone cameras, despite their portability.The small size but big screen make this a pocketable camera, but one that is at the same time easy to use, good screen size and menu design allow for a quick selection of the most important features.  So it's already seeing lots of use. A big range of features and modes is there instructions in the CD instruction manual for those who wish to explore the more esoteric modes, but you will soon settle down on a handful of modes that fit your choice of photography.The metal case gives the camera a little heft which helps steady the camera for low light / night time shots more compared to a plastic-only model.  Of course a tripod screw is on the underside, so timer shots, night photography at high resolution are possible.The 3MB burst mode is great for photography at parties or for candids as the kids play; you just need the discipline to ditch those pictures that actually aren't any good, and the pictures are a decent resolution.  Optical zoom is also flexible and quick; AF performance is quick and markers on screen show what the camera has focussed on to avoid those out of focus foregrounds discovered later in picasa.The higher resolution modes give great quality and allow close cropping without the images appearing pixcelated at decent size, or decent looking enlargements that aren't embarrassing when you get them back.All in all, a well specced truly compact camera with a quality feel and good ergonomics.

Reviews.Title: Silver over Black for the ELPH 300 HS
Reviews.Author: paul
Reviews.Content: I, too, have a black Canon Elph 300HS (for 8 months) and now a new silver Elph 300HS. I found, as did others, that the movable cover over the lens for the black did get easily dented, such that it would not completely close.  A bit of mashing now allows it to close completely. In general, both take great photos, and I am pleased with their performance.Do note that the black camera is made in China, the silver in Japan.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Kenneth A. Schild "OldHRhiitter"
Reviews.Content: I usually shoot a Canon 5D Mark II so these images are soft and a bit noisier compared to my SLR. It is a nice and small point and shoot which is easy to use, takes excellent photos (up to 8x10) and is excellent in good light and pretty good in low light.

Reviews.Title: My good purchase
Reviews.Author: Kristin
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with my new Canon PowerShot camera.  It's very easy to operate and I find the pictures sharp and the colours excellent. The camera is small and light and can easily be kept in my handbag.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Camera Lady
Reviews.Content: Several months ago, I found myself looking for a new "point & shoot" and decided upon a Nikon Coolpix 3000 since I think so highly of my Nikon D40 SLR. What a mistake. The Coolpix 3000 was extremely slow and all of my pictures were blurry. After doing more research and reading many reviews, I ordered the Canon PowerShot ELPH 300. The response time runs circles around the Coolpix and the the photos are very sharp and have nice color. It's compact, yet easy to handle. You will not be disappointed with the quality of the photos.

Reviews.Title: Yes, it has panorama assist! But mine was a lemon.
Reviews.Author: A. Shuler
Reviews.Content: First, I bought this camera as a compromise knowing it was limited but it was the best for my applications.  The ELPH 310 HS came out and it regressed to a 28mm lens.  No good.  So...Pros:1) It has the super wide angle 24mm lens.  I could care less what the "1 Billion X" zoom is on a camera.  You can almost always move closer to a subject.  Indoors, you can rarely move farther away.2) Great video modes.  I don't need 1080P, but I do like 720P and I really love the high speed 240FPS option.  I can take really neat videos when I want them.3) It does have PANORAMA ASSIST.  I looked through spec after spec and ended up seeing a you tube video that showed the panarama stitch assist mode.  It made me happy.4) Decent low light capabilities.Cons:1) I had to return it because it had a defective AF system.  The camera was constantly hunting during AF.  It would go in and out for about 5-10 seconds and then stop usually out of focus.  I thought this might be a "feature" (something I'd have to live with), but I stopped by the local big-box store and their camera performed just fine.2) The buttons on the back of the camera were NOT tactile.  You had to actually LOOK at the buttons to see what you were hitting.  Of course, I use the camera indoors and in low light and I was CONSTANTLY fighting with the buttons."Features" (items that may annoy you, but aren't really bad or good):1) Sandpaper finish.  Yeah, it's very rough.  It makes the camera easy to grip, but it just doesnt' feel right to me.  I would prefer a matte finsh and a wrist strap.2) Microphone location is on the TOP of the camera which makes it easy to cover with your left hand.  If you shoot one handed or on a tripod, I guess it would be okay.3) Wind noise was HORRENDOUS outside.  This is common in these tiny cameras, but you would think somebody would have figured out a better way.This camera (not the broken one I got but a functional one) would be GREAT for indoor blogging, family pictures, etc.  I can't use it for what I bought it for, though.  Now that my money is back from this, I've ordered a Sony DSC-WX10 Cyber-Shot 16.1 MP Exmor R CMOS Digital Still Camera with 7x Wide-Angle Optical Zoom G Lens, 3D Sweep Panorama, and Full HD 1080/60i Video (Black).  The Sony has a few features that I like like the ability to use SDXC cards now (not just Memory Schtick), in-camera panorama stitch, Hand-Held Twilight, and good low-light functionality.  For that, I trade the high-speed mode and better (IMHO) optics of the Canon, and about $50.  Hope it will work out for me.

Reviews.Title: My 2nd Canon camera
Reviews.Author: xtremeguide
Reviews.Content: We took this new purchase on our vacation hoping it wasn't going to let us down in any way. It worked out perfectly. We had no problems and enjoyed all the pictures we took. It produced good pics both in day and night.We purchased this camera on Amazon.com at a good price and it was delivered to us very fast. We totally love Amazon.com

Reviews.Title: An outstanding little camera!!!
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a replacement for a Sealife Mini II underwater camera I had returned. I did my homework and researched different models, read all the reviews and decided on the 300 HS. I haven't been disappointed. This camera takes beautiful photos and high definition video and is packed with all the same features I have on my higher priced Canon Powershot SX130IS. I also bought the optional WP-DC41 underwater housing for the 300 HS and tried it out on a recent dive trip to Roatan. Over the course of a week and about 14 dives, the camera performed flawlessly. And the photo and video quality remained outstanding, even at depths reaching 120 feet!I highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Katie L
Reviews.Content: Pros: I love taking pictures with this camera. The quality is really great. It is very compact.Cons: the color gets scratched off easily, camera needs a few seconds before you can take another picture.

Reviews.Title: Almost awesome
Reviews.Author: larz
Reviews.Content: The video recording is stunning; better than expected. The wide lens is wonderful, the size and weight are great. The controls are simple, the battery life, screen, and zoom are all good. The speed of the camera, especially when taking multiple shots consecutively, keeps up with fast, demanding subjects. The tracking AF is clever, as is the face detection AiAF.The paint chips easily (normal, I'll guess), but that's not a real issue. The issue for me is the macro mode Ai.  Canon's AF intelligence flies out the window when switched to macro. Shots can still be composed manually by focussing the macro subject in the center of the frame, then framing the shot before pressing the shutter down the rest of the way. That's not the way my past Canon Powershots have worked, and it's enough to make sure I sent this one right back.If you don't use macro: get this camera. It's wonderful in almost every other way. If you do use macro: look at other cameras. I've owned several other PowerShots and will still swear by them.

Reviews.Title: No need to trade in your SD780.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Chell
Reviews.Content: Although the Elph 300 claims to be "the world's thinnest camera," that's now, not a couple of years ago when Canon released the SD780.  The latter camera is thinner, narrower, shallower in all its exterior dimensions and marginally lighter in weight.  It's also boasts a 12.1 mp lens and HD video.On the plus side, the new Elph has a wider-angle lens and stereo sound (of questionable superiority over monaural sound when the recording mic is necessarily squeezed onto a sound stage this small).In short, unless your 780 is broken, it would seem pointless to replace it with this point and shoot.  Should you plan to pick up an Elph 300, you may wish to wait until the end of the month.  One of Amazon's competitors is promising to reduce its price for the camera, so it remains to be seen how Amazon will respond.

Reviews.Title: Delivers a power punch in a small package.
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: I picked this camera based on some quick research I did on CNet.  The price that Amazon was offering it at was too good to be true.  But it is, it is one of the few electronic items I've purchased that delivers more that what was expected.  This camera is just fantastic.  I've had no problems to date, the operation is simple and intuative, and the size is awsomely small.  I've given it 5 star on all catagories except battery length.  I think I can solve that by purchasing a better battery.  Cheers!

Reviews.Title: Great compact camera
Reviews.Author: 124call
Reviews.Content: Purchased the camera for a trip to China.  I have owned a number of compact cameras and spent a lot of time researching and trying cameras before I purchased.  This camera is incredible.  For me, the most important feature is the end result - it's a point and shoot so how do the photos turn out on point and shoot mode?  Excellent.  Great color, great light balance and crisp focus.  Low light photos are particularly good.  It is easy to use, light weight and the battery lasts a phenomenally long time.  As a side note, the recharge on the battery is fast - less than 1/2 hour.  Great zoom and "manual" features are intuitive and easy to use.  Here's the kicker I didn't expect.  The videos are fantastic. I never expected the quality out of this camera that you get.  I am selling my Sony HD handicam as a result.  I would recommend buying the largest and fastest SD card.  You will probably never fill it up, however, once you start using the video capabilities you will probably start taking more videos that you have before.  The only issue, if you could even call it that, is that the flash sits where your finger can sometimes get in the way.  Once you block it a couple of times, you learn and slide your finger back 1/4 inch.  The issue is only when you give your camera to someone else to shoot a photo.  Sometimes they block it.  Easy fix, mention it when you hand it to them.  Not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: WOW This camera is awesome! I love it!
Reviews.Author: It is what it is
Reviews.Content: This camera for the price cannot be beat.This camera is perfect for the beginner, novice, or experienced pro. It is so easy to use and setup.Charge the battery, throw in your SD card and go shot photos. Auto mode is so easy to use.It takes beautiful pictures in any mode. 1080p video is cool too! Shutter speed is great and No LAG!Love the button layout, construction of the camera, and options. The camera is also Made in JAPAN! WOW, really it is.Buy this camera and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great Companion to My DSLR and Video Camera!!!
Reviews.Author: OregonTrails
Reviews.Content: For my latest trip to Japan, I wanted to travel light, so I knew that I wouldn't be toting my bulky Canon XSi and all its lenses, nor would I be packing my VIXIA HF S200.  There was just no room in the one already overstuffed carry-on I decided was the only thing I would be taking...  Just about the time I was doing the TSA security thing before boarding here in the States, I realized that, in my haste to get to the airport, I had left my trusty PowerShot SD550 at home.  What followed was a 10 hour flight trying to figure out what I was going to do for a camera once I landed, since I knew I would need one...While frantically searching through one of the gargantuan electronic mega-malls in downtown Tokyo for ANYTHING, I came upon the IXY 410F, which is the branding used in Japan for the PowerShot 300HS.  I bought it mainly because, A). I happen to like Canon products and B). It hit my price point.  Boy, am I glad I did.  What a great camera!  After stumbling through the user's manual with my awesome grade-school level command of Japanese (and pushing a lot of buttons), I was stunned by the features Canon was able to pack into such a small camera.Now, I'm far from a professional photographer and only have the barest inkling of ISO, shutter speeds and the like.  That said, in side-by-side comparisons of photos taken with the SD550 and the 300HS, the 300HS wins hands down in picture clarity, which you might expect, since the SD550 is 7.1 MP and the 300HS is 12 MP.  Where the 300HS really shines is in taking pictures in low light.  The pictures I was able to capture the first night I got it were stunning...  Videos (using a Transcend 32 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card TS32GSDHC10E) are smooth, and while the sound quality is nowhere near what I can achieve with the aforementioned VIXIA, the 300HS is a fifth the size and weight.  Not bad for a camera that will fit in a shirt pocket...  The face recognition feature, combined with the AF/IS, make the 300HS super-easy to use when photographing people and 5X optical/20X digital zooms are great for distant shots.  I was also impressed by the clarity of the rear LCD.  Even in bright sunlight, I found I could easily see to frame shots, even with the camera held above my head.The only downsides I've found on the PowerShot 300HS are associated with one of its chief selling features; its small size.  For someone with big hands (like me), the camera often seems to get lost.  While the rear controls are well laid out and the grainy case texture has a nice feel, when I'm in a hurry to get a shot, I sometimes find myself mashing the on/off button instead of the shutter.  This isn't as much of a problem on the SD550, since the shutter button/focus ring is physically raised, so it's easy to find when holding the camera and focusing on your subject.  Also, it just seems to me that the 300HS is just a little more cheaply made than the SD550.  The SD550 has a beefy, solid feel to it, whereas the 300HS is much lighter and physically much smaller.  The battery/SD card door on the SD550 is spring operated and is well made, while the battery/card door on the 300HS is a slider that I always feel is on the verge of busting off when I don't line it up just right.These nit-picky minuses aside, the 300HS is a super point-and-shoot.  While it won't be replacing my XSi for heavy lift photography or my HF 200 for videos, I will be gifting my SD550 to my wife.  When combined with the two Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS Digital Camera Battery - Premium TechFuel® NB-4L Battery's I bought through Amazon, the Canon ELPH 300HS will be certainly accompanying me on future "travel light" trips (if I remember to pack it)!

Reviews.Title: Just Right
Reviews.Author: Pharia "Alex"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my boyfriend who never had a camera before. He was able to use it right away and is able to take great picture for a beginner. The camera is very small, light, and the texture or the black makes it easy to hold (not slippery at all like the shinny cameras) I recommend it for everyone.

Reviews.Title: Best camera ever
Reviews.Author: Polly P
Reviews.Content: This camera is small/compact that fits into pocket. Good photo quality and night time shots without tripod. Battery life is good, too. Recharge in about 2~3 days of use. Overall, I love this camera!

Reviews.Title: Photos are not upto the mark
Reviews.Author: Amit Chavan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera about a year ago, and have clicked photos in different environments since then. In almost all of the situations, the photos come out to be "grainy" --- not what I expected from a Canon product.I am not a professional photographer and I wanted a small enough camera that I could easily take with me everywhere. However, I am not satisfied with this product.

Reviews.Title: Cheaper at Best Buy.
Reviews.Author: Robert E. Hooser
Reviews.Content: I just bought this camera at Best Buy for $129.00. It came with a 4GB memory card, case, and $15 gift card for this price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Sistad
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take on my recent trip to Key West. I had previously been using a Sony Cybershot (which is nice too) but I wanted to upgrade to more MP's and I was looking for a sleeker, smaller camera. I bought the camera in black and it has a rougher texture making it easier to keep your grip on it. It fit in my small purse perfectly and I've had nothing but compliments on the awesome photos it took. Great color and clarity! I also took a few short video clips which was fun and easy ... you don't have to switch settings, just push the video button! This camera has way more settings/functions than I will ever use but is fun if you want to experiment. It really can't be any easier to use if you just want to point and click! I was down there for 5 days/6 nights and only had to charge my battery once. I used the "auto" settings most of the time and it almost always chose the right setting for the picture. Only a couple of times did I have to turn the flash off to get a better picture. You'll LOVE this camera!!

Reviews.Title: Died an early death
Reviews.Author: Carlina
Reviews.Content: I read lots of Canon Elph 300 reviews before buying mine recently.One thing that troubled me was the number of buyers who reported malfunctioning cameras. I bought anyway because so many people raved about the features/photo quality.Bad move.Part way through a 5-week vacation -- and just as we were taking a long-anticipated cruise through the Panama Canal -- the image began to shudder crazily and the camera died. I'd owned it for roughly 3 weeks and taken great care of it.I had the operating manual with me, and nothing I did could bring the darned thing back to life.So no pix of the Panama Canal. Sad day.Rather than spend the rest of our vacation cameraless, I bought a Canon Elph 100 in Panama City, Panama -- on sale, yet $75 more than it sells for in the States. (The 300 wasn't available there.)But here's the crazy thing.I compared the images taken by the 300 and those taken by the 100. The 100 shots definitely are better. Color is better; they're crisper.Now I just hope the 100 doesn't bite the dust.

Reviews.Title: Elph 300 vs S95
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: Purchased both Elph300 (the Japanese version) and S95, returned S95 and kept Elph 300. Because: 1) Elph 300 has better video features - full HD, plus, you can zoom during the video recording; 2) the battery on Elph300 lasts at least two times longer. I was able to take more than 230 shots vs ~110 shots with S95; 3)  In terms of image quality not much difference. The S95 has a slight edge when shoot in manual, but IMHO it does not justify 2 times higher cost. I shoot mainly in auto mode, so no noticeable difference here.4) Elph 300 is significantly smaller.

Reviews.Title: Great product but be aware
Reviews.Author: Tad
Reviews.Content: I bought the camare a week ago and it is great, I want you to be aware of that the camera comes with charge and battery. This is not obvious from the ad. In fact immediately below the Camera ad, Amazon advertises that customers also bought a charger and battery. Please Amazon: indicate in the ad which accessories comes with the camera. Although I could return the purchase, the return mailing is to expensive and these expenses are not returned by the provider. Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Reviews.Title: Great photos, poor build quality
Reviews.Author: Alice2011
Reviews.Content: I have owned Canon powershot cameras for the last 6-7 years and have always been happy with photo and buid quality. After owning Canon SD870 for 5 years, carrying it to beaches, hiking, etc. I found it to be a bit bulky and wanted something that can shoot HD video for my trip to South America and also something smaller. I was really happy with the picture quality and videos, carried the camera in my pocket (in a case) all the time. Suddenly I saw that the shutter cover is not opening any more and I had to use my hand to open/close it for the whole duration of my trip (it was damaged maybe 10 days into my trip, no obvious hit that I felt that could damage the camera). After I returned, Canon estimated the damage to be $170. Needles, to say, I am not having it repaired and I seriously doubt I will continue buying Canon powershot cameras due to poor build quality. I treated it with care, but having a small portable camera that you have to put in a big protective case in order to avoid damage due to normal handling beats the purpose of the small form factor.

Reviews.Title: Unacceptable level of Chromatic Aberration
Reviews.Author: T. Jacob "Jake"
Reviews.Content: I was upgrading form a A590 IS 8MP, and I really had high hopes for this camera seeing all the positive reviews. This camera has very noticeable fringing or chromatic Aberration problem cased by poor lens engineering. My old A590 had virtually no fringing issues..  Most people probably would overlook this but if you are a person who loves photography with a keen eye and want crisp clean pics, this issue will drive you nuts. I couldn't tolerate it so returned mine.. Everything else is fine but I still wouldn't recommend this camera for photography enthusiasts or for anyone considering it is a premium class camera with a serious problem. Imaging-resource dot com/PRODS/300HS/300HSA.htm did a pretty good review of it, if you want to see what I mean... the fringing is best noticeable between high contrast areas in bright lighting conditions.

Reviews.Title: 3 Year Camera!
Reviews.Author: Valentina
Reviews.Content: I have had the canon elph 300 camera for almost 3 years now and its one of the best cameras I have ever had. There is so much you can do in this tiny camera. When I was looking to purchase a camera, I looked at all kinds of cameras and was going to buy a canon sx30 (something like that). I'm so glad I didn't buy it and bought this camera instead. It has a lot of the features those other cameras have and come out just as good. This camera is bomb. The only thing that I dislike about the camera is where the recording button is at. Everything else is great from slow motion videos, multiple pictures, taking pictures in a dark place, perfect lighting, everything is great. If you have trouble picking from cameras look into this camera, not only is the price great so is the camera. To me it's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Rico
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son who travels a lot.  He loves the camera.  I also purchased one for my wife.  She loves it because it is so easy to use. Its functions are easy to access and the quality of the pictures are excellent.  Great camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot/and "vlog camera"
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: amazing video from a small little easy to carry point and shoot. and if you are someone who enjoys to "vlog" your adventures,this camera works very well for getting yourself fully in the frame when you flip it around to film yourself because of that awesome built in 50mm lens. Great stuff. and can't go wrong with canon with image quality!

Reviews.Title: Canon is Wuarranty
Reviews.Author: R. Martinetto
Reviews.Content: Grate item. Grate resolution and even better price!!!! The image is grate. Easy to use and VERY resistant (I drop it accidentally twice and still work perfectly).Canon is always recomended.

Reviews.Title: very good point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: DAYANANDA S KARKALA
Reviews.Content: i am very happy with my purchase of Canon PowerShot ELPH 300. i have been using this camera purchased during thanks giving  and so far very impressed with the quality of photos.i would rank this little camera much higher as compared to my earlier Nikon COOLPIX S9200.This little camera does its task of taking photos very well without any bells and whistles offered by an expensive DSLR.i would recommend this camera for anyone looking for a decent Point and Shoot camera,

Reviews.Title: She loved it
Reviews.Author: Seth Voland
Reviews.Content: Gave this to my girlfriend as a Christmas gift since her older Canon camera had finally broken. She loves the color and the small size. I have taken pictures with it and it works great. Wonderful little camera you can take anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the size and price
Reviews.Author: civ
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a replacement for my old SLR film camera. My old camera was a great camera for taking macro photos of flowers because was a SLR with a MACRO lens. First my new camera had to be small. Second it had to be able to take macro photos. The ELPH 300 will take good macro photos. I said good not great. What I do is take lots of photos of my subject and hope I get one that is sharp. With digital cameras you can take lots of photos and hope you get the one you want. Sometimes I'll 25 or more photos and delete the ones that I don't like.  Overall I like this point and shoot camera. It is not the best, and not the worst point and shoot camera. It works for me

Reviews.Title: Beautiful looking compact phone that takes some great pictures and videos
Reviews.Author: G
Reviews.Content: A worthy successor to my powershot 1000, which died nearly 3 years ago from water damage in Hawaii. I know there's newer models now, but I still take it with me over my phone camera for special occasions. I wish it took better low light pictures, but I don't believe any camera at this size does that particularly well. Old model, so there's no touchscreen. SD cards are become less of a standard now for many laptops. Still takes great pictures and 1080p video with 5x optical zoom. Still a very pretty looking camera. There's becoming less of a need for the compact camera, but I'm glad I had this when I went to Japan, and I hope to get several more years of use out of it.

Reviews.Title: My brothers mission camera
Reviews.Author: Snowman53
Reviews.Content: As a missionary one of the few things you bring back from a mission is pictures. That said I wanted him to have a reliable good camera and this one did the trick.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Julio C. Andrade
Reviews.Content: Nice and compact. Lots of good features which I hardly use but never the less. Nice quality pictures and video. Nice and slim and light weight. Meets my needs.

Reviews.Title: I needed a digital camera and this one is great!!
Reviews.Author: Mary E Wojciechowski
Reviews.Content: I'm still figuring some of the features out but basically it takes great pictures. And with more practice I'll get better and better.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: Patti
Reviews.Content: this is a very nice camera I enjoy the ease of its use.  the pictures are great  I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use and Lasts
Reviews.Author: Jason Tan
Reviews.Content: I've had this thing for a super long time. When I first got it the box was all damaged and I was promised some money back, but didn't get anything. This camera on the other hand works pretty darn well. I used it on all my trips, business photos, and at parties. It's a cheap alternative if you don't like cell phone pictures.

Reviews.Title: What a  buy
Reviews.Author: PatsGrl58
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the money. My husband travels for his joba and he loves this. The pictures are the best

Reviews.Title: Love my camera!
Reviews.Author: Anonymous "Anonymous"
Reviews.Content: I've had it for two years, still going strong! even through the hot humid climate where I live in SE Asia!  Great in low light conditions, which I love, because picture quality is usually so much better without the flash needing to go off! Easy to carry around, so small and light. Just a tip about taking video - if you zoom in during filming, and sound quality is very important to you (like my sister's violin recital!) when you playback the video you will hear little clicking sounds given off by the little zoom motor. Most of the time I have no need to zoom during filming, however. So I'm keeping it at 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: great!!
Reviews.Author: Yongcai Huag
Reviews.Content: you can'y ask other better camera! high quality on the picture, and you can take picture almost like professional.I fell when the lens is on, and it get broken... then I buy another one because I can't find other better than this one.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures for a compact
Reviews.Author: Xof
Reviews.Content: I have tried a few compacts that I returned until I bought this one. The price is quite high, but the quality of the pictures was much better than the other compacts.If you care about quality, this camera is worth it.

Reviews.Title: Order now please.
Reviews.Author: Geek_450
Reviews.Content: Capturing the best pictures is no longer a big problem these days now that there is already a digital camera like Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS to give you some of the finest photos that will let you capture all the important events in your life.Made by one of the highly acclaimed names when it comes to delivering remarkable cameras, Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS has a price range of $152.15 to $229.00 and is also the successor of PowerShot SD1400 IS introduced in 2010. Although the Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS maintains the sleek and compact size of its ancestor, this product has more features to offer to its users.The Thinner, The BetterWith a weight that is below 5 ounces and depth of less than one inch, PowerShot ELPH 300 HS can fit snugly inside your pocket while ensuring you that it has lots of power hidden beneath its sleek point and shoot body. It has an ultra wide angle lens of 24mm that comes with a remarkable optical zoom of 5x that can give you your needed versatility for shooting in whatever situation you might be in. If you ever got zoomed in pretty tight, there is also no need to be worried about things getting extra shaky because it has an optical image stabilizer. Canon believes that style should never be sacrificed for power because PowerShot ELPH 300 HS is perfect for an effortless capturing of great photos, whether you are just taking some walk around town or you have a night-long party.Say Goodbye to Dark PhotosThe HS SYSTEM of Canon has greatly improved shooting even in situations with low light with no need for flash and it can also lower the noise levels for the higher settings of ISO.The HS System being used by Canon will surely take away all the frustration that users might feel during low-lighting shooting as it can deliver you clear and blur-free shoots with every single ambiance still intact so that you will be completely freed from the commonly unwanted effects brought by utilizing the flash. Stunning low light shots have now been made at high and low ISO speeds, with dynamic range expanded in order to preserve the maximum detail in shadow and highlight areas.The Advantage of an HS MegapixelMegapixels have so much more to offer. The HS System incorporated by Canon in Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS can offer a dramatically better sensitivity that the average camera that has a greater or identical megapixel counts. This only means that you no longer require excessive megapixels just to attain the spectacular images that you have been looking for with reduced noise plus you will be getting equally remarkable results with the help of 12.1 megapixel ELPH 300 HS.Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS Features and SpecificationsThinnest digital camera of the world with optical image stabilizer, 5x optical zoom, and 24 mm ultra wide angle lensColor: BlackFull HD video of 1080p for outstanding quality together with a stereo sound, and access made easy by the allotted movie buttonHS System of Canon with DIGIC 4 Image Processor and 12.1 MP CMOS that can greatly improve shooting photos even with no flash in the low light instancesHigh speed shooting at its best with a unique point-and-shoot camera with an AUTO that can intelligently choose the correct camera settings based on its 32 predefined situations for shooting.Lowers the noise levels at the higher settings of ISODynamic IS keeps footage stabilized and optical zoom can be done while shooting a video.Super Slow Motion Movie allows video recording at high speed to offer a playback of slow motion.ProsGiven the features and specifications of Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS, you can already deduce all the advantages that you can get out of using this compact yet powerful camera. It boasts of excellent ergonomics, high quality videos as well as an instant startup.ConsAll devices and electronic products comes with some cons, and in the case of Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS, its flash is a bit inconveniently located, with a rare overexposure and a port cover that is not that properly attached. However, these are very minor disadvantages that can be easily overshadowed by the fact that the flash is not really required in most situations because it can remarkably shoot pictures even in situations with low light.If you are currently looking for a sleek digital camera that is fully-loaded with all the power that you need but will fit perfectly in your pocket, Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS is certainly your best choice.

Reviews.Title: I got this baby to replace my SD750.
Reviews.Author: lizzy2pink
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I have no complaints, works fast, flash is great, low light pictures are amazing. Love the big screen in the back. The only thing I would really want is panorama. But I keep forgetting my iphone has it so eh I guess. It's a really really sick camera for everything from Macro to portraits. I love it. I didn't even have to buy a new battery because it fit the same one as my SD750. YAY!! Get it!

Reviews.Title: Nice gift for a teenage girl
Reviews.Author: RAS
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my teenage daughter and she loved it. She uses it often and even in her photography class.

Reviews.Title: Excellent with underwater housing
Reviews.Author: C. Telenko "Miss_Pixy"
Reviews.Content: I use this camera with the underwater casing to take photos and videos while scuba diving. The videos are excellent and photos are quite good. The only issue is that the pictures are often too white with the auto white balance in bright areas.

Reviews.Title: Family & Picture taker
Reviews.Author: Joseline M. Graves
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome, it is not a professional camera by no means but it's an awesome camera for vacation and taking pictures of kids. My kids are always on the run and took great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Video capture - Just WOW!
Reviews.Author: D. Summerson "Happy Camper"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 2 years but didnt use the video recording until this last weekend.  My son took it to video a local band and create a video for them.  I wasn't expecting the results I saw.  What I saw was nothing short of astounding for this little guy!  The low light shots were still very good, the sound came out great, as it seemed it's internal AGC was perfectly tuned. I am convinced now that for the occasional HD video you may want to shoot, save your money on a video camera and use this camera.  His final edit was astounding and you could not tell that he didn't use a much more expensive camera.  Thanks Canon!  BTW, the camera takes great pics too!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Point & Shoot!
Reviews.Author: Casual Photographer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I received this camera as a wedding present over a year ago... we've loved it! Honestly, we have absolutely no complaints. Here are the things we've liked about it:- It takes great pictures and video... definitely higher resolution and quality than I would've expected- Surprisingly long battery life... whether taking pictures or sitting in the case for a month, I've hardly seen the battery dwindle down!- Very little/no delay when taking pictures. I really find it frustrating that so many little digital point and shoots have such a long delay between when you fully press the button and when the picture takes... This camera has hardly any such delay!- The User Interface is great... it's so easy to change a setting (turn on timer, change exposure time, turn on rapid-shoot, etc.)... and to experiment with new ones. There are helpful little phrases on each setting or effect, letting you know a bit more about it, which helped me learn more about the settings without having to pull out the manual.- I guess it only has a 5x optical zoom... but I wouldn't have guessed it! The up to 24x digital zoom is surprisingly good!- It has a nice feel and size too it. The casing seems quite rugged and scratch-resistant.All-in-all I highly recommend this camera! It does a great job!

Reviews.Title: Very impressed with battery life
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Barker
Reviews.Content: I switched from a digital p&s; AA battery eater.  I am an idiot for not switching years ago.  Charge this thing overnight and you can take so many pictures that your finger will wear out before the battery does.  The picture quality is fair.  I think that will improve as I learn to use more of the functions.

Reviews.Title: It's all it states it is
Reviews.Author: Curt
Reviews.Content: This is a small and easy camera to shoot quality photos with. After reading many reviews on this camera I was positive this was the one I wanted. I am glad I stuck to my guns and waited for this one, it is all everyone stated it is, easy, fast, loaded with options and exceptional photos. You'll love the quality of the pictures it takes.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Brandon Lee
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality and compact!  Definitely would recommend to anyone else that is looking for a point and shoot camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera!
Reviews.Author: Scuba Steve
Reviews.Content: This is the best of canons Elph series cameras. I love the button layout on the back and I love the slow motion video feature. My kids love doing tricks, jumps, and splashes while I film them in slow motion. The only thing I'd change is the LCD screen resolution because it isn't the best but what really matters is how the picture actually looks- and they look great!

Reviews.Title: works great
Reviews.Author: AmazonBuyer
Reviews.Content: love this little guy. You can take it anywhere with and take a bunch of great pictures that can be printed nicely.

Reviews.Title: Doing great
Reviews.Author: K=8
Reviews.Content: So far it seems to take great pictures.  It is for my 15 year old and he is enjoying it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera!
Reviews.Author: vannemic
Reviews.Content: Even though it's a year old, it still takes great photos and awesome HD video. Bought it for a trip and am very happy I did.

Reviews.Title: Nothing to complain about.
Reviews.Author: Ace-Guitar
Reviews.Content: Great camera for young photographers or for families. This camera is simple to use and has great quality. My little brother loves using the slow motion effect to make some stellar videos.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: Granny "mur"
Reviews.Content: Best little camera I have ever had. Pictures are flawless as is video. My son went out and bought one after seeing my pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon 300 HS
Reviews.Author: Jack P.
Reviews.Content: Love the camera. Many, many features on it. One can play with this camera all day, and then some. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: It's the best
Reviews.Author: Sanji
Reviews.Content: When I try it I feel that is the best camera ever ..... But I think its better when it came with other battry and memory larger. So I advice to try it.

Reviews.Title: wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Katharine L DeVilbiss
Reviews.Content: I love canons & this one doesn't upset. It does not have the macro feature for shooting super close up, but does a decent job at producing clear pictures close up on the auto function. One of the best point and shoot cameras out there!

Reviews.Title: Super FAST!
Reviews.Author: Kari
Reviews.Content: This little camera has a great picture, but the best part is that it is unbelivably fast. I was able to catch action shots like a dream. Ive always been so annoyed with other cameras to push the trigger & competley miss what I was shooting for. This camera is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Love this camera.
Reviews.Author: Penny Everage
Reviews.Content: Takes great sharp photos every time.  Small and compact. Not one blurry picture. Don't particularly care for the surface of the camera as it isn't smooth but other than that I like the camera.

Reviews.Title: It's a PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Seth
Reviews.Content: From what I tested so far, it's a really decent device. I would recommend this to anyone who wants a decent, yet affordable point n shoot camera. Zoom is nice and I was able to catch moving actions with out motion blur. Though one down side is I notice it takes a second to snap after pressing the button. Might not bother some but it's harder to time that "just right" movement shot.I would recommend this for the average user / vacationer.

Reviews.Title: Love this little camera!
Reviews.Author: Dr.S
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for over a year and am extremely happy with it.  The picture quality in both stills and video is excellent and there are some wonderful features that I utilize regularly.  There is a best shot feature that takes three consecutive shots within seconds and chooses the best one.  This is great for many situations, but I especially use it for group portraits with very satisfying results.  I love the vivid mode which creates very interesting and dramatic sunsets, cloud shots and anything that involves dramatic light and color.  It takes it to a whole other level.  I find that I easily bring it with me due to its small size and have therefore successfully documented many valued moments in my life, in particular, those involving friends, family and pets.  The battery life is long.  The slightly rough surface of the black model helps prevent it from slipping out of my hands.  It has several low-light settings.  All in all, I highly recommend this little gem.

Reviews.Title: ELPH 12.1. MP
Reviews.Author: John Mckee "John"
Reviews.Content: I received camera earlier than expected and found it to be the right size and takes excellent video.  It is easy to use just like my previous three  Canon's.  No view finder and no slow motion in viewing video. The 12..1 MP is compensated and and takes outstanding pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Brian R. Bobrzynski
Reviews.Content: This is a great Pocket Camera.  It is small enough to carry everywhere.  Rugged too. I dropped it many times and it still works. (as long as you don't drop it right on the open lens!)The Battery lasts a long time.  I have yet to have it run out on me while taking pictures.This camera has a great macro feature for closeups and takes great 1080p HD Video.My first Cannon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS met its demise when the camera fell 3ft directly onto its open lens.  Actually the camera still worked, but the lens would not retract without manual assistance.  I was so pleased with this camera I bought the exact same model again.  I am still using the battery from my old camera.  Still working great.

Reviews.Title: bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: A. Encao
Reviews.Content: My wife has had this for a year.  It fits in her purse and goes almost everywhere with her.  Takes great pictures and does so quickly. It does have a lot of functions and features, but like most other people we have parked it in "auto"

Reviews.Title: Excellent pocket camera.
Reviews.Author: Mitch H.
Reviews.Content: Researched many  pocket cameras, and this was rated better than some with more megapixels. I have not been disappointed. I have not used many of the different modes that it offers. Mainly Auto, no flash, macro, and different resolutions. Fairly intuitive, and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great beginner camera
Reviews.Author: Eric Burdett
Reviews.Content: I'm a novice photographer and found this to be a great point and shoot camera! It has a lot of settings but is very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Joyce Milat
Reviews.Content: I love it.  Good quality pictures inside and out.  I love the way that it tell you with hints what the camera setting is doing. I don't want to fuss with it just shoot. So easy to handle and perfect size. Exactly what I wanted for travel.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: John K. Sisler
Reviews.Content: The the quality of the pictures it takes is wonderful. Functions very easy to use. A very good camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Colorado girl
Reviews.Content: What a joy to use!  Not being a photography expert, this camera is easy enough for me to use and has great detail on each picture.  This is my second Canon PowerShot camera and I would not hesitate to recommend it to everyone.  It is small and easy to take along anywhere.  It fits nicely into a pocket or handbag.  I received it in a timely manner intact and put it to good use after charging the battery.  The prints are pristine.  You won't be sorry with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: It Bounces!
Reviews.Author: Cathy W
Reviews.Content: No one mentions the durability of this easy-to-use camera.Dropped this baby from a balcony in New Orleans, landed in the street, splayed open, battery spilled out...still worked! Amazing!The ease and multiple functions are amazing, after 1 year of use, I am still discovering artistic ways to utilize this camera. Fits everywhere (but don't place in jean pocket, it may fall out and land in a street!)and is so easy to use. The video feature works well and the audio pick-up is very accurate.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Megan Hulin
Reviews.Content: I used to have a Canon that I loved and this one is better! Pictures are sharp and the menu is user friendly.

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: Ann Lewis
Reviews.Content: Easy to use.  Agreat size.  Clarity of color and detail is very good.This is the best small camera I have had.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, does the job
Reviews.Author: Paul Ruff
Reviews.Content: Decent enough point-and-shot, one of the better ones actually.Not a DSLR, but still a great camera, that takes great shots.And 1080p HD video is nice, although the 10 minute time limit is annoying.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Mike Kennerley
Reviews.Content: excellent pics and video the camera is easy to use in auto mode also the quality of the pictures is great

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: DavidS
Reviews.Content: For it's size and price, this Canon camera is excellent.  The low light feature is fantastic.  Would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: Bonny Ann Turayev
Reviews.Content: This has been my most favorite camera I've owned yet. (And I've owned A LOT!) I love the high-speed burst mode and use it a lot. :) The zoom doesn't go as far as I'd like, but I've learned to live with it, since all the other spiffy functions make up for it. There are a lot of really cool filters and options. The video is great. I love the way the pictures look- it's not dark, grainy, or have a strange hue to it, like some of my other cameras have had. The close-up shots are shockingly fantastic- I've had better results with this camera than any other for close-ups. It fits into your hand well and is very easy to use. It's fairly durable (though I try to take care of my cameras, I do take it through some rough terrain and I'm a clutz.) I like that it's not huge like DSLR's or some of the more fancy point and shoots. I liked it so much that I bought a second one so that when the first one inevitably breaks I'll have the same camera still (this is the first time I've done that.) Plus I LOVE that you can get an underwater case for it! People at the beach thought it was cool too. :)

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Lam
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I wanted a simple point and shoot camera that shoots HD video. This camera does just that. I couldn't ask for a better camera. Small camera but it really gets the job done. Video is 1080, pics come out very clear

Reviews.Title: it was perfect
Reviews.Author: Norman S. Stickney III "zaz"
Reviews.Content: i loved it . we got it for valentines day. it worked great. we took to the beaches of the caribbean. it worked great. one day i was waving to someone. i forgot it was on my wrist with the strap. it flew way high into the air. and landed on the concrete, and split open. i taped it back together with butterfly bandeges. performance is balky. i wimper all night long. we got another simliar one on ebay. it has a little spot on all the images. i wimper. all day long.

Reviews.Title: Lasts Long, Decent pictures
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Q. Huynh
Reviews.Content: Its not grade A stuff but its a Grade A price/performance value.
