Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter after reading all the good reviews about it. It is a wonderful little camera and small enough to ft in a pocket. My son ended up buying one also to take with him on the Appalachian Trail and it took great pictures.

Reviews.Title: Great for still photos
Reviews.Author: K. Piercy
Reviews.Content: This camera takes really high quality photos and videos with an excellent zoom.  The only downside I've found (which could be user error since I haven't read the whole manual) is that there seems to be a tiny lag when you take photos and if your subject is moving the photo can get blurry.  I have a tough time capturing my 2 year old since he is always moving.  But the video quality is great-just be sure to purchase the memory card as well, since it doesn't come with the camera.  I ended up getting a 16 MB card so I wouldn't have to worry about downloading and erasing very often.  It takes a little while to get used to the features, so plan on spending some time playing with it and reading the manual to get the most out of this camera.  I LOVE this size--it's smaller than my cell phone!  Also, I ended up buying a small case for it as well, so plan on an additional $25-35 on memory card and case costs.

Reviews.Title: my first digital camera
Reviews.Author: rossinator
Reviews.Content: Very nice, easy to use. I have this in my pocket 90% of the time because it is alot better than a phone camera. It comes in handy I bought a couple extra batteries so never have to worry about the battery, going dead right when you need it most.

Reviews.Title: Canon 300HS
Reviews.Author: W. C. Dougherty
Reviews.Content: I bought the Canon Powershot 300HS as a replacement for the Canon Powershot SD 1400 IS which was damaged severely when dropped by a friend of mine.  It was out of the warranty period and was not worth the cost of paying Canon to repair it.  The 300HS was less expensive but I believe that it is substantially better than the 1400. The pictures are much more clear and the color is much better.  Indoor shots are better and if one uses the program mode, adjusting the white balance yields much better color reproduction, especially under tungsten lighting.  It is often unnecessary to turn on the flash when a normal amount of lighting is present but hold the camera steady.  The video is clear and sharp but when using the zoom while capturing video, you can hear the whir of the motor as it moves the lens housing in or out, however, it is a minimal intrusion.  I would highly recommend this camera for a great point and shoot which is small enough to drop in a shirt pocket.  Be very careful not to get any dirt or sand in the lens barrels or it will jam.

Reviews.Title: Canon
Reviews.Author: Skinner64
Reviews.Content: We had purchased a Kodak camera and have hated it.  We purchased the Canon based on other reviews and we love it.  We are not camera experts, so this is a great camera for those of us who want the quality and ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: D. D. M. A
Reviews.Content: Although this one is not the lastest version of the model (12.1MP, not 16MP), as other consumer reviews note, is a credit-card size, powerful camera with extremely impressive HD video recording. I have nothing bad to say about my old Olympus FE 5MP camera, but this one is way more advanced and its software much, much faster and easier to use (for example, in terms of how the files are stored and opened in memory or when you are resizing images). The amateur or non-professional of photography will nevertheless love a bit of control with the many predefined shooting situation modes and a few other technicalities it teaches you on the way (such as the AF functions). The modes that allow to capture moving objects is awesome. The video quality is amazing and I am even considering editing a few for work-related activities (such as conference presentations). With this camera, my passion for photo taking has reignited!

Reviews.Title: Canon POWERSHOT
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Excelente producto, rápida entrega a Venezuela. Satisfecho completamente, es una excelente cámara. Tal cual como la describen, una maravilla por el precio es genial.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Ray Hedberg
Reviews.Content: Fits anywhere and I am amazed at the functionality. I was a little confused when the zoom went up to 24 power as I thought the camera was only a 5x. Zoom up to 5x is optical, then digital beyond that.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Valerie
Reviews.Content: this camera is great.  Long battery, amazing screen and huge value for the money.  Very happy with product and as always with cannon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with great price
Reviews.Author: TT
Reviews.Content: I am also using this (with proper under water housing, and filter sold separately) for scuba diving as well. I get great photos and HD videos both on land and under water. I highly recommend it. PS: Matter of fact I bought another one for my spouse.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful, i love this cam
Reviews.Author: Mr. Bloksa
Reviews.Content: It has so many cool stuff, this cam it's amazing. Let's start- The user interface it's great, everything is in its place, it has really cool functions, i've had a cybershot before and it was ok, but this canon it's so much better.- the battery last the time that you need, and you can carry the charger everywhere.- the picture quality is great, doesn't need any word, just amazing.- when you hold it, everything is in his place, no crash sound, it's made of metal a little heavy but you can feel the quality.to resume, i recommend this camera to everyone it has all the things that you need and more

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: TBiggs "texasbiggs"
Reviews.Content: Camera takes very good pictures and easy to operate.Small size and the case is textured for easy grip.Nice pocket camera and certainly a step up from smartphones cameras.

Reviews.Title: Canon camera
Reviews.Author: Ronald C. Ghizzoni "Kool"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after having used a Panasonic Lumina camera for the last couple of years. The panasonic was nothing nut trouble. I had most of my pictures come out blurry. The canon appears to be much better.

Reviews.Title: Cannon PowershotELPH 300
Reviews.Author: Bill
Reviews.Content: The camera iscompact, easy to use. If you need something small to take vacation, party or general snapshots I think you'll be pleased.

Reviews.Title: Best camera i've ever owned
Reviews.Author: t bird
Reviews.Content: i've had this camera for about 6 months and I still enjoy it. It's small size is very nice  while out with the family. it has many great function modes. The video is also wonderful. I have shaky hands and the camera adjust while in video mode to compensate

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: I am admittedly not a pro, nor have I used this camera extensively. So please realize that these are just my initial impressions.At this point I am thrilled to have bought this camera. The quality of pictures has been impressive, the camera has been very easy to use and, I LOVE the size of it.I WILL be VERY careful with it as I have read all the reviews about "the dreaded lens errors"! Actually, those reviews are part of the reason I bought this camera. When you remove all the poor reviews related to the lens error this camera would really have an exceptional rating! So if I am careful and can avoid that one problem I should be exceptionally happy ;)

Reviews.Title: Who knew a p&s; could be so spectacular?
Reviews.Author: LiveLikeLiz
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera. I was in the market for a point and shoot I could carry around in my purse for just taking photos, since I don't carry my high-end DSLR around. I'm a Canon fan-kid all the way, however I bought a Nikon p&s; prior to this one. I returned it the next day and bought this one without a second thought. Canon always delivers the best, and this is the BEST point and shoot camera I've ever used, especially for the price. I'm very picky when it comes to quality, I have no complaints with this camera. It has fun effects to play around with, too. I don't think I'll ever regret this purchase, and you won't, either!

Reviews.Title: Best point and shoot for the price
Reviews.Author: nerfezoriuq
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because we were going to go on vacation and I wanted to have nice pictures. This camera did not disappoint, it is very small and takes wonderful pictures. I don't like to record much videos so I pretty much ignored that part when purchasing this camera. But once I got my hands on it and started recording things I was blown away by the quality. It has a wonderful image stabilization that will make your pictures and videos much less shaky. The video is also in 1080p so once you move the file over into your computer and watch it, it looks amazing. I recommend this camera to anyone just looking for a good point and shoot, but I would recommend you also buy at least a 16GB sd card.

Reviews.Title: A tiny, but powerful camera
Reviews.Author: L. Da Vinci "Renaissance Man"
Reviews.Content: This camera appears to have been discontinued by Canon. The small size of this camera belies the quality and many options available in this very small and light package. Think of it as the smaller version of the S-95 model, one I had for a while recently.The features of this camera are many, most of them  available through the menu, which is a little tedious, but thorough.The colors are very good, you can easily get  a good quality 8x10, as long as it's well-lit and well exposed.I have not used the video feature in the camera yet, but it has a slow-motion option, something not usually seen in cameras in this price range.Hurry and get this model, before it's all gone from the store shelves. If that happens, get a used model in good condition.

Reviews.Title: The elph canon PowerShot 300
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth M Wust
Reviews.Content: The is definitely a fun an easy to go anywhere camera. How small it is this camera amazes me for the great pictures it takes. Very happy getting this camera and would recommend to buying it because this camera does hold up to its repetitation.

Reviews.Title: Love this product!
Reviews.Author: S. Rice
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this camera. The pictures it takes are just amazing and the HD recording is unreal for the size of this camera. Would highly recommend this camera to anyone that needs a nice small camera to take amazing photos.

Reviews.Title: love this camera
Reviews.Author: airrick
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to this camera from an older Canon and It works really well. It works so well that I bought one for my girlfriend too after I tried mine.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Jordan D. Klass "Grow Daddy"
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price!  Lightweight, compact, portable, and everything I want in a small, simple camera to take camping, concerts, and for just about whatever.  I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with Full 1080p HD Video (Silver)
Reviews.Author: G. Miott
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my grand daughter. It is a great camera, it was easy for her to master in a few hour. My order was process promptly. Thanks for your attention to details.

Reviews.Title: good for novice
Reviews.Author: Dr. Jeffrey Moskovic, JD "denlawfire"
Reviews.Content: If you need a camera to augment a more prosumer-type camera, this camera is small enough to fill the bill. The only cons, IMHO, were lack of TTL and flash placement (I personally prefer pop-up flash - finger can block flash accidentally).

Reviews.Title: OK but not Great
Reviews.Author: Ian Daniels
Reviews.Content: Unit seemed too small in my hands, you have to be careful or you cover the flash.  Takes shots way too slowly I felt like I would miss too many pics.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: William G. Cramer
Reviews.Content: I've owned many Canon cameras and liked them all.  This one is no exception.  I have not used it much yet but so far it is very easy to use, takes great photos and seems very sturdy.

Reviews.Title: A great PnS at this price level.
Reviews.Author: elcidbob
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer:  When it comes to photography, I'm little more than a somewhat advanced novice who knows some words like "aperture" without fully understanding how it works.  Just a regular guy who likes to play at taking pictures.This camera is simple to use and produces good images decently quickly.  Personally, I don't see much of a difference between the quality level of the major manufacturers at this price point, so I say it's a good idea to head to some place where you can put your hands on each model, see which one feels right to you, and has a user interface you prefer.The form factor is great.  It's no big deal to keep this camera on you all the time, slides in and out of pockets fairly easily since the only real protrusion is the zoom toggle, which also acts as a bezel for the shutter button, and it is nicely rounded so it does not catch easily.  The available buttons are easy to find by feel, with a small exception being the the Func. Set button, but that generally happens when you put a button in the middle of a circular pad.The interface is greatly simplified.  For the most part, you're trusting Canon's engineers to figure out and apply the proper variables to your pictures.  This is even true of the Program mode where you have more control, but many features for more fine control are locked away from the user.  For example, there are over a dozen different modes (such as "landscape", "fireworks", "portrait", etc.)  installed on this camera, and  you can only manually select a fraction of them.  Generally, this is no problem as the automated systems do a good job of selecting the proper settings, but generally does not equal always.For those of you who want more control, there is a firmware extension you can get called "CHDK" that will give you much more detailed control and does work on the Elph300HS.The video function, I can't really speak on because aside from one test video, I haven't bothered with it.  Obviously, I think it bears pointing out that if you plan on taking a decent amount of video at full 1080p, you need as large and as fast of a memory card as you can afford.  1080p video is *huge*.I'm perfectly happy with the image quality so far.  Most all of my bad pictures have been because I was playing with CHDK and did something wrong myself.  I've taken around 1,000 shots so far with this camera and have yet to come across anything that even gets me slightly annoyed at it.  It's not perfect, but no piece of technology is.  It gives good image quality, but not great image quality; however, that's a function of giving less than $200 for a camera.  For what this camera is, at the price it is, I'm satisfied.All of that said, to address some of the points frequently brought up about this camera:Textured casing--personally, I like it.  People refer to it as a sandpaper like consistency, which I guess is true if you're talking about an extremely fine grit sandpaper.Camera Breaking--I'll update my review if this happens and change the score accordingly. From reading on the internet, the issues with it physically breaking seem to happen much more with the Chinese made models than the Japanese ones.  I have a Japanese one, for whatever that's worth.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Michael B. Williams "kitsune_firefox"
Reviews.Content: I mostly use this to document my work so I'm not taking many shots of people. I've found the flash to overpowering, it tends to whitewash the pictures so I've turned it off.You'll need to get a memory card as it doesn't come with one and a decent case to keep the lens from collecting dust and scratching the back screen.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Bev Llewellyn
Reviews.Content: Main reason for buying the camera is because of the wide-angle lense.  Its small size is a plus, and it meets all my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: K. Adams
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera. It is tiny, lightweight. The pictures are great because I use the focus tracking almost all of the time. I want to make sure the focus is landing where I want it to.  Before I learned that I had a few slightly out of focus pictures.

Reviews.Title: Canon for Christmas, Girlfriend over-joyed. Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera (Black)I had an older Canon point-and-shoot product that I have used throughout my travels. It has many "battle" scars from all the traveling and being an older generation unit, was a bit bulky (especially when compared to this model). Long story short, my girlfriend loves taking pictures and I wanted to upgrade my old, trusty Canon to a newer generation one since my older one was definitely showing its age.This camera completely blew me away at all the options it has included and of course the great quality of the pictures it takes (true to the Canon name). The camera is slim and comfortable to hold and operate. My girlfriend absolutely loves all the camera settings you can fiddle with. You can do typical things like sepia and b/w pictures, but also many other things like accent colors and even a "toy"/old camera look (similar look to pictures taken with instagram app for smartphones). This little point-and-shoot has it all. Even HD video recording and slow-motion video (no sound but that makes sense, as why would you want to hear slow sounds as well, at least in my opinion).

Reviews.Title: Canon powershot elph 300
Reviews.Author: Wine-0
Reviews.Content: Love the camera and for the price I would buy again. Easy to use for the average photo person. Have not used the video yet but pictures are great. Took it on a rough sea day trip in Hi. whale watching and even with all the salt spray it was harder to keep my sunglasses clean than the camera.

Reviews.Title: quality
Reviews.Author: Debbie
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera yesterday and the first few pictures I took didn't turn out very well, one of them is an outside shot of the trail we walk every day and the bottom half of the picture is brown.  A couple other pictures are super tiny and the camera said unidentified object.  Some have shadows on the bottom half of the picture has anyone else had this problem?

Reviews.Title: My travel companion
Reviews.Author: Parker Hallam
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend's were in a hurry to buy a digital camera as my old one gave way and we were headed for a trekking adventure. I do not want to miss out on the outdoor shots.I did not do any research, , just zeroed on Canon Powershot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP camera just for the confidence I had in Canon. The Canon ELPH 300 HS came with 5x optical zoom lens that offers optical image stabilization technology which mean I need not worry about shaken images. I was able to shoot in HD quality 1080p.The response time was faster and I realized that it was because of Canon's DIGIC 4 processor. Reviewing shots was simple and it is coming for sure for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Chris Campbell
Reviews.Content: Personnally I like this camera - it is small & takes great photos. The only problem is we had to return the first one we ordered because it died within two months of ordering it. Amazon was great though and swapped it for another one, no questions asked. We are keeping our fingers crossed that the new one will keep working.

Reviews.Title: Good, not great
Reviews.Author: n0ne
Reviews.Content: I admit I have limited experience with these small cameras. It's a great size, easy to hold and shoot with, so no complaints there. I just wish it had a higher zoom. The picture quality is definitely better than what appears on the the digital screen so withhold judgement on that until you bring them up on your computer or have them printed. Overall happy, just not ecstatic.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Maggie H. "MAGS"
Reviews.Content: Haven't even charged the battery yet, but I was very pleased by features so far.  First of all, love how tiny the camera is, second, very easy to register.  Didn't have to search for numbers as the card had them printed out (I registered online), third the instruction manual (very thin and easy) was separated from other languages.  These things make a huge difference to me.  Seems user friendly so far.  Will update if I find out otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Close-up camera
Reviews.Author: derrick
Reviews.Content: Great compact camera for close up pictures. I'm a real estate broker and bought it for getting large views of interior house pictures in tight areas and it does fine.This is a wide angle camera built for capturing alot of the scene from close up. I wouldn't buy this camera if you are looking for something that zooms out to bring things close in for the picture because it does zoom out very far. Best for taking pictures of friends & family, to display your work, or for showing something to sell or show others- this is the better use for this camera.The video works real good but i had to set it down to 720 to stream it on my computer- the picture and sound was still very good at 720. My computer is older so maybe a newer one would stream higher def? You can always play back high def using the camera and displaying it on your computer/tv screen if you want higher def; but I prefer to download the camera and keep the memory cleaned out.

Reviews.Title: canon powershot
Reviews.Author: pat
Reviews.Content: Love it.  Easy to use. Great photos both up close and distant. Love the small size. Well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: Perfect device for the price
Reviews.Author: JM
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that had more options then your average smartphone camera.  On a budget, this camera proved a great option.  Great low light view, fast on/off process, great clarity on the shots.  Video very well. Sound quality was loud and clear.  I would definitely recommend this device for the amateur looking to capture day.

Reviews.Title: Really like this little camera.
Reviews.Author: Bobby L. Tefft
Reviews.Content: This is a sweet little camera.  The main reason I bought it was to snap photos through a microscope.  I teach BIOL 1111 and 1112 in our community technical college and wanted to show my students the actual slides they would be using.  I insert them into a PowerPoint presentation.I bought a device to attach to the scope, which will hold the Canon 300.  However, I have been really pleased in that I can hold this camera at the eyepiece and take pictures by hand.  Right now the pix are still on the SD card, but I plan to post some later.I played around with the movie mode and am really happy with the quality of the video.  It would rival my little camcorder, only the Canon 300 doesn't have a viewfinder.Anyway, it is just what I wanted.Bobby

Reviews.Title: The perfect point and shoot camera for me
Reviews.Author: Dpad16
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to replace my 5 year old Sony camera with a Canon since it seemed easier to use.  So after almost a year of reading reviews, I finally made the decision to buy this camera as a Christmas gift to myself.  I am glad that I bought this camera.It takes really good pictures on auto mode and is small enough to use with just one hand.  I lost the wrist strap but I'm not worried about dropping the camera.  The sandpaper-like texture of this camera provides just the right grip.Though it can shoot 12megapixel photos, I set it only at 2 megapixels since my photos are mostly for posting online.I love that the battery charger is compact, with no long cords.

Reviews.Title: Great portable camera
Reviews.Author: Alexander Bosworth
Reviews.Content: This camera is very small and great for when you're on the go and don't want to lug around a big DSLR. Sometimes I feel it can be a bit difficult to hold the camera because of its size and texture but it definitely fulfills the purpose of portability and quality that I was searching for. I was also very impressed with the variety of settings this little camera holds.Overall I would definitely recommend this product to those looking for a decent portable camera.

Reviews.Title: Quick and Easy
Reviews.Author: Jim White "Jimmy Bones"
Reviews.Content: I got what I ordered. It came more quickly than I expected. Make sure you understand that for some of these camera's you need to also order or have a memory chip. Because I had serious surgery immediately before Christmas, we have not been able to go out and buy the chip, so I really can't comment on the quality of the camera itself, but it had many good reviews online.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with purchase
Reviews.Author: BobT
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my son who seemed very pleased with camera's features.  I was pleased with the price.  Was impressed with the camera's compact size.

Reviews.Title: bar room video will do works well in low light
Reviews.Author: lane
Reviews.Content: low light video will do.The wideangle lense will let u do video in low light.marry unit with magnet trypod $30 set for 640x480camera will record for 59minutes.  set it and forget itI use my camera for dance shots, [...]in this vedio 945-5 Genda-David,Leba-Elaina,Ralph-Lynn,Cathrine,Jenny,Melanie-HatMan,Jeanie-Lane.wmvthe camera was hung upside down and left on for an hour. using the windows editor that came with my laptop select picture rotate then picture rotate again and the video is right side up.  it works greatu must leave the zoom on full wide angle. in low light conditions the light through the lens is very restricted when zoom to telephoto.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera
Reviews.Author: J. C. Liang "Cheungkinmen"
Reviews.Content: It's just great how easy it works. We love the compact size as it fits in any pockets. Recommended for travelers.

Reviews.Title: Best deal ever.
Reviews.Author: Bob Obb
Reviews.Content: Basically, with the Canon 300 you can take a picture of a pile of trash and it will look beautiful. Auto mode without flash is all most people will ever need to take a great picture, but you can also have some real fun with the various special effects - right now my favorites are fish eye, miniature, and vivid. And don't even get me started on the video! The 1080p quality is amazing (especially outdoors), and the 240fps videos can be really interesting.Build quality is great. The camera feels heavy and there's a textured finish for better grip. Button layout is perfect. The lens is amazing - 24mm wide angle in something this size? You'd be crazy to pass it up!It feels great to have so much functionality in something smaller than my smartphone, which regardless of what some people say will not be replacing the point and shoot camera anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Bruno "Bruno"
Reviews.Content: This is a very functional, very compact camera that is well built. It was a gift for my wife who had an older EL:PH that she gave to our daughter. This one has the benefit of more pixels, full HD, and annotated menus -- the last one is a nice feature. This camera also has a slightly rough surface compared to the smooth finish of the last ELPH, which makes it easier to hold (less likely to slip). I also got an excellent Cyber Monday price on it.

Reviews.Title: College Fun
Reviews.Author: P. Tang
Reviews.Content: Great camera to take around especially for college students. I needed to copy some papers, but had not scanners. Work fantastic!Takes really good quality photos esp portraits!

Reviews.Title: My daughter loves it
Reviews.Author: Vincent Natale
Reviews.Content: My daughter loves it.  we got if for her for a trip to europe.  so far it is a big hit.  I hope it lasts the whole trip!

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: lope
Reviews.Content: Great camera Very easy to use and small enough to take anywhere  this is a great camera to add so you don't need to lug the SLR around.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied
Reviews.Author: dotrock
Reviews.Content: I've have always been pleased with the Cannon cameras I have purchased and this one is no exception. Takes quality picture and is small in size. Great for carrying in your pocket. I am well pleased with price and shipping time from Amazon also.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: Christmas gift for my parents, they LOVED it! Lowest price anywhere! Free shipping. Nice little camera! Small, lightweight, great quality. Nice new lithium (plug in) battery pack!

Reviews.Title: Nice Compact Camera
Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: This camera so far and been everything I expected and more.  The textured feel of the casing is quality and helps eliminate the camera from slipping out of the hands.  The overall picture and HD video quality is very good for this category of cameras.  The only thing that I would change with this camera is to have a higher resolution LCD which shows the true quality of the images that are taken.  For a pocket point and shoot this camera is perfect and offers enough useful settings for making image adjustments based on personal needs and wants.

Reviews.Title: A fine upgrade!
Reviews.Author: Paul
Reviews.Content: I like keeping my wife equipped with the tools she needs for her interests in life. She is a world class doll maker (On Etsy -- maineartisen). She needed to take pictures for posting her Waldorf dolls and the previous Canon had an articulated screen but less than stellar image quality. This camera changes that and it is so portable she can keep it on her person when she is out among her beloved Nigerian goats. As they say, the best camera is the one you have with you. Quality of this sort in this form factor is what progressive technology is all about. She loves it!

Reviews.Title: small compact, and ready to shoot
Reviews.Author: haruman "haruman"
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to put my 2 cents on this. I originally wanted to purchase this to replace my S95, but comparing the pictures, the S95 always delivers better indoor pictures. The quality of the outdoor pictures are the same for both. There is slight better telephoto on the 300HS, but usually I don't use it at full telephoto. You get severe pin-cushioning on this small camera.Nonetheless, I think I'll keep both and perhaps use this one on my outdoor trips since it will get more abuse. It's definitely much slimmer, and more pocketable, though, I'd get a case for it. You really only have two choices from the canon line which is the psc-55 and the psc-1000. Do not get the psc-1050 as it will not fit. You may also want to go cheaper and just get a sleeve. You can purchase something like this from the palm pre line. It's a soft cloth that fits this camera perfectly. It also acts as cloth to polish your camera too.[...]I will say though, with this camera, you better have a steady hand for your indoor shots, still, a better value currently than compared to the newer 310HS which doesn't provide much more in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera For the Price - Beware of Amazon incentives, though
Reviews.Author: T. Gibbons
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons I bought this little camera was because of its reputation for taking good pictures in low light conditions.  And it indeed does an awesome job of it.  I can get pictures of the deer in my yard at night through the window with only the porch light on (no flash), and they turn out great.My only complaint has nothing to do with the camera itself.  Amazon offered Corel VideoStudio Pro X4 Ultimate or Corel Paintshop Pro X4 for only $9.99 as a reward when I bought this camera.  They sent a link in an email to use for this offer.  I never could get the link to work - kept taking me to some "error" page.  So it was a bit like false advertisement to me!!

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300
Reviews.Author: Chuck
Reviews.Content: I am most pleased with my Canon Powershot ELPH 300.  This is the second  Canon Powershot that I have purchased the past few years.  It does a superb job with quality pictures.  It is lightweight and easy to carry and very quick and easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot Elph 300 HS
Reviews.Author: Aniket Maindarkar
Reviews.Content: After going through multiple cameras (Canon EOS, Nikon point and shoot, and others), I fell in love with the Elph 300. It takes brilliant pictures across all environments - in low light, action (kids playing soccer and running), evenings, snow, sun, etc. Its also compact enough to fit into my pocket and I would recommend this to anyone looking for a family camera with great prints.

Reviews.Title: Canon does it again!
Reviews.Author: D. gallogly "danee"
Reviews.Content: I strayed from Canon and now I'm back and will never leave again.  I loved my first Canon Elph 10 years ago which was only a 2mp at the time (this one being a 12mp).  I've gone on to the larger powershots but always said I missed my little elph.  I love the texture of this one I'm not sure if it's just in the black model I got but it's a sandy rough texture.  The camera takes amazing pics and I love all the little features.  It's simple to use without even needing to go through the manual and takes amazing pictures!!Thanks Canon!

Reviews.Title: What a deal!!
Reviews.Author: W P N
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace my old Canon S80, I like the S80 and the great quality pics it produces but it is too bulky and it was becoming an inconvenience and the 300 HS is a quality camera packed into a sleek body that I can easily slip into any pocket.  I keep the S80 for the stadium and family get togethers, but the ELPH 300 will be my everyday and traveling camera.Most Canon cameras take great shots, but what is most impressive about this camera is its low-light capabilities. Indoor night shots without the flash come out amazingly crisp, the autofocus is quite impressive as it tracks faces in the frame, the menu functions are quite intuitive, and it's got plenty of preset shooting modes, and fast between shots for a Point and shoot.I also compared the 1080p video. The video quality is excellent with the 300 HS, low-light video is slightly grainy but good, in the daylight the video comes out great, and is easy to import into computer files.I did purchase an extra battery after reading battery life can be short. I've had the camera a since Cyber Monday ($129.00 w/4G SD card, case, and $10.00 gift card) and have used it daily without a need to recharge yet. One of the best days of my life.I'd recommend the black body as it has a lightly rough textured finish that makes holding this small camera much easier.Overall, considering the excellent quality of the camera, easy portability, and great price, this camera is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: very Good
Reviews.Author: sonali "Sonali"
Reviews.Content: I have been using canon camera's since long and this was my 2nd digicam as i lost the earlier one.this is a very good camera,sleek and handy easy to carry.Pictures are amazing. If you want a good camera within $200-250 go for this !!!I like the Auto and Program mode which can be easily shifted as needed.For taking pictures at night i keep the program mode ready by selecting night mode,while capturing pics in night mode be sure to wait untill the Busy bar gets finished. this is the one feature which i found a little annoying as after taking pic you have to keep camera in standby till the Busy bar is stopped, rest all features are good.

Reviews.Title: Great product at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Circe
Reviews.Content: I got the red finish for about $150 (on sale) and I love it!  You can't beat the price.  This is a point and shoot camera for sure, but it is so compact to carry around.  I have been capturing photos of my son around the house and took it to NY and DC.  I usually carry a DSLR, but with my toddler, it is very hard to manage. This camera is easy to carry and easy to whip out.  It takes fast, sharp pictures indoors and out.  I am really pleased with the video function as well.  I am still learning about it, but so far I would highly recommend it especially at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice point and shoot
Reviews.Author: H.M
Reviews.Content: I just love it,I'm canon fan and i think this is one of great point and shoot camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Easy-to-Use, Takes Great Pictures/Video!
Reviews.Author: jj
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's a great small size, it is very easy-to-use, and takes really great pictures!We bought it as a family camera to take home videos and snapshots of the kids.I love that the battery pack is rechargeable! I was constantly blowing through AA batteries on my previous digital Cannon camera.For only $199.00, you get a LOT of camera. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Simply superbbb
Reviews.Author: Vinoth Kumar
Reviews.Content: Simply Superb Camera which suits for girls much better due to its looks. I would surely suggest this camera to my friends who are planning on buying a point and shoot cam.

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Landero
Reviews.Content: Just what makes a non-professional look really good. This is our second Canon and we continue to enjoy wonderful pictures despite not knowing much about why they turn out so well.

Reviews.Title: small, lightweight, easy point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: camhammiam
Reviews.Content: Like advertised and some other reviews say, this camera is very easy to use in its automatic mode.  I have gone from taking landscape pictures to portraits to closeup of flowers and they all turn out great without ever pressing any buttons.  Just aim, focus, and shoot.  If it focuses on the wrong thing, just try again and it usually gets what I'm trying to focus on for the shot.  The movies it makes are really nice compared to my last camera (5 years old).  Plays great on my new laptop.Some negative points: I can't figure out how to force the flash yet (had it one month).  People on the edge of the photo are distorted (slight horizontal stretch of the image).  I'm not sure why that should be.  All my other cameras didn't have that issue.  The movies don't play well on older computers - although I have the movie setting on highest quality full HD, so that is understandable.  These are fairly minor negatives in my opinion.Other than that, nice basic versatile camera that goes along almost anywhere.  Good deal for $230.

Reviews.Title: I love Canons
Reviews.Author: D. Feng
Reviews.Content: I don't really have a good technical reason for why I love Canons, I just do. If you're looking for the technical comparison of this versus other cameras, go to cnet.com for the review.I like that this camera is so sleek, nice and sturdy feeling. I had a Canon for a while that I ended up breaking by dropping. The shutter stopped working. So, then I got a Sony, which is having problems with the controls. For some reason I never really got into the Sony, not that there was any wrong with it. I guess I just liked my first camera. So, I'm back and reunited with a newer and better version of my first love, the Canon.

Reviews.Title: Performs as advertised
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: It's a very nice little camera, seems intuitive to use, takes very good pictures. My wife and I are both very happy with it to this point.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: 2 kids, 2 pets
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my 11-year old daughter who is into taking & editing video.  She's found iteasy to use with excellent video quality.  And of course, it takes great photos, too!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 300
Reviews.Author: Jenn
Reviews.Content: Prior to ordering this camera, I was using a Canon Powershot SD850 IS. I had no problems with this camera but the weight of it plus the carrying case it was in..made me not want to take it anywhere. The Canon Powershot ELPH 300 is lightweight and thin. It takes a little while to get used to the settings but I guess that's what the manual's for. Overall, I like the new camera and I'm glad I purchased it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Brittne
Reviews.Content: I'm a vlogger on Youtube and needed a high quality hd camera to carry around with me at all times. This camera was perfect and the quality is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Graduation Gift
Reviews.Author: Glass Gryphon
Reviews.Content: We gave this to our nephew as a graduation gift and he loved it. He took it overseas on a trip and the pictures turned out great.  One thing to keep in mind though (found this out the hard way since I've never purchased a camera), the memory card is not included.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Craig J
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this camera after doing lots of research and reading all the various reviews online and I've been very happy with it.  It is very small and easy to carry around.  I got the black version with the "sandpaper" finish on it and although i was a bit leery about it I have really grown to like it.  I've read some of the other reviews on here regarding picture quality, etc and for what you are buying it takes great pictures...the flash goes quick and the shutter speed is more then fast enough.  If you are buying this and comparing to DSLR camera quality you'll never be able to hope to compare picture quality...but remember if you want that extra bit of quality then buy a DSLR and not this.  For point and shoot cameras it is quite nice.  The functions are easy to understand and operate, although the little manual you get with the camera doesn't go over some of the more manual functions.  But you can easily go online to Cannon and get the full manual version.If you are looking for a higher quality point and shoot camera that is above the basic $100 base version type then you will like this.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Hutchings
Reviews.Content: You get some much to play with in this camera! This is the best consumer digital camera upgrade I've ever made. Canon is head & shoulders above the competition in this price range & size. I live in NYC and wanted a small camera I could carry around in my pocket to take pictures or video whenever I find anything cool instead of using my phone and this camera does the trick nicely.The HD video quality in a camera so small is amazing, but of course the sound quality is lacking, so I usually combine video with my Zoom recorder for better audio. Nothing beats this camera and I tried many of them before settling on this one! The software that come with the camera is pretty cool, too. I also love that it's small and feels sturdy!  **The only issue with the black camera is the buttons can make it difficult to review photos in very low light , so maybe they could focus on making it more ergonomic in that way. Ya know, give the "FUNC.SET" group of buttons some texture or something, so you can feel them in low light conditions. I'm thinking canon could add to budget to have the text raised to give the buttons some relief with the profit they are making on this great camera. Also flash photos you will sometimes have a lightly darker area in the lower right corner of the frame. Move the flash to the right side of the camera please!**That's my 2 cents!

Reviews.Title: great little camera
Reviews.Author: Wayne Mitzner "wmitz"
Reviews.Content: This camera replaced an old Casio.  It does everything much better, from the easy menu, to the great movies (with good sound), to excellent photos.  I know there are some reviewers who say the image chip isn't as high quality as the Leica or Panasonic, but i would bet the price of a Leica that no one could tell the difference in a 4x6 snapshot.  If you want higher resolution for enlargements get a bigger camera, but for carrying around in a pocket, this one is hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: TheGrandMarkE
Reviews.Content: I have only used this a while, but it appears to be a great little camera. Seems to take very good pictures and good video. I like the ability to zoom while shooting video. Much handier than my Canon Powershot G5, which is admittedly dated and not a fair comparison. I suspect many of the modern cameras are as good as this one, but one feature I was really looking for was the zoom while shooting video, which seems to be rare among today's cameras. This unit is very small, which is great for a pocket or purse.

Reviews.Title: Canon Elf review
Reviews.Author: fafarm
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12 MP CMOS Digital Camera with Full 1080p HD Video (Red)I simply love my new camera. I bought it to go on vacation with my family and carried it with me all the time. I have some wonderful photos to reinforce my memories. Canon, thanks for always standing for quality! Amazon, you are the greatest, too!fafarm

Reviews.Title: Awesome pics/video
Reviews.Author: Steve-O
Reviews.Content: My little brother was very excited to get this camera. The pictures and videos he's produced with this camera look pretty amazing. Very vibrant and sharp. A great canon camera!

Reviews.Title: Canon Powsershot
Reviews.Author: Dorinda Mckenzie
Reviews.Content: This camera took a little getting used to because you have to hold the button down longer for the picture to take than my previous camera.  I debated getting this camera or a more expensive SLR.  My niece had a lower and older model and it took such good pictures I decided to get this one.  I am really happy with the low light pictures.  For the price I think this is a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Great Pocket Camera
Reviews.Author: Carlos B.
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great deal if you are looking for a compact camera for travelling. It takes quality shots and has an amazing battery life.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: 2cheap2eat
Reviews.Content: Having owned Canon compact cameras in the past, I had high expectations for this camera.  It hasn't let me down!  The size and weight and battery life are all acceptable.  I liked the fact they used the same battery which allows me to use my old battery as a backup.The LCD screen is crystal clear and the menu navigation is very similar to older models.  The picture quality is amazing and the HD video is fantastic.  The sound quality isn't great for video, but that is due to the small mic and where it is placed.  Not a big deal for me.The only downside is the camera is a bit light, doesn't feel sturdy.  That is probably due to the compact size.  I dropped our last one which is my I had to buy a new one.  This one would probably end up the same way if dropped.  Also, the wrist string can't be tightened like on older models, that is odd.  The camera write strap can easily fall off your wrist without the tightener.I use this camera with a 32 Gig Class 10 memory card and it exceeds all my needs/expectations.  I'm not a professional by any means, if you are similar and wanting a great compact camera, this is the way to go.  For the price, it gives you the best picture and video quality in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera
Reviews.Author: teachnmo
Reviews.Content: This little camera is marvelous to take on vacation. Slip it into your pocket or purse and you are ready to take that spur of the moment picture. Don't dislike anything about it!

Reviews.Title: Crisp, Clear, and Comfortable
Reviews.Author: E. Sala
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera on sort of an impulse buy. I researched it for a couple weeks and was deciding between this one and the Canon PowerShot S90.I chose this model because I wanted the 1080 recording functionality, the slim size, and the ability to take pictures in a dark-ish setting.I tried this camera out in a local park for three hours and never lost a bar of battery, and my pictures are all crisp, clear, and gorgeous. I am in love with the colors of this camera. Great for beginners.The only con I see with it, is that I wish it were a touch screen.I will continue to use it, and will update if any problems or major mind-blowing features are discovered.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Lots of Features, good HD Video, but bad software
Reviews.Author: V. Nayak
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera! The pictures it takes are spectacular, and it literally fits in your shirt pocket. The main reason I bought it was to replace my bulky HD Camcorder, and I am very happy with the video quality and sound, even in relatively low light. On a 16 GB SDHC Card, it can fit about 1 hour of 1080P HD Video. It also has image stabilization, and a slow zoom (which is a good thing). The caveat is that the maximum length of each clip is about 15 minutes. Another caveat is that while you can zoom while taking video, the zooming motor sound can be heard in the  video. The one thing I did not like is the Software that came with the Camera. I replaced my old Canon software with this one, and this software is hard to use, and does not even have the features the old software used to have. But the Camera itself is excellent, and I highly recommended it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but why is there an error with my new SD card
Reviews.Author: Sean Pham "Cydonian Knight"
Reviews.Content: Overall great camera. I keep coming back to Canon for the same quality that I've trusted over the years.I am not sure if I made a blunder on my part, but I keep getting an error when I try to use my 8 GB SDHC card. It will not allow me to take any pictures. I have to use my old 1 GB card which works without any problems. Has anyone else run into this problem?

Reviews.Title: Canon just gets better and better.
Reviews.Author: AmazonLover
Reviews.Content: I have been a Canon camera user for a long time and this camera has made me so happy to continue with this company.  Takes pictures quickly with exceptional quality.  Good in low light.  I love that you can zoom while taking video now.  That was a great upgrade.  I used to own a photography company and I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Awsome camera
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: This little camera shoots amazing quality pictures. As a layman photographer who loves carrying it around on vacations and weekends, love that I can just stick it in my pocket, pull it out, and snap and shoot. Even great for close-ups in Macro mode. Easy to us, plug and play with windows machine. Love it!

Reviews.Title: amazing litle camera!
Reviews.Author: SCRAPPYHAPPY "LOVE TO SCRAPBOOK!"
Reviews.Content: Ok, this is a wonderful little camera!  I bought a Canon SD700IS about a year ago, and this was an upgrade from it.  It is wonderful!  I LOVE this camera! Much better images, better flash....slightly bigger than the other one, but still small. Bigger LCD screen, better button management....just overall a much better improvement! The pics are wonderful! LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Compact & Sturdy with Date Stamp
Reviews.Author: Natalia Peterson
Reviews.Content: Compact enough to fit in your pocket and a sturdy metal case so that you don't have to worry when you do.  It also has an option to put the Date Stamp right on the Picture, so you never forget when you took the picture.

Reviews.Title: Small, handy and take good photos
Reviews.Author: Ralph 965 "Ralph 965"
Reviews.Content: This is a small and handy camera.  I bought a cell phone case to put the camera in and clip on my belt.  The camera is not much bigger than a cell phone.  The quality of the photos are very good, compared to my other several cameras, including a Canon XSi.  The image may be a little soft, but OK for common use.  It is not much worse than my Canon XSi with the standard lens that come with the camera.  The only thing is that there is no manual adjustment.  But for the small size that I can easily carry it around, I am using it much more often than the other cameras.  Due to the small size, and hence the small battery, it is advisable to buy extra batteries for backup.  The generic batteries on Amazon for this camera are only a few dollars a piece.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: LMO
Reviews.Content: Love this camera.  The size is perfect.  The matte black makes it easy to hang on to.  Haven't had any pics printed yet, but they appear to be sharp on my computer. So far, no complaints here.

Reviews.Title: Good things come in small packages
Reviews.Author: Kimplex
Reviews.Content: Lost this camera in the airport a few days ago.  I've enjoyed it SO much that I ordered the same camera again.  I have a Nikon D70s that I rarely use anymore, simply because this Canon is so easy to carry around.  I also have an older model, the Canon PowerShot SD1400 IS which pales in comparison.  I am extremely pleased with this product.

Reviews.Title: Best camera of this class. Period.
Reviews.Author: Bighugeg
Reviews.Content: Well, its better than the Nikon coolpix 3100 that I retuned.  The Nikon did cost me $135 , so I cannot bash it too much just because of the  price.  The biggest quality is the clarity of the HD video, every detail can be seen ,  and yes you can optically zoom while  recording.  Not  like the Nikon which could only digitally zoomed.  Unlike the Nikon, the footage didn't loose quality  while zooming. ( Digital zoom decrease quality on both , pictures and videos )It also  takes great pictures , I know , Isn't that supposed to be the  priority lolMy biggest issue is that it takes a lot of memory for the full HD.  If you don't have at least a 16 GB, you might reconsider  recording in full HD.  I am talking about 555 MB for a 2:07 seconds videos. Yes , you read that right, 555 Megabytes for a two minutes and seven seconds full HD video.  I have two Sandisks SDHC class 10 , one 4GB and one 16GB, the 4GB was almost full before I knew it .  For  Those of you who  are wondering, yes it is fast , nowhere near like a rapid shooting SLR  camera, but with the class 10 , you will get the best for your  money. I was getting  2 second lag between shots.  It was perfect for me although some people might consider that as very slow . Compared to the Nikon I returned , that was a great improvement just in that area,  the Nikon was Slower.Also a little advice, not all SDHC class 10 are the same. From my researches (please forgive me if I am wrong) I could only find one brand that could do 30 MB/S maximum and it was Sandisk.  At least on Amazon .Update: If you turn the preview off, it will take up to a second for the camera to be ready between shots.  It now feels like a rapid fire SLR. Buy his camera, you won't be disappointed .

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Deb
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take pictures of my daughter's first Prom.  Very nice, easy to use, took better pictures than our Canon Rebel.  Very vivid pictures. No delay, took photos very quickly. I did buy a scandisk extreme 8G card.  My co-workers asked what kind of camera I used, the pictures were so nice. I am very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: ELPH 300
Reviews.Author: Patricia S. Bergstresser
Reviews.Content: This camera does everyhting they promised, the slow-mo is cool, but the relolution is much lower then the HD regular video. So far am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Did not live up to expectations...
Reviews.Author: Enzo99
Reviews.Content: I had this for a few months before I sold it.  Granted this is a P&S;, but I expected this camera to take images at least as good as my 2008 Lumix FX500.  It does not.  I thought most of my images were out of focus but now I think it just takes very soft images.  It applies way too much noise reduction which I think leads to the softness, but also in some of my images the subjects, whether they be people, foliage, etc., appear fake and smooth-like.  The images also have a general feeling of haziness with the colors muted.  I really don't know what was going on and how Canon could make such a bad camera.  I tested all settings and experimented with the limited manual control and nothing made it better.  I am giving Canon another shot and since purchased an S100.  I immediately noticed the images were much better, albeit at a different price point.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Johnny
Reviews.Content: After all the good reviews we read, we finally decided on this one.  I've always had Canon's and love them.  We've been trying to replace our 6 year old Canon Powershot A620.  It's 7.1 Megapixel, the pictures are great, but it's a little slow and it's also bulky.  We tried a Lumix last year and even though it was a 12 megapixel camera, the shots were not coming out as sharp as our old Canon.  So we returned it.  We decided to give this Elph a try.  What we liked:  the small size, the quick shots, and lots of neat features.  What we didn't like...once again, the old Canon's shots were coming our sharper.  Hard to believe.  We did some more reading and found that these higher megapixels compacts don't always mean sharp shots.  Now we are returning this one too.

Reviews.Title: 7 yr. old Olympus 4MP camera has given me much much better results
Reviews.Author: Old Fashioned
Reviews.Content: As many others have pointed, I really don't understand why this camera is getting such high rating. Either people haven't seen better (I've a hard time believing this) or they have forgotten and got used to these days' low standards.I bought Olympus C4000 - 4 MP - camera in 2004 Apr. It has produced amazing results. Very rarely it used to let me down, if at all. It had no optical image stabilization either.Contrast that with Elph 300 with 3 times higher res. and optical IS. Out of my first 68 shots, only 2 or 3 turned out really crisp. I don't have time to debug why it didn't produce better results. Off it goes back to the vendor (note that I didn't buy it from Amazon).Really, really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: One Year Review of Elph 300 HS
Reviews.Author: Marty
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera now for a year, and here are my thoughts:1)  Nice and compact, I can wear it around my neck (neck strap not included, you must find one separately) all day and not notice the weight.2)  You can't take a pic unless you have a camera, and you don't have to worry about the weight making you keep it at home.3)  The black paint wears off a lot over time, exposing bare metal underneath. I originally wanted a silver model, but the store didn't have it in stock. I would NEVER buy a black camera again, the re-sale value from the chipped paint would be zero, I think.4)  Picture quality is not up to par with bigger-lens point and shoots or SLRs. But again, unless you have a camera on you, you can't take a pic.5)  The focus accuracy is good in pic mode. In video mode, it's poor, for the lens will seek out the correct focus and go in and out of focus. If you're taking an important video, leave this camera at home. I have an older Canon point and shoot (A620) and the focus is excellent in video mode. If video focus is important, don't buy this camera. The focus problem exists whether recording or simply using it as a live monitor feed.6)  Dust gets inside the lens and you'll get dark spots on every image, more so when you zoom in. Since the camera is now out of warranty, I opened the camera up, moved the LCD upwards, unscrewed the image sensor, and cleaned the clear plastic that covers the lens with a Q-tip. The big spots are gone now, but little ones remain. My A620 has no spots at all, and it's many years old. I had a Sony point and shoot years ago and that too had a dust problem. I might buy the Sony with the fixed lens (the one where the cover slides upwards and downwards) to help avoid dust problems.7)  The 24 mm (if memory serves) equiv. zoom gives nice wide-angle shoots, but there is distortion. That was to be expected.So would I buy it again? Well, all in all, I would likely have another look at competing choices.

Reviews.Title: Camera operates great, case feels flimsy
Reviews.Author: Technomadia
Reviews.Content: I've been a long time lover of Canon point and shoots, and this is my third.However, immediately out of the box - this camera just felt cheaper than my others (I'm replacing a Canon SD780 that I used for a couple of years). It feels more plastic-y, flimsy and the buttons less integrated. Trusting in Canon's reputation for quality I proceeded to unpackaging the rest of the accessories and charged up the battery.I at first bought the red case version after looking at the black version on display. I was disappointed that the red doesn't have the rubberized finish of the black.  And then was more disappointed that after just a few minutes of navigating menus and checking it out, I noticed a huge scratch on the camera. I don't recall bumping it, dropping it or doing anything that should produce such a huge scratch.  So I wrapped it up and took it back and got it exchanged for the black case version.  I'm hoping I just got a defective coating on that one, but do be cautious of the camera's finish if you opt for a colored one.I've been using the black case version since May 2011, and have been pretty happy with it. The wider angle lens as compared to my SD780 is definitely nice.  And I am able to get better shots in low light conditions. All and all tho, I consider this a transitional camera that I'll upgrade to something else soon enough. After just a few months of use, I feel ready for something better.

Reviews.Title: Very disappointed
Reviews.Author: Texasbluesplayer
Reviews.Content: Well I bought one of these on sale at Staples since they had a 20% off all Canon non-DSLRs. I wanted this to replace my old Canon SD 1300 that someone stole. This Elph 300 HS looks really nice, great feel, nice LCD in the back and takes great photos outside during the day. However, indoors it's just a mess. I took this to a birthday party, set it to AUTO and took pics but the people's faces looked really yellowish/orange and weird. Its like the camera didn't know what type of light I was shooting in. My old one did just fine and it was an older model. If I started tweaking in the P-mode and set the lighting and the ISO and a bunch of settings then the photos came out almost normal. I shouldn't have to do all that. I just want a camera to take decent pictures and not make people's faces orange in AUTO mode. It also has a hard time focusing. Seriously, your pictures will mostly look blurry indoors. Which is weird since this is supposed to be a low light camera. It can't even focus right. Look at all the great reviews this has.....from OUTDOOR pictures. You'll be surprised when you start taking pics with this and it sucks. I ended up taking the camera back. Now I'm looking for the older models since they appear to take better pictures but don't do HD video. That's okay though because I want a camera for the pictures!! I hope this will help you avoid making a big mistake thinking newer is better.

Reviews.Title: lens cover broke twice
Reviews.Author: W. Shackleford
Reviews.Content: Shortly after I bought the ELPH 300HS, the lens cover wouldn't close. I had to push it closed with my finger. so, I sent it back and they quickly sent me a refurbished one. After using that one time, the lens cover broke again. This time I had to push the lens cover open with my finger because half of it stayed shut when I turned on the camera. So, I sent that back again for another factory reconditioned camera which I ended up selling it 50 dollars less then I originally paid. I've owned two other Canon SD/Elph model cameras and never had any problems with those.The photo quality was pretty good. not much improvement over their previous models. the best thing about this camera is the size and user interface. very fun and easy to use. too bad about the lens thing.

Reviews.Title: Bought it for myself...twice!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "L.P."
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera back in april and again today.  2 weeks ago my family was on vacation and when walking down to the lake, I began to fall.  I had to let something go and my options were: my daughter or this camera.  So I let the camera go...flying into the lake. :( luckily, I was able to retrieve all the photos off the card but the camera was dead.  Note: water and sand do NOT mix well with this camera. :)~Anyway, this is my 3rd canon and I will never buy another brand for my point-n-shoot.  It is the best for low light (indoors) and moving subjects (my kids).  Add in the new HD video and the slow motion (son playing t-ball for the first time; daughter walking for the first time) and this camera is THE camera for parents!!  You just can't get everything canon gives you for this price.I almost upgraded to the 500 this round...but $50 wasn't quite worth it to me for the touch-screen (though that sounds like a great feature...the way our phones are now).  The new video feature that takes 4 seconds around each of your photos and creates an automatic "day" slideshow for you sounds pretty cool but I'm already running low on space on my card since I don't instantly transfer pics to my computer.Also, the battery length was getting listed as 'con' for that camera (I'm assuming because of the touch screen) and that is one thing I love about this camera.  I can take photos on and off all day for over a week before I am reminded "oh ya, remember to charge the battery before our trip this weekend."  But I have never had a fully-charged battery fail me on an entire weekend long trip.This is one amazing camera in the tiniest package yet.  And if you get the black one, the exterior has a nice, rugged texture.I would recommend this for any family member or friend...and you know I love it when I spend another $200 for the exact same camera less than 5 months later.  It just can't be beat!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera
Reviews.Author: Rene' Carter "Princess"
Reviews.Content: I never liked this camera. It did not focus correctly, or snap fast enough. The flash did not flash when it was supposed to. Dark pictures, blurry, just hated it. It cracked and I threw it away.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Ibrahim
Reviews.Content: The super slow motion is not in HD, was disappointed in that. But its one of the highest quality cameras for its price. The screen scratches very easily and it also cracked even though I'm very delicate and careful with all my cameras.Would not buy again. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great features, but not as durable as I would have hope for.
Reviews.Author: Quoc
Reviews.Content: Great camera with lots of options. I bought this for my girlfriend as she needed one for one of her mission trips. The camera took beautiful photos with great features such as miniatures, macrophotography, and all of the typical functions you'd fine on a normal camera.The material is matte, which makes it looks very slick and nice. Easy to hold with very good grips. However, it was unable to withstand our trip. After the trip, the camera rotating knob that allows you to select different mode works. It is now forever stuck on Auto mode, luckily.Overall, great product. Would buy it again if its a bit cheaper as there are many options out there that are much less expensive than this one.

Reviews.Title: Lasted one year
Reviews.Author: happy_dad
Reviews.Content: Bought the Canon ELPH 300 HS and after one year, the unit started powering down as soon as it was turned on. Not damaged. Tried new battery. No error messages. Canon service said only recourse was sending it for a repair costing more than the Camera. First Canon was an A1 and never had any issues with the brand until now. Good pictures until it quit. Have had better luck with Nikon or Olympus compact cameras.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: fusionhg
Reviews.Content: I am a loyal Canon customer. I got this camera as a beater-camera to replace an older elph, which I dropped in the driveway on a snowy day after taking great pictures of my kids playing... This was intended to be one to throw in diaper bags and pockets for quick, cute, casual shots. I've been disappointed by the quality of the pictures since I got it. At first, I blamed it on myself, but my cell phone pictures are wonderful, as are my DSLR pics, so I'm now blaming the camera. After several years, I don't even bother to bring the camera with me, it just sits on a shelf. I'd rather have no pictures than the blurry ones this camera provides. I used the auto setting for a while and then played around with the more specific settings, thinking that would help. This camera does not meet my expectations and has disappointed me since I got it.

Reviews.Title: Great outdoors, terrible indoors.
Reviews.Author: carol a mcveigh
Reviews.Content: I just used this camera to take pictures of my hikes in Canyonlands national Park, the Needles.  It takes great outdoor photos, true to life color, great focus and definition, and it's small, so it fits easily into your pocket.  I would recommend this camera for outdoor pictures. But, indoor photos are a different story.  I am very disappointed with the camera's performance.  It is so slow to focus that when I can finally take the snap-shot the moment has passed, and I get an unwanted, terrible  photo. And, it takes a few seconds before it can take a second photo.  I got this to take photos  of my new puppy, and it is practically useless!!  I have to use my 8 year old Canon instead.  I do not recommend this camera for indoor use at all.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Carol Shields
Reviews.Content: Great value, easy to use, and far better than expectations.  I thought that with the price that it was going to be a cheap knock off.  But it turned out to be a great useable product!

Reviews.Title: Purchased as a gift
Reviews.Author: Mayra Feliu
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a good friend of mine for Christmas and she loves the camera. It's easy to use and takes great photos.

Reviews.Title: High quality at an excellent price
Reviews.Author: Daniel Newman
Reviews.Content: After doing some research, I decided to purchase this camera. Easy to use, great quality, and a low price make this a winner.

Reviews.Title: given as gift
Reviews.Author: Ray Kump
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Xmas, it seemed like a nice unit but unfortunately I have not heard anything about its performance. It was quite small however it had many features and I have always liked canon products. I'm guessing it works great and is a solid product...

Reviews.Title: Too smart for thin skin
Reviews.Author: Brian Nelson
Reviews.Content: I've owned a lot of cameras over the years including several SD1100IS Canon's for quick use, great shot photos. Stepping up to the 300HS for HD quality and more options I find an undependable little camera which I thought would do a better job. Much of my time is spent wondering if I made a mistake in camera selections for the best shot or was it the camera which reacted to slow or inappropriately to the scene being filmed. Much of what I receive back from my photo shoots are blurry and I find the camera having a hard time selecting the perfect focus. Doesn't matter what camera setting I use, always the same results. I can never depend on the crisp, clear photo or video I am after. Instead of thinking about through the photo composure, I worry about the scene being out of focus. I'm tired of that and very disappointed. The camera does a great job if left along for a few seconds, maybe up to 5 seconds to figure out what it's doing, and after that, your subject may be in focus, so I can only give a two star rating based on it's inability to act quickly and precisely.

Reviews.Title: Loved the camera...for 2 months
Reviews.Author: Shannon Young
Reviews.Content: I am not one to post reviews, but I feel like I need to post one about this camera given that it's a somewhat significant investment.  We bought this camera in July 2012 and loved it!  It was compact and took great pictures for a point and shoot.  Fast forward two months and the flash completely stopped working.  We emailed Canon and tried all of their suggestions, but it seems the flash is dead.....after only 2 months of use.

Reviews.Title: Love the the camera but get the warranty for the back screen!
Reviews.Author: ryman11
Reviews.Content: I love the camera but the back screen is pretty sensitive. The LCD on mine cracked within the first week and I didn't even drop it so it would be worth it to get the extended warranty for damages.

Reviews.Title: I hate this camera
Reviews.Author: Kitkat89
Reviews.Content: I previously had a canon sd 1100 8 mega pixels and it was great. When it broke from me dropping it one time in the sand I decided to get another canon since that one was so good. This one I've had since May and I can't seem to take any good pictures with it. No matter what setting I use portrait, night, nature, auto... they all don't come out in good quality. The color is odd and slightly off. People tend to look more orange than they should. the pictures when I upload them when u zoom in our very pixelated like a crappier version camera. I've tried changing the sizes of the pictures but they're still bad. I just think that this is way to much work when my last camera was awesome just pointing and shooting now real adjustment. Maybe its just me but I don't like this camera at all. It frustrates me that no pictures come out good. It seems it take better pictures without the flash and more landscapes. Pictures of people close up come out bad. Ugh very frustrated... I wish my old camera still worked.

Reviews.Title: Lens error!!!
Reviews.Author: mastro
Reviews.Content: Needed a camera after my Canon sd1200 (which i loved) broke down. So on short notice i went and got this camera, being a canon, for a trip to Washington DC. When i got to DC after 2 pictures the Lens error came on the screen and the lens was stuck in the out position, leaving me with just my smartphone camera ...Now i'm waiting for canon to fix this problem. I love cannon and seen good reviews about this camera, but also seen the negative reviews that all seem to be lens error. So even when i get this camera back from canon, i would not trust it and bring a back up...really buyer beware!!!!

Reviews.Title: Slow camera
Reviews.Author: Barbara
Reviews.Content: I've had this Canon PowerShot Elph 300 HS for a year or so now, and I'm quite disappointed.  It is extremely slow to shoot photos, especially indoors with the flash option on - by the time the camera decides it can take the photo, the subject has moved.  Ditto for indoors or low light with flash off.  It works ok outside in bright light with subjects that don't move much.  Needless to say it's a big disappointment because what I need is a small, lightweight camera that works great for taking pictures of fast-moving grandkids & dogs!  If that's what you want in a camera, DON'T buy this one!

Reviews.Title: nice camera until it jammed
Reviews.Author: Anthony J. Hitchings
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this for a while, now the lens won't zoom and the lens iris is sticking. The image quality was nver very good, but the 24 mm equiv wide angle feature was nice for work-related photos

Reviews.Title: light and portable
Reviews.Author: chemstudent
Reviews.Content: sadly i did not purchase this camera from amazon, but from best buy, as I scored a great deal.  be that as it may, this camera does not perform any better than my canon a630 which is ~5 years old.  I got the black version which has a rough textured feel, which i kind of like. zoom is loud and camera is always constantly re-focusing.  several times the camera would just "freeze" with the screen black and with the green light above the play button stuck on.  Luckily i just turned the camera off and it came back on.  this does not bode well and leads me to believe that this camera will not last very long.  some of the reviews mentioned the japan model being better. unfortunately i got the made in china model...Overall i would say i was just "satisfied" with this camera and it serves its purpose as a basic p&s.;

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera.
Reviews.Author: Charles Romeo
Reviews.Content: I really love this camera because it is small and has so many cool feature.  I take better photos with this camera.  I think that say it all.

Reviews.Title: Compact but so so pics
Reviews.Author: bluemoon
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased this camera elsewhere...Amazon you need to reduce your prices a lot more..I got the red one for even cheaper than the price of your  black one.Anyway, previously had an Olympus Fe340, 8MP, great little camera with excellent photo quality, unfortunately one day it just stopped working so I needed a new one. My first digital was Canon and still going strong so I figured I'd return to Canon...after reading reviews here and elsewhere I decided on this one. I've only used it a little bit as I also bought a Samsung Galaxy S2 smartphone...I should have listened to those around me, camera wasn't necessary..the picture quality of this camera is only slightly better than my phone..I expected sharper images with 12MP, instead pictures are comparable to my 8MP phone. The camera is very light,compact and easy to use..didn't need to read manual to get going with it...just pop in battery (needs charging as only little juice when out of box)memory card and off you go. I wanted a reasonably priced camera to take landscape shots for printing purposes..not sure this fill my needs...bummer.

Reviews.Title: So far, it's great
Reviews.Author: J. Martinez
Reviews.Content: Very cool features and very easy to use. Fits in my pocket nicely. I use a smartphone slip cover to keep it clean in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: M Appel "m appel"
Reviews.Content: I've been using the camera for a while now and have not had any issues. It is easy to use and takes good pictures. I do recommend it. Excellent optics,small & thin... very compact.The only problem is I should have waited a couple of months to purchace it. It dropped from $180.00 to $130.00 in that time period.

Reviews.Title: Died within 1 year
Reviews.Author: G-Rapid "grapid"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in May 2011 as a replacement for another Canon Powershot that had a lens failure (lens stuck out and could not retract). In March of 2012, our gently used PowerShot ELPH 300HS lens, while on vacation, also spontaneously had the lens failure "Lens Error... Will shut down automatically.. Please restart camera" error. Ugh.All of the recommended tips to "unstick" the guide pins on this lens failed so, I have another $250 down the drain. Never again. I researched this purchase extensively, and chose the 300HS so I could reuse the battery packs and charger from my previous PowerShot. The camera worked well prior to it's demise. However, after the second Canon PowerShot to die the same death with potentially dirt or fragile guide pins in the automatically retracting/extending lens...I have determined that this type of lens in general is a serious design flaw and should be avoided.With a camera at this price range, it's really not worth sending back for repairs, as it will be at least 1/2 the cost of the camera to repair.I would highly recommend people consider more ruggedized versions, or a "sealed" lens that does not have fully automatic extension/retraction.
