This may be available in some of the higher-end waterproof digital cameras out there on the market that do not have the concentric lens barrels that can get small dirt or sand particles stuck in them causing this error. Another option I would consider is investing in slightly higher end fixed-lenses, or simply rely on better smart phones with built-in cameras if portability is a key factor.

Reviews.Title: Kind of regret getting this camera.
Reviews.Author: AJ Quick
Reviews.Content: I do like this particular camera for its asthetics and HD video capability. I've owned it for a few months now and it REALLY doesn't do a good job for what I need it for. I take mostly close up photos against a white background and some minor background lighting. This camera cannot handle macro mode very well. More times than not, the photo ends up blurry. It also likes to not use the flash in situations that probably call for it. There is no way to force the flash that I can see. Its too bad when you have just enough light for the camera to think it doesn't need a flash, but you feel it needs one. Ultimately the photo suffers. And speaking of the photos. There is something very wonky with the color profile. When I adjust the tone, brightness and contrast of the photo in photoshop it always pushes the photo into a darker range and the colors are always a little bit off of what they should be. Its not a horrible camera. I'm sure it works much better doing outdoor photos in daylight, or photos from several feet away. Its just horrible for close up photos with indoor lighting (even in macro mode). HD video and slow motion are really nice though!

Reviews.Title: Very good but with some issues
Reviews.Author: Alexandra Cooper "Alex"
Reviews.Content: The camera feels equal in construction to my last Canon Powershot, with an aluminum (to all appearances) body with plastic buttons and a big, nice screen. Yes, the bottom flap (over the battery casing) feels a bit cheap, but not when it's closed, only when it's open, and that's hardly ever.My main concern/issue with the camera isn't its construction, but rather in its photos. In indoor lighting conditions, especially the type of overhead poor lighting you see in offices and schools, it takes poor photos of people. How so? Well, on automatic, the color balance tends to make it appear as if everybody is wearing cake makeup. I also find the auto-white balance, when inside, to be rather too warm. In addition, on occasion the noise levels seem outrageously high (to be fair, I've also noticed the reverse, so that might just be on me.) You can overcome it by fiddling around on manual, but I just want to take decent photos of my classmates as soon as I turn my camera on. I also noticed it has a tendency to lack focus. So if you're lazy and take a lot of this type of photo, I'm not sure I'd recommend the camera. It does wonderfully in better lighting by windows and outside.The second issue I have with the photos it takes is the amount of fringing, which is more than I've ever experienced before. Granted, I've only shot with SLRs and my last two point-and-shoots, but it is significant and annoying. Still, it's hardly crippling.Otherwise, I found the camera to take very pleasing photos in decent lighting, retain very high amounts of detail in it's crisp macro shots, and be an improvement over my last Canon point-and-shoot. The images it makes are large and detailed, it does a good job of identifying faces (though it will see them where they don't exist, it finds them 90+% of the time when they are in the photo). Granted, I'm not sure how useful that is. It's good at preserving non-skintone colors, and I found that I can crop the images it takes about 50% and still have a usable photo. I never need the digital zoom, but I have played with it, and it's better than Canon's digital zoom used to be.The menus are not difficult to use, but their layout is inefficient, especially in manual mode. If you're buying a point-and-shoot to use in manual, (1) you have some introspection to do, and (2) this isn't your camera.I found it needs some urging to focus on the correct area of the photo, but what point-and-shoot doesn't? I also noticed distinctly lesser ISO noise in low lighting than in previous cameras I've owned, though more than you'd see in an SLR (of course).Overall, I'm happy I got the camera. It's inexpensive for the quality it delivers. It's lightweight, responsive and where lighting is passable, retains colors very well. It's not perfect, and its photos will never knock me off my feet, but I would have been foolish to expect a camera in this price range to be stunning. It's very good.

Reviews.Title: apparent factory defect
Reviews.Author: Hey Blue
Reviews.Content: I currently own a Canon DSL and an older model Canon Power Shot Elph so chosing to buy this 300HS was a no brainer.  Amazon had the best price and it arrived no problem.  Unfortunately the Macro (or back) button doesn't work right.  When you push it, it performs the same function as the Movie start button and starts recording video.  Bizzare defect.  I reset the camera to factory defaults and tried everything else I could think of.  I've checked all of the forums looking for this problem and called Canon thinking maybe I needed a firmware update.  No firmware updates have been released yet and no mention of this defect on any forums.  Looks like I got just an old fashioned defect.  First problem I've ever had with any of my Canon cameras (even going back to my old film cameras).  I need to confirm with Canon tech support (they are only available M-F) but it looks like it's going back.Update (2/28/12):  Canon Tech support had never heard of this problem.  While they would repair it under warrenty, they suggested I return it to Amazon which would actuqally be easier.  At this point I still want this model camera because the combination of features, image quality and size can't be beat for the price.  The image quality and shooting options are outstanding but the defect makes it too difficult to use.

Reviews.Title: I've had really good luck with Canon
Reviews.Author: HDT "misterpresident"
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd Canon (compact) camera. I've had good luck in keeping them functional for years on end. I make an effort to keep them safe from moisture, temperature extremes and hard knocks (invest in a nice case, it's a must).I don't recall ever having any functional problems - outside the protective shutter on the lens not fully opening without some encouragement. A problem that can be expected for an older camera that's been everywhere with me.What I've found that really separates these types of cameras is how intuitive and functional the many options are. Getting around the camera's menu options takes lots of practice, and I've found other brands to be very difficult to learn. I've never HAD to open the Canon user manual, with others I've been forced to. If you're not someone that has been shooting for years you really should peruse the manual and get a grasp on what your options are. If you're old enough to have shot actual film, these cameras simply blow away your imagination.This model offers a 'tilt-shift' shooting option (referred to as "miniature") and fish-eye lens option. Both very useful and fun to make your images stand out.I always tell people the most critical component to getting a good pictures is to first, have a camera with you. If you own a large SLR with extra lenses you'll get some great pictures no doubt, but are you going to bring that camping or vacationing? Maybe, but it won't be with you all the time. This camera (with case) takes up a little more space than a smartphone. It can be with you at all times.The video is another reason I upgraded; bigger and sharper than my previous model (SD 1100). Video can capture so much that a still-shot can't.My only real complaint is that getting to the "photo stitch" option seems to get harder and harder with every model. I should find that manual.

Reviews.Title: Excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Jean B. Reed
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful! I love all the features. And it truly is point and click. The picture image and clarity is amazing! No more blurry or out of focus photos!! I had to return the first one because the shutter stuck and the second is phenomenal! No problems, no weird sounds... Would definitely recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: J. F. Vogel "Road Runner"
Reviews.Content: Very nice camera, excellent pictures and very easy to use. Bought this for my wife for Xmas and she loves it.

Reviews.Title: Poor zoom quality
Reviews.Author: J. Warfield
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after upgrading from an old Canon PowerShot that I have had for 8+ years and saw it had good reviews.  I am not pleased with zoom quality.  When I zoom, the picture becomes fuzzy and blurred. I will be returning this one and looking at other PowerShots to purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazing little camera!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Dizon
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I'm tired of hauling two gadgets (Canon Rebel Xsi and Vixia HF10 video camera). I get the best of both worlds in this compact camera. It has a nice solid feel and the sandpaper touch is awesome for better grip. I'm very amazed on the picute quality even in low-light conditions. The 1080p with one-touch record button is a joy. The quality is amazing coming from a very small package! I love how it comes out on our 52" LCD TV, everybody is amazed on how clear the images and the stereo sound is good as well. The only complaint I have is the battery life. That's why I got an extra battery for $15, so I would have an uninterrupted fun.If you are looking for a simple, inexpensive ($150), quality compact camera and also has a 1080p video, this is the ONE!I checked numerous websites and they all have great reviews on this Canon 300HS!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, not great
Reviews.Author: Brad
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Thailand, it performed well. Quality is ok, not amazing, I thought it would take better photos due to the high magapixel rating but found out that has more to do with blowing up the photos. We plugged it into a tv to show friends, that worked really well, video was good and battery life was good. I will say that the lens shutter began to jam and wouldn't open or close all the way just a few days after buying it, so I would rate the quality of the camera construction as poor.

Reviews.Title: It is good!
Reviews.Author: bbmmdbl
Reviews.Content: I think that this product is very good!!! It is very beautiful. The battery can last a long period. I recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jonathan C. Niznak
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a vacation, and it worked great, pictures were really good, easy to carry around, and all for a great price.  I recommend this to anyone looking for a camera in this price range.  I hope you enjoy it as mch as I do.

Reviews.Title: Macro Function with Depth of Field
Reviews.Author: Reed M. Smith II
Reviews.Content: At first I didn't note this because I thought it could be tied to user error. After further review, I had to give this product 4 out of 5 stars. Best case scenario is that I have a rare dud.When the camera is on (battery fully charged, memory card in place), if you depress the primary function button slightly as to trigger the auto focus), the camera will crash as much as 3 times out of 5.I had to keep 4 stars because it is still a fantastic product. Returned it for a replacement, though.

Reviews.Title: Good Value, Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: redanman
Reviews.Content: I had some gift cards to use and thought how about a new camera?  I've been using an older Nikon S1 so I looked at the Nikon updated similar cameras as well as Canon (we have another in the house). I chose the Canon quite frankly because of battery charger similarity.  These kind of cameras are all a gift to photographers with any semblance of intelligence.Positives: Durable. Easy to use. Long Battery Life.  Good results in low light. Big (12.1) but not unmanageable file sizes.  Too big and I will have a hard time stitching photos, this size is perfect.Low Points: None really.  Lack of a higher zoom is NOT a low point.  Zoom past 3-4X is useless without a tripod, people, listen up!  These cameras with 12-21X zoom are unusable.

Reviews.Title: Canon Powershot ELPH 300HS
Reviews.Author: K. Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: This Canon has everything I needed and wanted in a point and shoot camera. It's simple to use, has an awesome viewing screen, takes great photos, and the menu options are wonderful if I want to do more than just point and shoot. Overall, I am very pleased with the camera and would recommend it to anyone in the market for a good, relatively inexpensive, and reliable camera.

Reviews.Title: Dummies taking photos
Reviews.Author: coachrich
Reviews.Content: I've been a terrible photo shooter for decades. Not only does this camera take the voodoo out of taking pictures, the applications that can be used when preparing to save and print the photos will rescue you from any errors you may make when you've taken your shots. I take my Canon everywhere I go. Whether I intend to take pictures or not. You never know when a photo-op may arise.

Reviews.Title: One of the best point of shoot I've ever had
Reviews.Author: XXA
Reviews.Content: I owned tens of pos in the last tens of years, i think this is one of the best pocket camera I've owned. I was considering about to have another camcorder to replace an old Sanyo. now I realize I can take this slim baby instead of taking the heavy 5D II and all lens or Pentax-7/X and camcorders. It does all general routing jobs. Image is quite crispy,and super wide range lens perform just wellafter playing a while, I immediately got another one for dad.highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Vivid colors and quality pictures
Reviews.Author: N. Noei "N. Noei"
Reviews.Content: My expectation of a point and shoot camera had dwindled over time, but the vivid colors and quality of the pictures that come out of this camera impressed me.  For the price this camera is offered it is a great bargain

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for a very low price
Reviews.Author: Chiguireitor
Reviews.Content: In point-and-shoot terms, this is one of the best out there. Good sensor quality, impressive shutter delay and vast array of options. The camera feels solid in your hands as if it would stand a beating without a hitch.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mauro
Reviews.Content: The camera is really great! it came in the exact time that it should. I am very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: mountain hiker
Reviews.Content: I carry this camera with me all the time.  The size makes that easy to do.  It takes great pictures and is easy to use.  I had it with me when I saw three bear cubs in a tree in West Virginia and got several great shots.

Reviews.Title: Goog
Reviews.Author: Zhi Fang
Reviews.Content: it is very good camer,I like it very much.I think next time i will buy the same one

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Not Satisfied
Reviews.Content: Size is perfect for instant shooting. It's fast and takes great pictures. Not so great for video shooting as it fills up the memory fast. But takes great video aswell.

Reviews.Title: Generally a very good camera
Reviews.Author: E. OBrien "Metman"
Reviews.Content: This Elph is a very good compact camera not unlike other models I have had. The only criticism is the delay built into these cameras which makes taking quick shots problematic.

Reviews.Title: Great "TakeItWithYouEverywhere" camera
Reviews.Author: Mike in Columbus, GA
Reviews.Content: On a recent long weekend trip, I never felt like dragging my DSLR around and I wound up taking zero photos.  I knew that I needed a compact camera that I would actually carry around.  This one has not disappointed me.Pros:>24mm equivalent wide angle really helps with tight indoor shots as well as wide outdoor scenics>Easy to navigate menu with plenty of settings to handle different difficult photo situations>Full 1080p video with the ability to zoom during shooting and decent stereo sound from the built in mics>Excellent low-light photo quality for this type of camera - most compacts that I've owned in the past were almost useless indoors>Easy Automatic mode for when you need to hand your camera to Aunt Clara to take a photo>Textured finish gives you a solid grip on the camera - I find that I don't need the wrist strapCons:>The battery life is average at best - you'll want to carry a spare battery for weekend tripsBottom line:  You won't mistake the performance of this camera with a DSLR, but if you want really nice quality photos and video from a camera that you can truly carry in your pocket, this will fit the bill nicely.

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Foxgolve
Reviews.Content: I purchased this a few months ago and since then it has been on vacation with me. It fits perfectly in my purse and nothing on it has scratched or dented. Turn on time is fast and the battery lasted me 3 days of  random picture taking while on vacation. Picture quality is good but of course not as good as a DSLR. The menus are easy to navigate and the auto setting usually takes a good picture though I really enjoy switching over to manual and playing with all those settings. Definitely a great buy and this camera will last quite a while.

Reviews.Title: great camera for all around use but wind noisy in movies
Reviews.Author: beedub "bw"
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with Full 1080p HD Video (Silver)this is a really good camera. I like everything (except the wind noise) about it for a portable yet flexible unit.after trying and testing a lot of cameras including a camcorder or two,, I am quickly leaving my Sd550 ELPH aside.

Reviews.Title: Pocketable
Reviews.Author: Andre Bernard
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my vacation, last July and it was a good deal.The pictures are bright, clear but at night, if you like taking artistic pictures, upgrade to S95 or similar.The charger is a little bit fragile, and the electric connector crooked, I used pliers to fix it.Buy an extra battery if you can. It's not that expensive.I also bought 2 Transcend 8GB Class 10 SDHC Card (TS8GSDHC10) and a Case Logic TBC-302 Ultra Compact Camera Case with Storage (Black) for compact cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Happy Buyer
Reviews.Content: For someone who is looking for a decent p&s;, this camera is wonderful.  I bought it for my mother, and she loves the quality of the pictures, the ease of uploading it to her computer, and also the size of it.  We've had digital cameras before, but she just can't stop talking about this one.  Great camera, I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: no
Reviews.Content: this camera is awesome, i wish it was a little easier to navigate the programmed settings (like on an older version elph), since they're all in one folder, but this camera rules.  really happy with it.  maybe my best canon yet.

Reviews.Title: Love this camera
Reviews.Author: Stevenretired
Reviews.Content: I had a previous model and used it often.  It did not survive the swimming pool so I bought this one.  The image quality has improved especially in low light situation.  Remember the flash is only good for ten feet or so.  I carry the camera everywhere.  Love it.

Reviews.Title: ELPH 300
Reviews.Author: A. Flanary
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing little camera. It is a power house in a small package. Low light performance is simply amazing. Regretfully I had a few sequences of pictures which were very dark in situations which should have been perfect. In discussing the problem with Canon, I was encouraged to send the camera back for evaluation. Later, I received recall notice from Amazon saying that the memory card manufacturer was experiencing problems with their product storing large files. Even though my memory card was not in the affected serial number sequence, I suspect the problem with the Elph 300 may be caused by something associated with the memory card. This is a great little camera and I am confident Canon will resolve the issue I experienced.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Vijay
Reviews.Content: I use a canon dslr with 55mm 1.4 prime for most of my portraits. I find this camera great for every day use. regardless of the situation, image quality if good... almost. But then thats expected from a camera of this size. Video is exceptional. Zoom while recording a video happens slowly... thus giving a gradual zooming in effect to the video. Worth every penny one spends on this. Auto mode does a great job. P fucntion is useful especially in bright sun light conditions.Night shoot is a little dicey despite the advertisement. It is ok... as is the case with many point and shoots. But these are very minor hiccups.I recommend this camera to anyone who is looking for a camera to carry all the time and take great pics.amazon service is anyway unparalleled.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Assem Habbab "-- san"
Reviews.Content: I've used this camera for few weeks now without any problems. The battery doesn't last as long as my SD800IS but that is expected. The pictures are very sharp and the camera is quite fast.cheers

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome
Reviews.Author: Joseph Croft "cyber croft"
Reviews.Content: I own a SLR camera but wanted something smaller to carry around every day that has good quality pictures.  This is exactly what I was looking for.  We have been using it for two weeks and love everything about it.  The black that we purchased has some kind of coating that feels a little weird but keeps the camera from slipping.  I know I wanted something small but this might be a touch too small for anyone with large hands.  This is actually smaller than my smart phone.  Absolutely love it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Successful Day
Reviews.Content: This is my third PowerShot and it is the best I've ever owned.  Canon continues to have one of the easiest to use interfaces on the market.  What sets this camera apart is that it takes brilliant photos.  It especially thrives in low-light situations.  The zoom is impressive.  Just putting the whole thing on auto and shooting away produces excellent results.  I wish the battery lasted a little longer (shooting video seems to deplete it very quickly), but that's my only complaint for what is on the whole the best point-and-shoot camera I've ever owned.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: I take a lot of indoor snapshots. This camera takes better indoor shots without a flash than my five year old Sony with a flash.

Reviews.Title: LOUD zoom... DO NOT zoom while recording
Reviews.Author: M. Holt "Matt"
Reviews.Content: I did my research for weeks on this bad boy versus the SX230. Finally decided on this guy based on size and features (and I'm not sure I need a travel zoom). I took a few impressive pictures, even pointed the thing at my family photo wall and noticed it did a great job picking faces out of the pictures... I noticed the zoom was pretty loud, but I figure it's okay.Then I recorded a video. AMAZING 1080p24 quality picture... the loud zoom sound was RECORDED. This was mentioned in one other review and verified by some people on youtube. Some cameras have the issue, some don't. Mine does, and it's going back ASAP. May be my last canon based on poor quality control.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera  !
Reviews.Author: Neldam "Neldam"
Reviews.Content: I wanted to replace my 10 year old Canon sd 450 which still works great; but wanted to get a newer one.  I researched, I read all the reviews, and finally came to the conclusion that for my needs, the Elph 300 would serve me best.And I was correct.  I got it about a month ago, & took it on our vacation and it took great photos, and videos.  I would have gone for the elph 500 but the only draw back was that it is a bigger camera, and doesn't easily fit in a pocket.That's the reason I selected the elph 300, because it does a lot, does it well; and is small enough to carry around on vacation.I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Best P&S; camera
Reviews.Author: Frank D. Nguyen
Reviews.Content: So compact that it takes only little space in the pocket - very high quality pictures that only second to those taken from larger SLRs

Reviews.Title: Power in a small camera
Reviews.Author: Lawrence R. Hudson "Fatherhonda"
Reviews.Content: I have wanted a camera for some time that could take decent low-light photos and 1080p hi-def video.  I thought I'd have to go with a bulky Four-Thirds camera or an SLR.  But the CMOS sensor in the 300HS does a nice job in low light.  It would be interesting if someone could do a side-by-side test to see how close this camera comes to, say, the Panasonic DMC-GH1K in this respect.  I also like the multiple-frames-per-second stills (even faster at 3 megabytes).  The 24mm (equivalent) lens is free of fish-eye distortion (except in extreme close-ups where you might actually want it), perhaps due to computed correction within the camera.It is a bit inconvenient to switch between functions because the buttons and the screen icons are small.  Although a rotating function dial like the ones that Panasonic and Fuji use would make switching easier, clearly there isn't room for one on a camera this small.  If the camera is to fit in a pocket this is one of the necessary trade-offs.I had been concerned that the 300HS would be significantly larger than the SD780IS it replaced, but no worries.  The difference in thickness, the most important dimension for me in a pocket camera, is not significant.  So here is this little gem with 5X optical zoom, optical image stabilization, fast frame rate, hi-def video, and good low-light capability, and it all fits in a pocket!  Don't tell Canon but they aren't charging enough for this camera.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE THE FULL HD VIDEO!  LOOK HERE BEFORE YOU BUY!
Reviews.Author: Shazam!
Reviews.Content: I have been a CANON fanatic for many years.  The macro lens features of the DIGITAL ELPH series alone are like no other.  The cameras themselves are, over-all, outstanding.  They are very compact, very user-friendly and professional in results.  BUT!  READ!  Newer isn't always better.  YOU NEED TO KNOW that when you are looking for an HD video camera... and this new model is FULL-HD, UNLIKE ALL OF THE PREVIOUS CANON ELPH MODELS, this new "upgraded version", with all it's bells and whistles and upgrades, DOES NOT ALLOW YOU TO CONTROL THE HD MOVIE FEATURES!  IT FORCES YOU TO STAY IN A STUBBORN AUTOMATIC MODE, which causes footage to ALWAYS be over-exposed and washed-out.  Furthermore, during filming, the camera "flares" the video results from one extreme to another IN EVEN THE SLIGHTEST LIGHT VARIATION!  Each and every video comes out in WAVES of bright to dark if the camera isn't in completely stable light conditions.... and you have absoultely no control over it.  HOW IRRITATING TO WATCH!  I HAVE TO ASK:  WHY EVEN BOTHER TO UPGRADE THE DIGITAL ELPH TO FULL HD CAPABILITY AND THEN NOT BE ABLE TO MANUALLY CORRECT YOUR PREFERENCES FOR LIGHT, CONTRAST, COLOR, ETC before filming??  It was unbelievable to me that something so new and upgraded was so generic in it's HD functions.  It is, in fact, so disappointing, I must now return this camera with a sad face.  LONG LIVE CANON, but absolutely skip this model if you are looking for stability of the HD VIDEO mode.  NOTE:  The previous CANON POWERSHOT SD 1400 IS is the model that correctly allows for user-options with HD.  Although not FULL HD, it is still HD.

Reviews.Title: Taking it Back
Reviews.Author: Steve Bennett "stevebenett"
Reviews.Content: I'm an advanced amateur, but still an amateur.  I have an old Kodak that's painfully slow to get ready to take pictures, and has very poor video.  I thought this one would work.  Portability is great.  The rechargable battery lasted very nicely (beyond 150 pics and multiple videos).  The outside shots are fine, in fact pretty nice by my view.  Inside shots set on auto are either blurry/grainy with no flash or grainy/orange with a flash.  The video is nice, but that's about all.  I'm a novice.  I need point and shoot for the most part.  Some macro.  I set this on auto and get pictures worse than my 5 year old kodak.  I give it three stars for the battery life, portability, outside shots and video but that's it.  I repeat that I'm a novice.  I may be missing some setting or option for clearer pictures.  Right now, though, I'll stick with my kodak.

Reviews.Title: About the same quality as my phone
Reviews.Author: M. P. Daniels
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera hoping that with the larger lens it would take better pictures than my phone, but the quality is only slightly, by the tinniest of margins, better than my S3 or S4 phone. Since it is not worth carrying around for pictures, I thought maybe I could set it up on a tripod and capture long nature scenes, but I discovered that it has a 10 minute time limit for video, even if there is ample space left on the SD card. So disappointing! It never leaves home. It sits on my desk, sad and alone. And probably uncharged.

Reviews.Title: Lens Error x2!!
Reviews.Author: Samsam007
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera and loved the low profile and reaction time, however, I have had more problems than ever before. As a Canon fan (printers, DSLR owner) I was very disappointed right out of the box when I kept experiencing a "lens error" message. I exchanged my first one thinking I got a lemon and I am having same issues with my new one. After researching, I see that this is a very common problem. It is incredibly frustrating that I can't zoom in or out when taking photos and if I do, the camera shuts down. Not happy...

Reviews.Title: Only OK
Reviews.Author: d a settle
Reviews.Content: I suppose in the age of kiddies who get their first cell phones at the age of 6 or 7 and snap pictures of all their friends, it is only to be expected that  standards of photography will fall. Now I got my first camera at the age of 6 (a Kodak Brownie). I have used almost all types since then from compact film cameras through SLR's and plate cameras.Even with loading my own film into the cassettes I had to take care when photographing any thing since the most shots you had on a roll would be about 45.  Then along came the digital camera at around 1.3mp. Fun, but not good pictures. The 5mp was very good for small prints. You might even get a 5x7 out of them. When the 10mp's came along I was very happy. Getting the Panasonic LX10 was quite a pleasant time for me since I was able to print an 11x8.5 that really looked great! Camera manufacturers could not leave well enough alone.  1: Increase the megapixel count for sharper pictures. More megapixels do NOT guarantee sharper pictures.  2: Add more processing for better color. You get oversaturated incorrect colors.  3: Use the same tiny sensor.Even a modest increase in mp count would add say 2 million pixels.  So what happened to this Canon? The test pictures I ran showed the following faults.  1: Oversaturation and unacceptable purple fringing at the corners in all modes.  2: Barrel distortion more noticeable at the edges.  3: Unsharpness across the entire photo even on 4x6 prints.  4: Bleeding of colors in bright sunshine.  So my conclusion must be that for uncritical vacation shots and people who just want to be able to recognize Uncle Chuck, this camera might just do. I returned my Canon 300 Elph for a Samsung TL320 which can take photos that look like photos. I cannot recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Bad Camera
Reviews.Author: edwardted
Reviews.Content: I bought it on October 3, 2011, however, it broken April 9 2012. It can not work because of the lens error. Even then, I contact the Canon surport, they let me send it to their company, and I should pay the mail fee!!!!! So I think please consider my situation before you buy it.

Reviews.Title: Cannon power shot elph 300 hs
Reviews.Content: i just got this from best buy a couple days ago but i would not buy a camera off of amazon reason why it would be a pain in the ass to return it if i wanted to but i just desided to make a review i used to be on 720p but when i got them camera im all at 1080p now I love it so i can make my youtube videos in full hd its a great camera so far and its small and can travle any ware easy i got a hard case for it it fits it my pocket find so make sure if you dont have that much monney but want to get a great camera get this cannon :)[...]

Reviews.Title: disappointed...
Reviews.Author: Momof2
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this camera, after reading so many glowing reviews.  I was looking for a small and light camera that I could take anywhere.  While my old powershot A620 still takes great pictures, I wanted a camera with newer features such as hd video and better low light performance.  My experience with the elph 300 hs has disappointed me in several ways.  Compared with my trusty A620, pictures taken with the elph 300 hs do not look nearly as crisp - almost soft, especially toward the corners and edges. I've played with settings and typically use P mode.  I just cannot seem to get decent pictures with this camera.  Other complaints I have are the autofocus speed, barrel distortion with wide angle, inconsistent exposure, weak flash, and horrible lens flare.  The bottom line is that the image quality simply isn't there with this camera.  While I would love to have a camera I can slip in a pocket, I am not willing to compromise image quality enough to use this camera when I want to take halfway decent pictures.  I will grab my A620 every time - even if it doesn't fit in a pocket. Of course, I am not expecting dslr performance from this little camera.  My basis for comparison is my experience with my A620, my kid's A590is, and my dad's sd1100is. This little camera has many features in a very small package & might be a fun little toy for someone who isn't picky about image quality.Pros:small, yet comfortable to hold and operateexcellent battery lifemany featuresexcellent burst modebuild qualitycolor is typically goodCons:image quality / softness, even when sharpness setting is adjustedblurring of corners and edgeslens flare - much worse than other point & shoot cameras I have used, makes pictures look washed out (vs. attractive flare)autofocus speed, autofocus in video modesound quality could be better - perhaps something to do with mic placement? (top vs. front)flash - weak and inconsistent (and easy to block with finger at first)shot to shot time when using flashinconsistent metering, compared with other cameras I have usedbarrel distortion at wide angletoo much noise reduction, especially at ISO 400 & up.  (Though this is a personal preference.)UPDATE:  I have decided not to sell this camera.  I am still frustrated by the negatives I have mentioned, but I am loving the size more and more.  I can take this camera anywhere.  Sure, I'd get better pictures with my A620 or an slr, but there are some times when I wouldn't have a larger camera with me.  A larger camera certainly wouldn't fit in the pocket of my life jacket for a kayak trip or in the pocket of my "skinny jeans" when I am running around a park with my kids.  This little camera will enable me to capture memories that would not otherwise be captured.  I would probably give it more of a 3.5 star rating now, but definitely a 5 star rating for size.

Reviews.Title: Great Features. Useless for children or pets!
Reviews.Author: Jere C. Julian, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I've been through plenty of cameras over the years and have had a very good history with Canon.  However, this camera was a huge disappointment.  The reviews were great and the technical specs and features are excellent.  The one thing I never saw before the purchase was how long it takes to acquire a focal point and actually snap the shutter.If you want to take photos of kids or pets, this is NOT the camera for you!  You will miss every cute moment you planned to capture when buying a pocket camera like this.I've tried adjusting countless settings and cannot seem to speed the button-to-shutter time enough to be useful.  My spouse keeps trying the camera because its small enough to cary (compared to the Rebel) but consistently threatens to throw it through the window.On the up side, the video quality is good.  I actually dialed back the quality a bit to get more time on our card and we're still very happy with the video.  Its too bad that's all we find useful on this camera.

Reviews.Title: You Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: carolee
Reviews.Content: I've used many Canon P&S; and was looking for a compact, good quality one to bring around with me to parties and events. I currently own a SD907IS and replaced it with the ELPH300 because it's much more compact and easy to carry but was greatly disappointed. Not sure if I was just given a faulty one, but every other picture I took with the flash on was blurry. I had no problems with it in well lit settings, but in dark settings this camera doesn't do it's job.

Reviews.Title: Elph 300 review
Reviews.Author: DT
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera 4 months. Was wanting a small, light camera for hiking and backpacking. Needed to take HD video. After reading tons of reviews, I bought this camera because it is one of those rare ones that allow you to use the zoom while shooting video, continuously focuses, adjusts for changing light and has Image stabilization. I'm happy with the video. The audio, wind noise is typical of every camera that uses the mic type that these do. I'm in the process of making a dead rat to encompass the whole camera, as even handling the body of the camera introduces unwanted noise.The pictures tho are very disappointing. You'd think for any camera approaching 10mp the pictures would be sharp and crisp with some nice detail. No so with this camera. It seems to have a lot of useless effects, but lacks important options like a sharpness setting. If you're taking landscape type pictures with this camera, expect soft, bland, detail-less pictures, especially of trees, foliage, bushes, grass, rocks. Detail and color are blotchy. I quit using it on Auto and use the Program setting all the time now to try to salvage what I can out of it.My Canon A620 7mp takes better pictures.

Reviews.Title: It may sound petty, but the button's silkscreened symbol really rubs me the wrong way
Reviews.Author: Paul C. Huang "Paul Huang"
Reviews.Content: I have bought many of the ELPH-series cameras. All have been very good. For two years in a row, I used the old ELPH 600SD (only 6MPX) for my annual greeting card pictures and people couldn't believe that all pictures were taken with a pocket camera. (Of course, the lighting, subject matter, and composition make the picture, not the camera).Although it works fine, I just don't like the fact that the functions are painted on, not etched and painted. This one is even slanted. Take a look at the 'customer picture' area and you will see what I mean.Not really a big deal, but FYI.

Reviews.Title: Made in China, top-notch performance & features
Reviews.Author: D. Snow
Reviews.Content: Just received a silver 300 HS ordered from Amazon, not a 3rd-party seller.  This one is made in China,but so far all seems to be well.  Some people have mentioned a rough textured surface, but my silver300 HS is smooth.Compared to my PowerShot SD 780 IS, the wider 24mm lens on the 300HS is nice, and the startup andshot-to-shot times seem much snappier.The new red movie mode button is convenient, and the 300 HS can zoom and change focus while in movie mode,something the SD 780 IS cannot do.An awesome little camera, at a great Amazon price!

Reviews.Title: A must have...for the price
Reviews.Author: Lisa M. Scolaro "Sympathetic Mom"
Reviews.Content: Love my new canon camera...got this in August for my birthday, just before a day at the zoo.  Pictures are great and the video is even better.  My favorite button is the video recorder button.  You view and push the button on the back without even having to look for it.  Press it again to stop the video...love it!  Quick review of your photos and video.  Haven't even explored the many many things this camera can do...but I will.  My zoo photos may have been even better if I had more knowledge of how to use it.  It fits in ALL my purses and some wristlets and it's not too small to handle...buy it!!

Reviews.Title: IT'S AN OKAY CAMERA
Reviews.Author: whiterose
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in April, as a birthday gift for my hubby. He love to take pictures, but doesn't like to play around with the camera. Months later, I tried taking videos. It only takes 10 minutes videos! I then, refer back to the manual's book," Shooting time for a 4gb is 14 min. 34 sec., and for a 16gb is 59 min. 40 sec., maximum clip length is 10 min." I was confused, and call cannon customer support. Everything was clear now, but regret buying this camera. I should have pay more for a good cell phone that does everything.

Reviews.Title: Canon is the best camera ever made
Reviews.Author: Lynn Lev "BronxLady"
Reviews.Content: I had a canon power shot camera before this one and i had it for over 4 years until i dropped it. I went on line an looked at about 20-40 cameras, different brands but i stuck with CANON.. WHY? you ask. lol well this camera is FANTASTIC, EASY and I LOVE IT.. it takes great picture and the zoom is awsome and they print out sooooooooo clear.. CANON I WILL NEVER LEAVE YOU.....

Reviews.Title: Terrible!!
Reviews.Author: crosol
Reviews.Content: The pros to camera: very small.The cons: The packaging looked like someone dropped it off a 5 story building. It took clear shots (sometimes) but the screen was always blurry. The buttons for changing screens, deleting, filming was just too much work than it should have been. Not worthy the money.Another pro: returning it was a breeze and had no troubles there.Got my money back, went to WalMart, got the Nikon with 12 optical zoom and saved $30.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: michael nealon
Reviews.Content: Shutter stuck and stopped working after 18 months will not depend on canon camera anymore. Should have two year warranty as standard

Reviews.Title: It worked. Good Point-and-Shoot
Reviews.Author: Jeff Flowrs
Reviews.Content: This camera was ok. Nothing spectacular. Worked fine as a point-and-shoot camera. Set the resolution to its highest setting and you can get some decent prints.Mine ended up breaking, but that was more my fault (or Mother Natures). I was hiking and it started to rain. Slight drizzle, really. I took it out to snap a couple of photos, and I guess water got in there. Meh.

Reviews.Title: OK for a middle of the road camera.
Reviews.Author: robm
Reviews.Content: Photo quality is average. The video is rather poor in that any lighting changes affect the quality significantly.Should have paid a bit more and got a better one.

Reviews.Title: Below average
Reviews.Author: ROBERT D BECK
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with the quality of this camera. It takes inferior photos compared to similar photos.  I'd pass.

Reviews.Title: Happy With The Camera But Buying Experience Not So Good
Reviews.Author: K. Orlan "Math Mother"
Reviews.Content: Recently bought the camera (red) and it's very nice as many other reviewers have said.  I want to add something about my buying experience with Amazon.  Nowhere on the Amazon product description, did I find that the camera included a charger.  So I added a charger from another vendor to my order.  When I received the camera, a charger was included.  I contacted the vendor to see if I could return the extra charger and was surprised to find out that the vendor was in China and the postage would be too expensive to justify the return. The extra charger was delivered about 3 weeks later and I guess I'm stuck with it.  :-(

Reviews.Title: Good solid little point and shoot camera.
Reviews.Author: Candice
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this camera until i dropped it on the floor and the monitor screen became pixelated.  It takes very nice pictures for a point and shoot, however they are not very detailed.  The settings are fun to play with too.  It served me well for a point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
Reviews.Author: Aisha
Reviews.Content: OMG THIS CAMERA IS IN MY BAG 24/7. I've had it for about 3-4 years! I love all the settings on it that I can play with, I don't need fancy computer software to make my photos look good, I can do it on the camera its self!!! The lens cover (the slides) did break...they don't close all the way I have to do it carefully! I know of others who have had the same problem it doesn't bother me to have to do it, but as long as you get the warranty I'm sure best buy or another business will replace it if that DOES happen. The thing is no bigger than my phone and credit card it fits in my back pocket without problem and its a great camera!

Reviews.Title: Its Just Okay
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Youman
Reviews.Content: Nice and compact.Simple to use and set up.Picture quality is not that great - I am disappointed.Especially in low light situations.Maybe the standard settings are the issueand I need to adjust these settings for picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Canon ELPH 300 HS.
Reviews.Author: Marcia L. Cook
Reviews.Content: Very good service and delivery. I'm loving my new camera the size is amazing . I have a new puppy and some beautiful flowers to photograph so I am shooting away!

Reviews.Title: Does what it's supposed to
Reviews.Author: Sam Clemens
Reviews.Content: I don't expect spectacular performance from a point-and-shoot. Image quality seems as expected. Depth of field on any point-and-shoot digital tends to be too big, partly because the sensor is relatively small. The size of this camera makes it easy to carry around, leading you to take more pictures. On the other hand, I'm not sure how much longer point and shoots are going to be able to compete with smartphone cameras -- their areas of ideal photographic use overlap a lot, and obviously smartphones do many other things.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Point and Shoot Camera
Reviews.Author: Pickelw
Reviews.Content: This is my second 300HS.  I purchased this to replace a two year camera that has a cracked screen.This camera takes excellent pictures and video.  I took hundreds of pictures in Europe, Russia and Poland two years ago.  I also used the camera to shoot one minute videos of different sites.  The pictures and video are both excellent even in low light.Pros: the camera is small, light weight, fits in your pocket, and takes excellent pictures and video.Cons: the lens cover is easily damaged because it is so thin. I had to use my fingernail a couple of times to pull the cover out so that it would open.  The batteries do well for pictures but are sucked dry when shooting video.  The batteries will last all day shooting pictures but drain when shooting more than one minute video. The shutter is a little slow to react sometimes especially if there is action or movement in the frame.

Reviews.Title: Good pictures
Reviews.Author: Darlene Garrison "dardar"
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of canon and love the quality of the photos.  The zoom on this is not as good as the last but it fits in your pocket and is very handy.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for average usage
Reviews.Author: Fmahmoud
Reviews.Content: It is a good allround camera, looks nice and does the job as expected. Don't expect miracles from it though.

Reviews.Title: Love love love this camera!
Reviews.Author: lscags
Reviews.Content: I did some research and found that this camera comes with high recommendations so I purchased it.  I made the right decision and bought it for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Bad in Low Light
Reviews.Author: Craig Riley
Reviews.Content: Great camera for the price and works well in most conditions. Not so good at night or in low level lighting.

Reviews.Title: The zoom is great - low light not as good as expected and auto flash works at odd times
Reviews.Author: Khail Mills
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a camera that would be a great point/shoot vs. my smartphone camera (that sucks at taking photos).  This camera does have fantastic battery life (wish everything I owned with a battery lasted this long).  The zoom is really good and it has a lot of neat features - like you can set it to NOT take photos when the subject's eyes are closed or if they are not smiling - and it actually works!  I am a little disappointed with the low light ability (maybe I am not adjusting something right?)  And I should have opted for the silver camera - - the black matte coating whatever it is chips very easily.  Overall it is a good camera - not great.  I thought I had done my homework.  It was probably worth the roughly $200 I paid - but not worth a lot more than that.  It is very small and easy to stick in a pocket.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Mark Twain
Reviews.Content: It works like a camera should! I took a picture with it once and it displays on the screen in back. Wow!!

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Jose Magana
Reviews.Content: GREAT CAMERA WITH GREAT FEATURES, GREAT QUALITY PICTURES. I USE TO BUY 3 TO 4 CAMERAS A YEAR DUE TO MY WORK, SINCE I SWITCH TO THIS ONE I ONLY HAVE TO BUY ONE OR TWO IF I DROP IT AND BROKE. I NORMALLY DON'T BUY THE EXTRA PROTECTION, I RATHER TO BUY A NEW ONE IF IT BROKE. I ALSO BUY THIS CLASS OF CAMERA TO ALL MY EMPLOYEES.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: gary burnett
Reviews.Content: This is the third ELPH 300 camera I've had.  I love the size and picture quality of the camera. Problem is they are too sensitive to pressure.  I carry it in my front pocket and crush them. First one the lens would not open and second one the display went bad.  I will try to be a little more careful with this one but have already ordered a cheaper powershot just in case.Camera Killer

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: TxWalker
Reviews.Content: I charged and set up the camera in a couple of hours. Color is great choice since it doesn't blend in if you put it down.  Not easy to lose.

Reviews.Title: Canon elph hs 12.1
Reviews.Author: Roddy Capers
Reviews.Content: It serves it's function as a point and shoot camera but am disappointed it doesn't have an image stabilizer for low light shots.

Reviews.Title: Image quality not great
Reviews.Author: ala55
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Canon300HS in May 2012, due to the numerous positive reviews.  I have taken about 1500 pictures with it.  The camera works just fine, however the quality of the pictures is usually not that great.  The pictures are not sharp.  I now have purchased a Canon S95, which is more expensive ($350.00), but the images are much better.  I highly recommend checking out the website [...] to compare images before purchasing any camera.  I am still very confused about all the positive reviews!

Reviews.Title: Barrel Distortion due to the Super Wide Angle Lens
Reviews.Author: Eduardo
Reviews.Content: This camera is ultra compact but the pictures have a horrible barrel distortion due to the super wide angle lens (24 mm). That is why the ELPH 310 (newer) is 28mm (problem fixed).If you do not care about faces looking with a barrel effect (fat faces), then get the camera.

Reviews.Title: Good Not Great
Reviews.Author: Tierra
Reviews.Content: This camera is pretty good. It has a lot of different modes to shoot in with toy effect being my favorite. Going through the modes is easy to understand.  The pictures come out pretty good. If you're looking to take professional pictures I would say go elsewhere. I use this for everything from random pictures or taking photos for my blog. You can see a shadow in the corner of your pictures where the flash can't get to because of the lens so take that in consideration before buying. I knew this beforehand so I wasn't shocked when I saw it. Readjusting to more light on the side where there would be a shadow sometimes helps; it gets annoying when it doesn't.  I don't keep the battery in the camera when I'm not using it so I can't say exactly how good/bad it is but while using it with it in it works great. And unless I did something wrong there wasn't any sound while recording if you zoom in which really annoys me. Also there is a zooming noise you can hear.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Patricia E. Slattery
Reviews.Content: I'm not a pro at all, but once I played with it I did well.  Wish they had a users video!!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Debbie Wessels
Reviews.Content: Christmas present to myself. Easy to learn how to use.  Enjoying the video portion of the camera.  Nice present to my self.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Rodney L. Schulz Jr.
Reviews.Content: I loved shooting with this camera (normally a DSLR person) and the video recording part was awesome. The best part was that I was able to put this into the hands of a 14 year old boy that doesn't usually do much for photography and he figured it out really fast and was off and running. I'd highly recommend this camera for anyone that wants one to put in their purse, hang on their belt or just have a dedicated point and shoot always handy.

Reviews.Title: Decent, not great
Reviews.Author: Snark Twain
Reviews.Content: Very good at lowlight, (if you use a high ISO and no flash) but if you use your flash in a darkened scene, photos come out milky.That said, it's a decent camera for the price, and feel solidly made.I just wish it adjusted for flash better. That's all.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Emmanuel C. Ndi
Reviews.Content: My wife is using this phone and it works well. She says she loves it. Good product. I will recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Review Canon PowerShot ELPH 300
Reviews.Author: Raynette L. Shannon
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with my new camera that I purchased through Amazon.com I'm always satisfied with anything that I purchase from them and I do most of my shopping on-line.  I like the smaller, more compact size.  I haven't had a chance yet to take too many photos or develop any photos that I've taken but I think I am going to be very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Not a good reliable camera. Do not Recommend!
Reviews.Author: Queen of the Kitcken "Queen of the Kitchen"
Reviews.Content: If I could give this camera NO stars, I would.  The camera arrived timely, however, after turning on the camera, setting the date, and snapping a few pictures, it stopped working.The fatal, Lens Error message popped up on the screen and no amount of turning the camera on and off and other start options suggested by youtube videos, did the trick. I sent it back immediately and I am awaiting my refund.I simply would not recommend a camera that is so poorly built. Period.

Reviews.Title: shutter jams after 4 months
Reviews.Author: bsk
Reviews.Content: terrible reliability with shutter jamming soon after purchase- second time a cannon elph has done this to me- reflecs poor construction

Reviews.Title: Lens problem
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: I love this camera--takes great shots, quick, small, etc. BUT it is not a reliable camera.  Within the first 9 months, I got a lens error and the camera shut down.  Seemed to happen when zooming and taking video.  It then cleared up and worked fine for a number of months.  Then I took it as my only camera on a trip to Isle Royale backpacking--well it totally died on me.  I am now shopping for another camera as the Canon is now out or warranty and they want to charge me $175 to fix it.  It looks like the higher-priced Canon S100 has the same lens issue.  Hard for me to believe that a great camera company like Canon can put out such a piece of junk.  My advice--don't buy one--but if you don't heed the warnings, make sure to bring a back-up!

Reviews.Title: Maybe it was defective?
Reviews.Author: T. Best "Family Man"
Reviews.Content: I've owned 2 Canon digital cameras and loved both of them and after reading all the great reviews on the Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 i thought for sure it was the camera i was looking for. I was looking for a compact camera that i could keep in my pocket. We go to Disney World a lot and i wanted a camera i could easily keep in my pocket and whip out whenever a good photo opportunity presented itself. i took the camera to the Star Spangled Sailabration at the Baltimore Inner Harbor. Most of the shots were outside. The photos were "ok". The shots that were taken inside were embarrassingly horrible. They looked like the pics i used to take w my cell phone 10 years ago. I tried different settings and nothing seemed to help. I did Google more reviews and there were other's w similar problems. There is a chance I got a defective ELPH 300, that is why i didn't give it 1 star. I ended up returning it and getting the Sony Cybershot WX-150 and i'm happy w that. it's not as good as i'd hoped it would be but i guess you sacrifice a little when you go w a compact camera. i would not recommend the Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: great purchase!
Reviews.Author: sharla mohammed
Reviews.Content: this camera is a great purchase at a great price! this camera has so many features that it makes taking pictures a breeze. the pictures are really clear and i love how it automatically adjusts to it's  surroundings. overall a great buy!

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: Amazing camera. Great pictures, and fast. I used in harsh conditions, with an OtterBox case (the small one, a 100 maybe?) and it worked perfect. Good combination to take everywhere with you.

Reviews.Title: Good, small camera
Reviews.Author: J-man
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my wife.  It is small enough to carry everywhere and the pictures seem nice.Update:  We have now have had this camera 1 year.  I'm giving it three stars as it seems to be middle of the road on overall picture quality.

Reviews.Title: Good product but overpriced
Reviews.Author: Alfred D. Holston
Reviews.Content: Delivery was excellent less than a week and was well packaged. I love the camera for point and shoot an am still figuring out how to use. My bad because I don't read manuals. Pictures are excellent though!Only dissapointment was I found same camera at Wal Mart 3 days after I received it for $40 less.Generally get better deals on Amazon than that.Definitely but the extra battery and of course the memory card.

Reviews.Title: Niceeeeee!
Reviews.Author: Madison
Reviews.Content: The quality of this camera is amazing! It's so thin and study! Get it nooooowwwww! Best quality at this price!

Reviews.Title: Nice Cool Camara But Image Quilty Not As Expected
Reviews.Author: Jacob K "J. K."
Reviews.Content: Video Quality is great better then expected,Has aolt of great video and picture featuresbut the images quality is much less then expected,too dark and red eye can also use some help.i wish i could return this, and get something better

Reviews.Title: slim yet powerful
Reviews.Author: J. Tran "JT from Houston"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.A few things I liked:1) Black finish with unpolished texture to entire casing (gives it a rough, durable-feeling, unslippery grip to it) - kinda manly, too!2) Long battery life - I took it on a ski trip and it lasted me about three days of frequent shooting (HD video-shooting will definitely zap the battery a little faster)3) Cool picture-taking functions: e.g. function to stitch pictures together for a panoramic photo like city skylines, color-isolation like B&W; photo of a woman with only red for the color of her dress, and too many more to mention but those are two I really had a chance to play with.4) Options for fine-tuning your photos and details: e.g. light-setting whether in dim-lit settings, bright sunny outdoors, cloudy day, or under fluorescent, etc.5) 1080P videos with really good stabilization.  I've tested the slo-mo function and that was really cool, too.6) Size: this camera was quite slim and fits in pocket nicely7) Price: Bought it for 149 from AMZNCONS:Well, there wasn't any, really.  I was so tempted to purchase the S90 mainly because I heard it takes closer to DSLR quality photos, but I'm satisfied with my Elph300 purchase mainly because of size and price factors.  Plus, the Elph300 received quite a lot of good reviews and has been in many hands that will vouch for it.If I had to list some CONS, I'd probably say1) It didn't include an HDMI cable - since camera takes full 1080p, it would have been great to actually see this quality displayed on a TV screen2) On my ski trip, the camera fogged up on me most of the time, but I don't think that would have been avoided with any camera due to the quick change in temperature causing humidity to fog up the insides of the camera.All in all, great purchase!  Can't go wrong at that price point.  Really good bang for the buck.  I'd highly recommend it.  Happy Shooting, everyone!

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Bargain Hunter "Bargain Hunter"
Reviews.Content: Excellent optics,small & thin... very compact.The only problem is I should have waited a couple of months to purchace it. It dropped from $180.00 to $130.00 in that time period.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Emad
Reviews.Content: It is Perfect small and thin camera , with perfect priceTake good pics and nice vediosBut screen is too small

Reviews.Title: Thought this was a great camera...
Reviews.Author: Pip
Reviews.Content: Gave my wife this as a Christmas gift.  She used it once, before putting it into a case.  While it was in the case, it got dented.  The lens cover that automatically closes to protect the lens would not close.  The pictures taken with the camera were great, and it was easy to use, unfortunately the camera is not sturdy enough to withstand normal use.  In fact, it isn't even stout enough to withstand gentle use.Add in the fact that for some reason this camera now costs $80 more than it did in December, and I can't recommend this camera at all.  (Our last 3 cameras have been Canon Digital ELPH's and I've loved every one, until this model.)

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: E
Reviews.Content: This camera takes very good pictures.You will need to read the directions as its use is not very intuitive in its operation.The only fault I have is it did not come with the memory card.

Reviews.Title: Nice and Compact
Reviews.Author: Red Hot "Lava Rock"
Reviews.Content: Like all the ELPH products, this one does not disappoint.  The sachet of the Canon makes it more expensive than other brands.  What you get is a good solid all around camera in the middle of the pack.  This unit does not have the widest FOV or the highest zoom; but for its size, it packs a lot of features.

Reviews.Title: Not Too Shabby
Reviews.Author: C. Johnson "Carlos"
Reviews.Content: I've only had this little camera for about two weeks.  The pictures in moderate light are a little grainy, but I suppose I'll have to play with it some more to get the feel for it.  In the meantime, it satisfies my need for a portable camera to augment my DSLR, which I don't always like to cart around.

Reviews.Title: decent for the price
Reviews.Author: charlie
Reviews.Content: this camera hits the nail on the head when it comes to being portable.  good/simple point and shoot, poor night time/ low light photography, very few shooting option, build quality is good (as with most canon cameras. as for the toughness, not too sure since i've never dropped it.  gets cramped in the hand after awhile so use a wrist strap.

Reviews.Title: Great TINY point & shoot, not quite as crisp of pictures as my old powershot, though
Reviews.Author: C. Kindt
Reviews.Content: I thought this would take 'as good' or better pictures than the powershot I had to replace when I broke it (an 800is from about 3 years ago), but unfortunately it's not quite as crisp, especially during movement.  THAT being said, it still takes better quality pictures than my friends/family point & shoot cameras, when we compare.I love all the functions available on this camera.  Lots of options for taking continuous pics, color tinted pics, b&w;, sepia, borders, fadeouts, and lots of pre-set settings (for aquariums, fireworks, nighttime, etc.).  I'm not ready to jump into the world of fancy cameras & setting my own everything, so I enjoy having those available to me when the auto setting isn't quite cutting it.I also love how easy it is to start shooting video.  Instead of having to switch a dial & wait & then hit my shutter button to start, there's simply a single "play" button on the camera to hit & it starts recording a precious moment RIGHT THAT MOMENT.  It's wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Good things come in small packages
Reviews.Author: Cleave
Reviews.Content: I was sincerely impressed by how much power this camera has, specifically because it is TINY. I love it though. I love the texture of the camera itself, I love the touch screen, I love the resolution, and it's all relatively easy to use. If I could think of one complaint, it is with the battery time, but its battery is rechargeable and a wall charger comes packaged with the camera. It's not worth docking it a star, but is something that could be improved. Overall, an excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Not quite as advertised
Reviews.Author: J. Nelson "mystery lover"
Reviews.Content: A selling point for this camera was its ability to take clear pictures in low light;however, I've found that my Elph1000 does a better job at that.  I do like the redeye correction feature and am trying the resizing feature.  Quality of pictures in good light or within flash range is very good. Erasing an image require many steps which is a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: Does anyone else's camera take a long time to shoot?
Reviews.Author: joseph
Reviews.Content: Hi, I got this camera after reading all the rave reviews. I am having a problem that I didn't see anyone else discuss, so I am wondering if it is just me or maybe my camera is on a strange setting? Basically, it takes a good few seconds from when I press shoot until it actually snaps a picture. I am constantly missing the moment, my kids look away and the moment I'm trying to capture is lost. Does anyone have any ideas on this?Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: Cute & Multifunctional Camera
Reviews.Author: Jackson Heights
Reviews.Content: Cute and multifunctional. Easy to carry. Acceptable picture quality. Reasonable price. Efficient delivery. Little bit disappointed because the original package of the camera doesn't include SD card, making it unconvenient for a test use. Have to place a seperate order for a card.

Reviews.Title: Lovely but this has been by far the worst Canon when it comes to battery life
Reviews.Author: Denisse
Reviews.Content: I love the sleek little camera, and loved the red color, how pocketable it is. I am Canon person and have had several through the years, powershots and other elph cameras. Unfortunately after a few months of using I am getting rid of it because its battery life is really poor. Low light conditions less than satisfactory for me.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Black friday offeed memory card
Reviews.Author: cameranut
Reviews.Content: I just received camera but positive when I placed order on black friday 11/25, it offered free 4 GB memory card.  customer service checked but said does not see such an offer.

Reviews.Title: Loved this camera
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for a while and absolutely loved it. The shutter speed was great and it is compact and easy to use. Unfortunately, I, along with quite a few others on here, ended up with the lens breaking. It no longer closes. The camera is now useless. I took it to a camera repair shop and it was going to cost $143 to have it repaired. Now I have to buy a new camera. If you buy this camera, I would highly recommend buying the warranty.

Reviews.Title: BUY THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: T6934
Reviews.Content: I am (was) a dslr guy and was looking for something to supplement my Nikon D40.  This camera has pretty much replaced the D40 (sorry man).  It is small versatile and takes pics that rival and in some cases beat out the D40.You will not regret getting this camera.  Do get an extra battery and keep it charged if you plan to be doing a lot of pics (esp with flash or video).  It has a great variety of settings (read the book).What more can I say.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera so far!
Reviews.Author: Ydtrack
Reviews.Content: I bought the ELPH 300 HS to replace my Nikon S3100 which developed a "Lens Error" after only 3 months. So far I have been very happy with the Canon as it powers up quickly and takes pictures quickly as well. The only thing I liked better about the Nikon was the fit and finish. The black buttons are OK on the Canon, and everything functions just fine, the Nikon just looks sleeker. So far the picture quality is just as good, if not better than the Nikon. The camera is also the same size as the Nikon it replaced, so if fit nicely into the same compact case. Hopefully this one will last longer than 3 months!

Reviews.Title: Great little camera for keeping with you all the time.
Reviews.Author: Kelly Zimmerman
Reviews.Content: I bought it expecting to like it and I do.It has one minor point of irritation for me but I can live with it. Every time that you turn it on it resets the flash back to on. I like being able to tell my cameras when to use their flash. Its a minor annoyance but one I can live with.It has a very small profile.The image quality is top notch.The toy camera mode is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Handy Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert A. Larson "Driller"
Reviews.Content: This is the camera that will take the pictures.Small enough to take along without bulk.I really like this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera with a couple things to improve
Reviews.Author: Frequentbuyer
Reviews.Content: This was an upgrade from a Canon Powershot that was dropped on the lens and stopped functioning.  The camera is very compact and if you are familiar with Canon cameras the functions are all very much the same.  We have used the camera for the last few weeks and overall it is great.  The photo quality is great, auto focus is as fast as any other point and shoot camera, the menus are easy to navigate and the video quality top notch.  The one button video recording is the best feature and one of the reasons the camera was purchased.  It makes capturing the moment a snap without having to change settings on the camera.  There are a couplrpe things that could be improved.  1) The flash is where you naturally put your finger so it blocks the flash and ruins the picture in lower light settings.  You just have to be a little careful how you hold the camera. 2)  The zoom in and out seems a little slower than other cameras I have used.  It is adequate but ther have been a couple instances where the slower zoom lead to a lost picture.  3) It is almost too small.  It is easy to stash in your pocket but also very easy to drop.  The good news is that the case is very durable.  It took a fall on to an asphalt driveway and survived with only a minor scratch on the corner.

Reviews.Title: This camera is AWESOME
Reviews.Author: Kelly Ristau
Reviews.Content: Bought this as an upgrade for a digital canon I had bought in 2005... LOVE IT. So many functions and very quick response time. I really like the size and weight of it, as well as the rough/textured surface- it keeps you from dropping it. I took it to Hawaii with me, and though I usually use my DSLR out there, this camera was perfect for my most recent trip. AWESOME picture quality.Buy it, it does not suck. :)

Reviews.Title: Great and User-Friendly Camera
Reviews.Author: Sonia L. Sergent "snowcuddler"
Reviews.Content: You say you want a user-friendly, small digital camera that you can pull out of your pocket and get greats shots on the spur of the moment? You're looking at the right camera. The end of Dec 2010 I purchased a Nikon digital (with manual options) for between $300 and $400 and in the few months I tried to use it never got a really good shot of anything or anyone. In June of 2011 I purchased this Canon Elph 300 and as soon as I opened it, I knew I had the right camera. I have had SLR's so I'm not ignorant about camera operation, but the Canon is so much more 'user-friendly' than the Nikon it's not funny. I know it's all in what you want - and in someone else's hands, good photos could probably be taken with my Nikon - but if you want a no fuss, easy to use camera - this is THE ONE!!!  S Sergent

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: T. Pratt
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted tiny for her handbag - I wanted quality photos. She wanted ease of use, I wanted sophistication. This camera meets all our needs very nicely. 1/2 star off for having no SD card packaged with it, so had to go get one on her birthday :-( 1/2 star off for what looks like a very fragile SD card/Battery access cover - I'm scared it will break all too soon. I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Zachary Holt
Reviews.Content: The finish on this is not smooth.  It is rough.  Kinda feels like fine grit sand paper.  Its a little weird, but I am sure that I will get use to it.  The display is AMAZING!  Pretty fast too.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures and video for a camera this size
Reviews.Author: TimL
Reviews.Content: So far this camera is awsome. It has met my expectations. Only concern is battery life. Video really drains it and if you plan to do a lot of video, buying a second battery is a good idea.

Reviews.Title: beyond my expectation
Reviews.Author: Daisy
Reviews.Content: I planed to buy nikon at first, but after consideration of price and quality, I brought this one and it actually beyond my exceptation.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Kate
Reviews.Content: This point and shoot is one of the best there is, produces really high quality pictures and the hd recording is not bad. Altought the low light could be improved.

Reviews.Title: Easy to carry but pure crap audio.
Reviews.Author: Dude in Ohio "Who me?"
Reviews.Content: Pros: Compact. Great battery life. Video image quality is very good.Cons: Microphone picks up even the slightest amount of wind. Zoom lens is loud and can be heard when recording. Audio quality is pure crap. Faces in photos sometimes seem scrunched together. Photo quality seems the same as my old canon SD770.I would not buy this camera again and I am losing confidence in canon's products.

Reviews.Title: New digital camera
Reviews.Author: vzmoses
Reviews.Content: For what I've used the camera for so far, I'm very pleased. The one thing I've had a problem with is they don't give enough instructions on how to set up the different keys so I kept dumping out good pictures that I wanted to keep. I "think" I have that part figured out now. I did think I'd be able to take pictures when it was at sunset because of the extra low light feature but they didn't come out as well as I had hoped and I even tried using the flash with it. But overall, I would recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Super compact, solid body, good picture quality
Reviews.Author: A. Mustafa "AM"
Reviews.Content: very nice camera, Mostly canon cameras now a days sucks however this one rocks. Better than SX120 I purchased before this, returned that and purchased this one.

Reviews.Title: Great features, very solid point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Ashleigh
Reviews.Content: This is what I expect out of canon. A well priced, feature packed, portable point and shoot. The quality is top notch. I have owned this for a couple months and the picture quality never ceases to amaze me. Props to Canon

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1
Reviews.Author: Nokkedli
Reviews.Content: This camera fits into a small pocket, weighs little, and takes excellent photos. It is great for those, who go on backpacking trips or hikes, where space and weight are of the essence. Since I used the video only once, I cannot rate it with confidence, but a video of bees flying in a field of lupine yielded a lovely show. I would certainly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: J. P. Connors "JPC"
Reviews.Content: This is my first pocket camera and I could not be happier.  So easy to take along and the pictures and video are better than I could have hoped for.

Reviews.Title: Great for your money
Reviews.Author: AmazonianCharles
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this camera a lot. Pretty easy to use, great size, good enough image quality. Superb video quality. The ability to do general edits to video ON the camera is a great feature! The image quality can be a little sub par at times but nothing to turn me away from this camera. It's a wonderful wide lensed point and shoot camera for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: good product
Reviews.Author: R. Arikan
Reviews.Content: I am totally satisfied. It works without any problem. Sturdy and solid. Improved compared to older versions. Better than similarly priced cameras.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality outstanding
Reviews.Author: Pamela Sampson "Dede"
Reviews.Content: Great little camera.  Photo quality exceptional.  I wish this one, like all point and shoot cameras, was a little quicker to recycle on indoor flash assisted shots.  Other than that, I would totally recommend it to a friend.  Very happy that I bought it!

Reviews.Title: overall a very good subcompact
Reviews.Author: E. J. Hutchinson
Reviews.Content: I have not used the camera extensively but so far I think its a very nicely designed camera and takes very good pictures. I am often surprised how many times the auto flash does not chose to use a flash, when I would think it should, and the picture comes out great. Some nice touches, the sandy feeling of the paint, the record button for video (no having to switch to video mode), many cool picture modes, its just very easy to use. The thin size is just great. My only (minor) complaints are that the switching of modes is all done via a menu, which can be a bit of a pain. Instead of having some sort of dial with some of the modes you might want to bring up quickly (like high speed mode). And I have found that the digital zoom is hard to focus when you get toward the higher zoom. I realize that digital zooms are not historically great so I can't say its an issue, but have to mention, neither complaint I think warrants the dropping of any stars so I am sticking with 5. Overall I am very happy so far.

Reviews.Title: very good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Pradeep R.K.
Reviews.Content: This camera is too good. The image quality is really good and there are lot of photo options. The only drawback would be it optical zoom but Canon has released a new version of the same one with higher zoom.Also, this product weighs very less, which is an added bonus. The sand paper texture give good grip during photo/video capture.

Reviews.Title: Excellent digital camera
Reviews.Author: Everett L. Craig
Reviews.Content: Compact and esay to use. Very nice pictures and it is easy to carry and the design is for any photographer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for art and casual photography
