Reviews.Author: Rosenwink
Reviews.Content: This camera is beyond satisfactory for use as an art student and a casual photographer. I bought the camera primarily as a method of gathering photos for research and image references for art projects, but also as an everyday camera for taking pictures of friends and family. The camera's automatic settings will take excellent quality photographs in most conditions, and it has enough adjustable settings for more knowledgeable photographers to enhance the existing quality. The camera's small size makes it easy to transport anywhere. It also has lots of fun settings to play around with. My younger brother especially loves messing around with the "super slow motion" video mode. All in all, a great product that delivers a lot of punch for the relatively low price.

Reviews.Title: New, but like.
Reviews.Author: Avid Reader "Jo"
Reviews.Content: Purchased as an adjunct to my Canon Rebel XSI for times when I don't want to take the larger camera, or just want snapshots.  Still new, so haven't discovered everything it offers yet, but appears to be just what I was looking for.  Obviously doesn't take the same quality pictures as my Rebel, but don't expect or need it to.  A lot in a little package for the money.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good
Reviews.Author: mgauss "mgauss"
Reviews.Content: Black finish is too grainy.  Suggest the Silver.  Good picture quality in low light.  Not as good as S95.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12 MP
Reviews.Author: G. Bergelson "Fast Track"
Reviews.Content: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12 MP CMOS Digital Camera with Full 1080p HD Video (Black) by Canon is another camera with great image quality and image processing and it shoots excellent videos for it's compact size. I have had Canon "point and shoot" cameras for years and find them reliable. Daily use often either doesn't warrant a rather bulky SLR system.

Reviews.Title: Bad service
Reviews.Author: Jess
Reviews.Content: I am beginning to think I received a defective item from this company. I bought a Canon powershot camera from them September 7, 2012. It broke in February of this year. That is after only 6 month of having it and paying $200 to buy it. It was a gift to myself for getting a desired job. I am very dissatisfied. I contacted them and received no help.

Reviews.Title: Works great for 3 month
Reviews.Author: Eyal Gal
Reviews.Content: It seems that it's a known issue over the web. This camera has a nasty lense mechanism which tends toGet stuck when it thinks it saw dust from 10 klicks away. Does not worth the money. Surley there's a more reliable model.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot
Reviews.Author: Karra Gillingham
Reviews.Content: The little lens cover that is supposed to close when you turn off the camera will not.  Sometimes have a hard time with the color coming through as seen through the camera.  Other than that, which is enough, it seems to be a good camera.  I like the zoom on it.

Reviews.Title: Second Canon camera with stuck lens
Reviews.Author: fx3000
Reviews.Content: I can't recommend this camera at all. After a year and half the lens is getting stuck. It won't open or close without me having to wiggle my finger on it to assist it. This is the second Canon camera in a row where this has happened to me. Canon cameras are otherwise great but this is a showstopper that is now forcing me to look at other brands - or at least Canons that have a different type of lens cover. Anyway, very disappointed with having to buy a new camera now.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Unhappy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera less than a year ago and can no longer download pictures. It never was very easy. Now it won't download the pictures at all! I can no longer return it to Amazon either so now I am stuck with it.Buyer beware!  What a waste of money.

Reviews.Title: The camera WAS wonderful....
Reviews.Author: Schwartz
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera in November of 2011. It was great. I kept it in a case that I also bought on amazon and took excellent care of the product - never dropped it, only carried it with me when I was planning to use it etc. I went to take a picture one day and the camera just shut off with the lens open! I had just finished charging the battery, so I knew that couldn't be the problem. However, I went to an electronic store and bought a new canon battery just incase that was it, but unfortunately it wasn't. I am very disappointed with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Returned twice due to quality issues
Reviews.Author: BooksRFun
Reviews.Content: Ordered this for my daughter but had to return twice due to picture and video issues. Amazon finally said they could not replace it again and refunded my money. First one had picture problems where some shots will have few bubbles of various sizes  when you see them on a screen or even on the camera. The second one made loud sound while recording video and the sound will get recorded in the video. I am now looking for a better model. I have an older cannon that is awesome and works great even after 3 years but was disappointed with cannon on this model.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Color
Reviews.Author: GatoRat
Reviews.Content: My ex got the Lumix LZ3 in the divorce. It was a nice camera, but rather bulky for many occasions. I'd long wanted a super compact and this seemed to fit the bill, especially when it was on major sale at another establishment. Due to the price I paid, I almost gave this three stars, but found I couldn't recommend it at any price.On the plus side, the camera is very compact, very well built and has a very nice wide angle lens. I haven't used the HD video often, but it is much better than my old Lumix, though still has problems (see below). I actually like the simplicity of the settings, though the inability to easily override the basic settings has occasionally been a problem.On the negative side; the white balance is horrid. It will change even between consecutive pictures, especially in bright sunlight or low light. This happens with the HD video as well. It is quite annoying to be shooting a video of my granddaughter, shift the camera slightly and have the picture go yellow.(By comparison the Lumix was grainy and had poor color in low light, but in medium light and bright sunlight, the color was dead on. I miss that, especially at pools, the beach or the like.)The delay between pictures is excruciating at times. Sometimes it simply won't take a picture. I press the button, nothing happens, press it again, nothing happens, moment passes. Finally I can take a picture. Granted, this is common with digital cameras, but with Elph 300 HS seems worse than any I've used in this regard.The auto-focus is just plain weird. It's supposed to identify faces and focus on them. That works maybe half the time; the other half, it focuses on the most random things. On the other hand, you can force the focus point and it will track it correctly.I'm neutral on the flash. I've actually found it to be better than many other digital cameras I've used and I have fewer red-eye problems than with my Lumix (which also tended to overexpose a lot more.)* * *Update: Since I wrote this review, I've taken dozens of pictures, including some from a family vacation. Almost every picture is over saturated, has heavy yellowing and is soft. In several pictures with high contrast, the brights are completely blown out and the shadows over-exposed. I've had to color correct and sharpen almost every picture.This is a dreadfully bad camera where it counts--picture quality.* * *3/2/2014After returning from a vacation to Hawaii, I thought I'd lost all my pictures. Turns out they are still there and can be read by an SD card reader, but for some reason, the camera refuses to recognize them as valid. I suspect this is done in case one SD card is used in multiple cameras. Very disconcerting though.Another point is that while I'm still unimpressed with still images, the video it takes is quite good. I don't quite understand that.

Reviews.Title: Could not meet my expectation
Reviews.Author: M. Jiang
Reviews.Content: I got this one from Amazon last year for a trip to China. My wife used it primarily and I used for a few times since my main camera is a DSLR.If you are serious about image quality, this one would NOT work for you. It can only serve as a travel camera that has better pictures than cellphones.My very first Canon digital camera was also purchased from Amazon. It was way back in 2004 and the model was S500. Unfortunately, my mother-in-law broke it four years ago. If my memory serves right, the old one gave better picture quality than this new one.Pro1. compact2. battery lasts a whole day with full charge (600 pictures, some flashes, a couple videos)4. cosmetically pleasing5. enough picture quality for web sharing and 4x6 printsCon1. really soft images (focusing problem?)2. clear distortion at wide (24mm) and tele focal length3. video not true HD quality and taking humongous space comparing to any digital camcorder4. the advertised high-ISO sensitivity was achievable but at expense of very soft focus and blur (slow shutter speed)5. could have been more useful if aperture/speed/manual program was avaiableIn short, this camera did not meet my expectation. It was not much better than my old Canon compact. If you want to upgrade from your cellphone pictures, this could be it. If you are custom to any DSLR, this one will fail your expectation instantly.

Reviews.Title: Love the camera
Reviews.Author: Misshart
Reviews.Content: Only disappointment I have right now is I bought this camera for around 170....then a few days later it showed up as 130 something. ;-/ Kind of upset that i paid more when they changed the price that fast but whatever. The camera is so small and light weight im afraid its so fragile its gonna break. I love the camera though. The pictures show up crystal clear, all the different options for taking pictures packed into this tiny discreet camera are amazing.

Reviews.Title: LENS ERROR!!
Reviews.Author: Nathan O. Thorvilson, PhD
Reviews.Content: Loved the pics, but LENS ERROR after two months!!!  Ugh, spent a good amount of money on this camera, but it's the second time a Canon camera has had this lens error problem.  Frustrating.

Reviews.Title: Quicktime?! Arg!
Reviews.Author: J. Andar
Reviews.Content: We got this as a gift and can't return it, but if I could I would.  As a camera it works great, but who wants to go through the hassles of converting video .mov files to .wmv?  I just want to be able to play the video in Media Player and upload them to our family blog so that the grandparents can see them.  So far I can't do either.  I'm not techy at all, so this is a big pain for me to figure out.  Any suggestions?

Reviews.Title: Dead after one week
Reviews.Author: I. R. Gatsav
Reviews.Content: I've always been a fan of Canon cameras, so when I saw this one on sale, I quickly bought one.After receiving the camera, I did a full charge of the battery and played with it for one day to see what it can do (and to drain the battery).  The camera seems to take good pics (as expected from Canon) and I liked some of the new features (multi-shot burst, super slow-mo, etc).  Good low light capabilities.One complaint was that in Auto mode, the camera would continuously decide what to focus on -- not allowing me to focus on my subject and then shift the framing of the picture.After one week, the camera display went blank.  Seemed odd ... but i would push the shutter button and if would bring it back.  I checked my energy saving settings and the display was to stay on for 10 secs.  So, not sure what was going on.  Then, the camera would freeze up, with the green light on the back panel flashing, and no button/function working.  The only way to do anything, including turning off the camera, would be to remove the battery.  Would re-insert the battery and re-start the camera, but the camera would freeze up after any attempt to do anything (including viewing photos).So, hard to say much more about the camera since it is now useless.  Very disappointed.  Seems quality in Canon cameras has really gone down.

Reviews.Title: Great Black Friday Deal
Reviews.Author: Curtis
Reviews.Content: I've been checking this camera out for a few weeks now and it was $150 a while ago, jump back up to $179 and now back to $150. The only difference is that now, the 8gb class SD card and the HDMI cord is included. It is also tax-free(CA) and free shipping. I couldn't miss out on the offer so I had to get it. Now I gotta wait a week for it to come x]

Reviews.Title: Compact and easy to use, not very good without flash
Reviews.Author: V. Calderon
Reviews.Content: I had high hopes for this Canon considering I had previously owned one, but am disappointed in the functions and features it offers. While there is the basic automatic mode and there is a manual mode, the manual mode lacks sophisticated options. The zoom is pretty decent but trying to use the camera in manual mode with no flash leaves you with blurry pictures. If you are looking for a simple point and shoot then this is great camera for you, if you are looking for a camera with some customizations then I would go another route. I purchased this one because I was hoping to get the quality of a Canon and the simplicity of use for my husband's usage. I find myself retaking pictures quite frequently because I'm just not happy with the quality.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: copect
Reviews.Content: My wife absolutely loves this camera. We have the older version which is great, but this one has a few more additions my wife had to have( better zoom, better megapixals, but most of the fishbowl effect).

Reviews.Title: owner time
Reviews.Author: proud owner
Reviews.Content: All I can say is I love the camera. I've shown it off to many of my friends and relatives and they all agree that it's sweet. It's very user friendly. I know the Cannon Power Shot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera can do a lot more than I've done with it but it does what I want it to do beautifully.

Reviews.Title: Video is a downgrade from older models
Reviews.Author: J. Sinclair
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth Canon point and shoot camera, and the first time I am disappointed. One of the reasons I use my camera is to shoot some short videos at concerts. Each generation of Canon camera has been better than the previous one, until now.The biggest failure is that video is handled via a button, and not a setting. That means focusing is no longer an option. In a concert setting, with flashing lights and so much movement, the camera does a poor job of auto-focusing, leaving you with bad results.On top of that, the microphone seems to be of worse quality than previous models.Yes, we can zoom in now (a welcome feature) but if the video starts out blurry, zooming makes things worse. You need to stop filming and try again.And finally, the location of the button is hard to push, so most video start out shaky, because pushing the button moves the camera.Aside from the video mode, there has been a bad change in the camera mode. "Micro" is not handled the same as it was before, and especially in Auto mode, this camera always defaults to Micro before focusing on what's actually happening. So if you want to quickly pull out the camera and take a shot...don't. It will be in micro mode for whatever reason and takes a second to realize that you're trying to take a landscape picture.

Reviews.Title: would not buy it for myself
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a gift, as a gift this camera might be ok, but I would not buy it for myself. I realize that this camera is only $200 dollars but image sharpness is a huge problem for this camera. image color quality is OK, nothing to be excited about.  Most things about this camera i can tolerate because this camera is so cheap, but I did like video quality. of course this is not a camcorder so zooming and moving with the camera is not advisable but i thought that this camera produces better video than photos.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME camera for ur money!
Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: This is the BEST point & shoot I've had! The pictures are very crisp & clear! Every picture I take comes out great!  It has really neat settings like color swap & accent, toy camera mode, mini mode, & the high burst mode is pretty sweet! The high burst mode only takes pics that are 3mp but its still clear enuf for a good pic!  The HD movie mode is very awesome! everything is very crisp n clear! even at night!  The movie has its own button for convience which is pretty handy so i dont have to keep pressing buttons trying to find it.  The only thing ive had problems with is the macro mode.  Sometimes it doesnt focus very good, but i think its bc im too close to the subject.  Other than that i havent had any  problems yet, ive had it for about a month now.  I read somewhere that the camera is made in China & Japan, but the one from China breaks more, not for sure about that but i got the one from Japan!  I also got a steal on this camera! $199 when amazon was having a sale! I took some pics n put them in with the other pics to give u an idea of how much this little camera has to offer.  Sometimes if ur taking a video the battery will blink but wen u stop recording & switch to camera mode it says u have 2 bars left, found that kinda weird, but the batt can die on u.  The only flaw is the new cameras dont have a view finder! So when ur out in the bright sun the screen is useless & ur basically flying blind when taking a pic! I was debating on this one or the 100 hs, but i got this one cuz the navigation buttons seems easier than the 100, the 100 didnt have the separate video button.  Overall great camera for the money! very satisfied! =)

Reviews.Title: Almost
Reviews.Author: Annelise S.
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera to replace an older Sony point-and-shoot. Own two Canon D-SLR cameras (500D and T2i) and have been impressed with the pictures from both cameras.Heard good things about Canon's ELPH 300 HS, liked the size and thought it would work out. Unfortunately the flash has a way of overpowering almost everything in a picture; even when forcing the flash for backlit situations, the resulting images look unnatural. Flash output is so bright, and there's no nuance just like (unlike both the older Sony and the newer T2i).We ended up sending this one back and opting instead for an SX230HS at almost 50% higher price point.[...][...]

Reviews.Title: Good camera - don't buy the black one!
Reviews.Author: Bob Jones
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd canon digital elph, and hopefully not my last one (I'm only replacing the previous model because American Airlines shattered it).  Amazon was out of the silver model when I bought it, so I got the black one.  That was a mistake.  It's got some sort of texture to it that just makes it horrible to handle.  It's rough, it feels bad coming in an out of your pocket, a case, whatever.  Cleaning the screen is almost impossible because the "texture" grabs hold of most soft cloths that you would use.  I could easily see this snagging a sweater, etc.  The only thing I could imagine this texture would be for is improved grip, but honestly, I don't think that's ever been a problem for anyone.  These things are so light that it takes almost no effort to hold on to them.  The texture also collects any dirt or other particles around it.  After 5 minutes in my pocket (this is a pocket camera, after all) with what appeared to be a completely clean/empty hard candy wrapper, the camera came out covered in pink mess.  Also, the wrist strap on this model wasn't soft and flexible, but instead very stiff.  If I wasn't wearing it, but just grabbed the camera for a quick snapshot, I had to be very careful that the strap didn't stick straight out into the picture.  That should never be a problem one has to worry about.The picture quality on this camera isn't quite as good as it was on my previous model (SD770IS).  The quality isn't quite as sharp, the colors aren't quite as good, etc.  I can only hope that my particular camera was a fluke, both in the quality of the pictures and the roughness of the textures.  Come to think of it, I may pick up a different model instead of another one of these - maybe the SD4000IS or SD4500IS.

Reviews.Title: WOW Awful Quality
Reviews.Author: SMLTMS "smltms"
Reviews.Content: I have had many canon sd cameras before and was pretty happy with all of them. This camera is not really canon quality. It has a flimsy plastic-hinged door over its battery/memory card compartment - it is a matter of time when it breaks. The pictures come out very soft and there is a horrible lens noise when zooming in/out. The product I received is made in china. May be this has something to do with the quality. I am returning the camera - big disappointment. Please read other reviews of the camera before buying it. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: Solid performer but not exceptional - I returned one and the new one was better
Reviews.Author: J. Zhang "eagles"
Reviews.Content: I am just an average user owns a few cheaper point and shoot and a Canon SLR. The point and shoot camera I had all very good at day light but sucks at indoor pictures. The Canon SLR took great indoor pictures, with or without flash. I thought I could get better pictures perhaps with Canon point and shoot since the SLR does a good job.This was pretty disappointing. I wish I have not sold my old camera on ebay.Pros - Good looking; decent price. Okay with low light. Great HD video. Good battery life. Video button is a good idea. Good 24 mm and 5x zoomCons - too many:--Blurry pictures and no manual override to correct focus;--Over exposure - picture too bright;--JPG Compression too high, losing detail; making the 12M looks like 8M but worse; And No RAW format to count on--Out of focus even at video mode - my kids were dancing and the camera struggles to find focus - result in out of focus video - why Canon why?--Not very sturdy. Don't put it in your pocket without the case otherwise, I can imagine you'd get lens errors like other reviewers.Like other reviewers, I tried many things to see if I can come up with better results but I could not.Unlike other reviewers who want to know where its made of, I don't really care. Mind you, those iphones and ipads are all made in China and have the best quality. These days electronics use standard parts and standard quality control. Honestly, the Chinese workers are the most hard working. I would actually prefer stuff made in China, cause I know these workers are normal people. Assembly workers in Japan? That's so 80s. Only bombs in Japan would go work there. Same logic goes to labor work force in the US. We may have the best software engineers but best labors? Gimme a break. The Germans are different. I know they train professional workers like truck drivers for 3 years after high school. That's a trustable system. Anyway, my b.s. not related to Canon.I will keep this camera only because I sold my Kodak 893 - the 893 was great only a bit disappointing indoors.Canon, you'd better improve otherwise you will be just like Sony's TVs, getting killed by the Koreans and Chinese brands.----Updates ----Amazon lower the price by another $20 and don't have price protection? So I returned this one and got a new one. This new one can focus much better - I no longer have 50% of the blurry photos. Pictures still not as sharp (due to compression?) but at least its focused. So now I revised the rating to 4-star. It's good but not impressive; but consider the price its a good deal.

Reviews.Title: Not for photographers
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: This camera doesn't have shutter or aperture control. There is no excuse for this, canon could easily have given it a manual setting along with aperture and shutter priority, but they didn't. If you don't know what shutter and aperture are, then go ahead and buy the camera, its a fantastic point and shoot. But shutter and aperture are the very basics of how a camera works, why anyone would make a camera that doesn't let you control these is beyond me.It does have presets which gives you a vague kind of control over shutter and aperture. You can also manually control the ISO, but thats it. I think I'll be getting the 500 elph instead.

Reviews.Title: Returned This Camera
Reviews.Author: Nancy L. Otto "indiana71"
Reviews.Content: My 6 year old Canon PowerShot has a slower-than-desired time between pushing the button and taking a photo; and it isn't the best in low-light conditions...so I ordered this one after reading many reviews.Well, it didn't prove to be any better so I returned it.Amazon has a very good Returns system and I was pleased that this return had no complications.I will continue using the old Canon and work around it's shortcomings.

Reviews.Title: I get the lens error too
Reviews.Author: Christohper P. Furner "fsu23phd"
Reviews.Content: I got the red version of the 300HS during the Xmas 2011 season, via Amazon. I was pretty happy with it, the videos and pictures were good quality in good light, although luke warm in anything but perfect light.In February 2012, my 2 year old dropped it about 2 feet onto a carpet with the lens extended. There are no scuffs or marks.  Now it no longer takes pictures, and the lens won't retract. Whenever you turn it on, it says "Lens error, will shut down automatically, restart camera." Then shuts down.After some google work, I found that this is a common problem with this model.  Several people suggested fixes: removing and reinserting the battery, pulling the lens in each direction while restarting,  among others. None are working for me.I will see if this is covered by warranty, however I don't have high hopes. I understand my daughter dropped it (2 feet onto a carpet), but I am not impressed with the durability, so I make this post as a warning to shoppers that the durability is poor. I am echoing a complaint that has been voiced by a number of other owners of this model.

Reviews.Title: A bad camera , a good camera recorder
Reviews.Author: aber
Reviews.Content: THis is the worst camera I have had. Before this, I just returned a S95 because S95 only have 28mm wide-angle. I need a more wider camera for carried everyday' so I bought this for its 24mm wide-angle. However, the photo quality is really bad, I have to resize the 4000*3000 photo to 1200*900, then the picture looks better. I hate small CMOS sensor!!!If the photo quality of  DSLR is 100, S95 could be 80, and this one, I think just 40!!The only one thing makes me still keeping this, is this camera has amazing DV quality. The quality of HD movie generated by this ELPH300 is even better than many camera-recorders, but it is really small and easy to carry. So I decide  to keep it as a easy carried and wid-angle DV, but not a camera.Good: small, good movie quality.Bad: really bad photo quality. white balance is not accurate.

Reviews.Title: Happy while it lasted
Reviews.Author: kim_pdx "Kim"
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera until it broke. It broke 2 years after I bought it and it's completely dead (lens stuck in out position and even force won't push it back in).

Reviews.Title: Close-ups not sharp
Reviews.Author: Gaurang Master
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera based on ratings in Amazon. But, it did not take sharp close-ups and seemed to have a little shadow in the top left corner. Maybe it was a defective unit. I'll be looking for another model or another brand.

Reviews.Title: Great camera... get an extra warranty
Reviews.Author: Jeremy dePrisco "www.mindspeak.com"
Reviews.Content: This is likely the best camera I have owned in this class. I am an amateur photographer, and I like the portability. I've got some great pictures from this camera on a number of vacations and for musical performances that I attend or where I perform. It doesn't do macro mode as well as my old 2.1 MP Fuji, but I can forgive that.Reason I can't give this more stars is that it has some design flaws. I've had two of these cameras so far - my original May 2011 purchase, then a replacement that was needed for spots on the lens from dust (Sept 2011). Canon warranty was good that time. But now (June 2013) I am getting ready to send it back because of the same problem and an additional flaw where the shutter doesn't close all the way. Problem is, now it is out of warranty, and I don't know if they will be as forgiving.This camera sucks up dust incredibly quickly. Even though I keep mine in a case most of the time, it seems there some flaw with the casing or the telescope lens that just encourages dust to get inside. You can NOT put this think in the pocket of your kaki's and expect it to remain dust free. Kind of kills the portability.A repair right now is $160. The camera is going for $175 new on Amazon. Still not sure I wan the same camera if this is going to happen in another year. Might be time for another brand.

Reviews.Title: Camera might be great, but this seller is suspicious
Reviews.Author: Tynka
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera and let me tell you, the packaging is clearly not original. The box says canon, but that's it, it only has a small sticker on the side with a model written on it. the way all the contents were packed inside makes it look like this is not a new camera. I have purchased a Canon camera before and the box was for that particular model, will all the contents stored inside the proper way. This one had some kind of foam piece and all contents in plastic bags. ALSO, there was no warranty card! I am calling them first thing in the morning and see what they say. Oh and mine is black.

Reviews.Title: I am not impressed with this camera at all
Reviews.Author: Hannah Regis
Reviews.Content: I am thinking of paying more for a better camera because I am not impressed with the quality of photos this camera take. Photos are dull, that are not sharp at all. Maybe there was something wrong with the particular camera that i got, but the quality is really bad

Reviews.Title: The camera is just ok.
Reviews.Author: Jose A Goria
Reviews.Content: The black paint on it is discolouring... it looks horrible and old. The HD Video is in MVI format, what I don't like becauseWindows Movie Maker doesn't accept it. Very difficult to edit it.

Reviews.Title: Good, but was expecting higher quality pictures
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Fernandez
Reviews.Content: A great point and shoot with some cool shooting modes, but the photos could be crisper, and I can't find a mode that will capture the bright scenes well.  For example, a snowy mountain peak (from a distance) against a blue sky is very hard to capture.  the mountain and sky blend together as nearly white in the shot.  It would be nice if there were a manual setting that allowed you to custom-adjust the shutter speed.

Reviews.Title: Cannon makes good cameras
Reviews.Author: kim
Reviews.Content: The camera takes awesome pictures and the price was ok.  I did find other cameras cheaper in local stores.  I like all the functions but it it hard to go thru the menu just to erase a picture.  And I wouldn't even begin to try to set a different flas setting or anything else.

Reviews.Title: Night pictures are a bit green
Reviews.Author: Ethan Jewett
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera overall, but Canon changed something from the previous model (1400IS) and now the night pictures have a greenish hue. Even though this one has a lot more options than the 1400IS, I would get the 1400IS if you like rich warm photos. My girlfriend likes the green though, so maybe you'll like it too.

Reviews.Title: Not Up to Expectations
Reviews.Author: Glenn M. Fujinaka DDS
Reviews.Content: This is the second Canon Elph camera that developed the same problem on the view screen and finished prints.  They both developed "black spots" or drop in pixels in the upper right section.  It was about the size of a pea on the finished prints and occurred within 7 months. If you took a blue sky photo, the dark spot would occur in the same upper right corner on both cameras.  Canon declined to comment on this problem, but I feel I can't be the only one experiencing this problem.I would not recommend this product even though I own over 3 Canon SLR cameras and numerous lens.  Sorry!

Reviews.Title: Some upgrade
Reviews.Author: CJ Whittle
Reviews.Content: I had an older model which I used for going to concerts. That was destroyed in a car crash so I thought I would upgrade since the Cannon Powershots have always been good to me. This one FAILS. They added features and "quality" however now the camera doesn't always take the photo or focus properly and is really slow compared to older models. I was so disapointed. As far as this brand of camera goes...Newer is not always better. Also this whole quality thing they were supposed to upgrade also fails. Every single picture on every setting is grainy. Also the calendar never sets so each time I turn the camera on, I have to quickly try to exit it before I can take a shot. This is now my junk camera for when I am out hiking and there is high possibility of it breaking. At least if it breaks I will have an excuse to replace it. BTW I have had this camera for almost a year now and I use it all the time and have yet to get it to be as good as the older ones.

Reviews.Title: If you even breathe while taking a picture it comes out blurry
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: I love the gorgeous, metallic candy apple red color, but that's about all I love about this camera.  If you even breathe while taking a picture it comes out blurry.  I mean I have never owned a more 'sensitive' camera in my life.  And the video is a joke unless you are outside in full daylight.  Inside even with lights one looks awful, and outside at night you might as well be filming mud.  We used it to record the kids going trick-or-treating and even in the brightest porch lights it was pretty bad. I've had some issue with Canon cameras in the past, but this is the worst.  My sister has the exact same model and has the exact same problems.

Reviews.Title: Very grainy and blurred pictures
Reviews.Author: Sonia Malik "Mommies Dream"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as I needed a small, compact camera for occasions when I don't want to carry my bulky DSLR. Unfortunately the results are terrible ! I have given this camera over a year to perform and have tried all settings with no luck. The pictures have way too much noise, are blurred and funnily tends to make everyone look at least 20 pounds heavier. Extremely disappointed :-(

Reviews.Title: faulty
Reviews.Author: dani
Reviews.Content: I was sold a faulty item..Very disappointed.the camera lens would not focus at all when i first got it.I tried everything and took it to a repair shop who told me it be cheaper to buy a new one...never again will I buy from this store

Reviews.Title: Good pictures, terrible durability
Reviews.Author: Jay in Michigan
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in June 2011.  The pictures were good, though not as great as I had hoped.  They were only somewhat better than those I had taken with a Sony Cybershot purchased in 2003.  The HD video, however, was excellent and quickly became a favorite feature.  Unfortunately, the camera refused to open when I turned it on in September.  I sent it back to Canon and they replaced it.  I paid shipping.  I had a new camera in a week.  The camera they sent me, however, was defective.  The shutter would not consistently open all the way or close completely.  I needed to send it back again.  They paid shipping this time, and replaced it once more.  Another week without a camera.  In January, I noticed a spot had developed on the lens that showed up on any photo I took with telephoto.  Very frustrating.  I didn't address it immediately with Canon, however, having already been frustrated with my experiences with the camera.  Then last week I took the camera to the park--I placed it in my front pants pocket as I've always done, and when I took it out, the top of the camera had split open and one of the tabs that held the camera together was sticking out.  I sent the camera back to Canon.  They considered this damage to the camera and refused to fix it without charging me $140.  Now, nine months into this camera, I'm left with virtually nothing--I'm not going to invest anymore money into the camera because of its durability issues.  My Sony lasted eight years--the main reason I wanted to upgrade was the advances in technology.  I didn't treat this camera any differently than I treated the Sony.  My recommendation is to stay away from this Canon Powershot Elph 300 HS--it's a durability nightmare.  Four major concerns in nine months, and now, no Canon support.

Reviews.Title: cannot handle bright light
Reviews.Author: Hupbach, Almut
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed in this camera.  I bought it because I have had good experiences with Canon cameras in the past, and because it is small and lightweight, and therefore, seemed like an ideal travel companion.  But it CANNOT handle bright light.  I tried every possible setting, and still, bright light shows up as white, and the rest of the picture is blurred or colors are all distorted.  One good thing is the video setting - it shoots nice videos.  But again, the bright light issue "overshadows" all the pros for me.

Reviews.Title: love canon
Reviews.Author: merjohan
Reviews.Content: I love canon products and refuse to buy anything different because they are so durable. however, the quality of the picture is not QUITE what I had hoped... some pictures turn out blurry. this also may be user error of course :)

Reviews.Title: Error!
Reviews.Author: S. Coleman "S Coleman"
Reviews.Content: True to form, this Canon Elph presented an Error E32 message within days of purchase. It seems this is common with Canon brand digital products.  This camera is going back and I am done with Canon products. Switching to Nikon and not looking back after a bad run of Canon digital products with bad picture quality, errors, and quickly dead batteries.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera-No Manual
Reviews.Author: D. Berry
Reviews.Content: I would have given this a higher rating but the cameral only comes with a few pages of how to get started and no user manual. I don't know what the icons mean and I don't really know all of its capabilities. It came with a CD Rom in place of the manual but my computer's operating system isn't updated enough for this new camera. What about others who don't even own a computer but just want a nice little camera and know how to use it. Canon should be able to provide me with one but there are only download links and I'm a dial-up user so there again I'm out of luck. I really hope that Canon Company will be able to send me a manual. This should just be an automatic item included.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: smoore000
Reviews.Content: I love this little camera, I had the Canon powershot sd 780 before, this camera is pretty much the same, with pretty much the only difference I saw was 1080 on the video and stereo sound. It has a black flat finish which is nice , you don't get the scratching on the body that I did on the old one. The pictures are great and the Video is fantastic. I was hoping the sound would have been a little better, I usually video some of the live bands , and was hoping for better audio, but was a little disappointed. Over all its a Canon, and you really cant go wrong with Canon, the price was good, and the shipping was fantastic, literally 1 1/2 days , and that was with free shipping. Bottom line is I love the Canon Powershots, so much, that I bought this one over my last one, strictly for the 1080.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: P. Crosby
Reviews.Content: Great value camera, takes great pictures and short video's.  I mainly bought it for short video's and it does a great job too.  I highly recommend it if you need a good camera at a good price for pictures and videos.

Reviews.Title: This camera worked flawlessly with the AAXA P4 Pico Projector
Reviews.Author: Abdullah
Reviews.Content: I take pictures all the time and need to share them in class with everyone. For a point and shoot camera this camera has great potential to take fast decent quality shots. I can then connect it to my P4 and show the class examples of how to take quick pictures. This works for me, because we often go around the campus and I can project anywhere on the white walls. I can also show the students the view I am seeing through the camera and the angles I need in order to make it work because of the projector. This is a battery intensive process and the Canon PowerShot ELPH doesn't die on me even though I virtually have it on and projecting the entire time. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good
Reviews.Author: Edwin Diaz "Fantasy Fiend"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera over a month ago, and so far I love it. Its very easy to use, takes great pics, and has not given me any issues at all. Price is also very affordable in my opinion!  An excellent point-and-shoot camera all around.Pros-Easy to useGreat battery lifeTakes very good picturesCons--Very small camera, some may not like this as it makes it harder to hold and easy to drop-No memory card included!?

Reviews.Title: Simply Awesome
Reviews.Author: Jason Nobody
Reviews.Content: I needed a camera to take on vacation and my D90 and expensive lenses weren't going to Mexico. I wanted something that was easy to shoot that allowed me to create shots like I might with my Nikon. I understand this price point isn't going to get you a DSLR BUT this little camera really performed.The one thing that really surprised me about the Powershot 300 HS was the video quality. I wasn't expecting movie quality but WOW... it really blew me away. High resolution, good sound, no shake... fantastic.Look for my uploaded pictures in the customer media section above. Certainly a great camera for the money.J

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT, but...
Reviews.Author: Fela
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, simple, small, weird feeling of the material, great zoom, image quality, everything GRAT, BUT, when battery is about to run low, it does not show on the screen. I only get a red battery blinking on displey, but I dont get the 2 bars nor 1 bar battery :( it should right?

Reviews.Title: Great pocket camera
Reviews.Author: Daniel W. Lindsey
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for your pocket or purse. Smaller than a phone camera with 10 times the picture quality. Case has an anti-slip surface which makes handling a camera this small much safer. I still use the camera wrist strap. Build quality is outstanding, as it is made in Japan like the high-end Canon cameras. See CNET for their review, they are the experts in electronics.

Reviews.Title: So far I love it.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Great camera! I got the black one and I like the rough exterior, and it's not very heavy. On the right mode the pictures come out very crisp, and the vividity of color of all the pictures (not just in vivid mode) is nice.

Reviews.Title: Excellent point & shoot;
Reviews.Author: Roger C. Fleck
Reviews.Content: small easy to use; takes great flash pictures, battery lasts a long time and picture quality is excellent.  very pleased with this purchase, would buy again!

Reviews.Title: Yet another spectacular failure from Canon
Reviews.Author: igost
Reviews.Content: I simply don't understand how this camera managed to get so many positive reviews.Yes it's compact, fast, pretty and inexpensive. But it fails where it matters most - producing quality images in auto mode.Pictures are coming out soft, non-contrast, underlighted. And wide angle lens added a new "feature": if your picture features tall objects on the sides (trees, buildings), and is shot below horizontal optical center, they would be "falling down" to the middle of the picture. Big way falling. Pisa tower falling. Get your cropping skills polished.I bought this camera as a replacement for SD1400, which had another big problem - "soapy" corners on most pictures. So far I don't see how the new camera is better - it's still a lot of cropping, with even less contrast.I think, Canon got too carried away with adding new features and forgot about the most important thing - quality of the picture.The last reliable Elph I had was SD1200. With less pixels, less macros it was producing far better quality pictures than anything that came from Canon after it.Something tells me it's my last point-and-shoot from Canon. Very disappointed.Update 11/23/2011: returned to AmazonUpdate 12/02/2011: just got a Canon SX230 - what a difference! Such a quality pictures, minimal distortion on a wide shots, and 14x zoom is simply unbeatable for the size. Should have bought it from the beginning.Let me just re-iterate my findings: Canon 300 HS is simply a bad camera producing bad pictures, looks like Canon had cut a lot of corners while making it. Spend few bucks more and get yourself a real camera, not a cute toy.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality and photos can't be dragged and dropped to PC
Reviews.Author: Bears_fan
Reviews.Content: I got the Elph 300 HS as a gift.  I had just bought a different brand of compact P&S;, but returned it after I saw all the great ratings and reviews for the Elph 300HS from professional reviewers and customers. After having the Elph 300 HS camera for a month I am really surprised that so many reviews are positive, which have fooled me and others into going with this mediocre camera.  Yes, it looks nice and is small, but the image quality is very disappointing and there is no way to directly drag and drop the photos from the camera onto your computer.Image quality - This camera is touted as being good in low light due to Canon's update to better sensor technology in this model.  Far from being better in low light, it is much worse than my previous compact point and shoot.  Indoor images are blurred when anyone in them makes even the slightest of motion during the shot.  And they are not just a little blurred; they are significantly blurred even when the lighting in the room is good.  I also have experienced an excessive yellowness to images taken without the flash indoors.  With most cameras there is usually a nice warmness to photos taken indoors without flash, but the Elph 300 HS goes way beyond a nice warmness to excessive yellowing.Downloading photos - I am surprised that I read nothing about the lack of direct download capability in all my research on this camera.  I went on a weekend trip and afterward went to download my photos to my Mac like usual with all my prior cameras.  I have always dragged and dropped the photos onto my hard drive into folders, and only import them into software programs when I want to edit them.  When I connected the camera to several different computers, none of them show the camera as an external drive.  As a result, this camera does not allow dragging and dropping; you must use a software program just to get the photos to your computer.  You have to install and use the software from Canon's CD, or use iTunes or iPhoto or similar to get the photos from the camera to a computer.  This is a hassle and a waste of time.  After then searching specifically for this problem online, I found that some others have experienced the same issue and it appears to be the camera design and not a unique problem with my camera or computer.  Why doesn't Canon allow drag and drop?  I wonder if Canon could not get the camera to be so conveniently small if it had included whatever was needed to allow drag and drop, and thus it traded a capability that ever other digital camera I've had came with in order to try to appear so attractively small to buyers.  I never imagined I wouldn't be able to just drag and drop the photos because I've never known anyone who couldn't from their digital camera.With these major flaws already apparent after only a few weeks of use, I would not recommend the Elph 300 HS.

Reviews.Title: Please Don't buy!
Reviews.Author: airmanxx
Reviews.Content: The 1 star reviews are not kidding! I saw them and chose to ignore, and wasted a lot of my time for doing so.  My lens failed with less than 100 photos on the clock.  This thing is very cheaply made- feels like a toy compared to my SD870is it was supposed to replace (slower to startup/shut down too) Mine was made in China- I am guessing Japan ones were an earlier production run and are all gone. Please don't support the company by buying their cheaply made products.  Very disappointed in cannon for taking a nose dive in build quality.Oh, and the photos were nothing special.

Reviews.Title: Moving metal broken in just 1 week
Reviews.Author: James M. Peake
Reviews.Content: I just started using this Canon Power Shot ELPH 300 HS.  The metal clam shell that opens and closes every time you prepare to shoot stopped opening in the 1st week of actually using the camera.  It might have been due to the fact that I did not get the accessories package with it and get the case that comes with it.  It also did not come with a flash card so i could not start using it when I first received it, I did not see any mention about that when I bought it.  If they did say something it did not jump out at me.  Now I'm stuck on a 3 leg trip with only a cell phone camera.  I will replace it but I would not buy it new again.  Very disappointing!

Reviews.Title: Be careful about the image quality
Reviews.Author: J. Zhang
Reviews.Content: Except the image quality, I feel I like this camera especially the size, the building quality. However, the image quality is the most thing people cared about for a camera, right?After reading the reviews, I make my decision to give it a try since I never expect the image quality comparable with DSLR. But I am so disappointed because the pictures are almost not useful at all and much worse than my 4 years old cannon SD450/470. Also, by reading other camera reviews, it seems very normally happened to most of the latest compact cameras regardless which brand is. I really don't understand how the technology is developed cross the whole camara industrial. Without customers' satisfition, maximum the profit from a single product doesn't make them rich.The camera is back to where it came from and I have to thank Amazon for their best custom service.

Reviews.Title: buttons not intuitive or as user friendly given the long learning curve for this company
Reviews.Author: Dwight
Reviews.Content: I can't wait for the Samsung Galaxy Note 3 to come out so we won't have to keep this camera at the ready.  It's faster to learn how to use a smartphone then to figure out all the options on this camera.Also, the ZoomEx browser provided by Canon does not recognize its own camera. I also have a Canon printer that won't provide working drivers for Windows 7 so the software with this company is an issue for me.

Reviews.Title: Poor image quality
Reviews.Author: Formertenor
Reviews.Content: I bought mine from a Best Buy vending machine in the Philadalphia Airport last year. I just wanted a really simple compact point 'n shoot. It has some great qualities and conveniences, but image quality seems very poor at most normal ISO settings of 100 - 400.  There is far too much noise and nothing appears to be in sharp focus.  Blow-ups are a lost cause.  The only good pictures were some closeups of model train parts which for some reason were far sharper than pictures taken outdoors in good lignt.  Did I get a lemon?

Reviews.Title: "Lens error" - on two cameras of same model
Reviews.Author: E. Cho "echomyst"
Reviews.Content: I want to love this camera.I even bought a second one after my first broke due to the dreaded "lens error". I'd figured it was my fault the first time: I'd dropped it 2-3 feet while it was turned on, and the lens could not retract.The second camera broke today, months after purchase.It was stored in my pocket. It must have turned on by itself (rubbed against something, perhaps?), because when I took it out, the lens had forced its way out, got jammed, and the camera gave me the "lens error" message.I am done with this model.I'd loved the pocket size, the relatively quick shutter speeds, the video quality, the wide angle, the relatively good quality of photos in low-light settings, the special effects, ...But all these are not worth replacing the camera every few months due to its apparently common lens problem.

Reviews.Title: Meh....
Reviews.Author: Bernell Clifford
Reviews.Content: Love the size of this camera. Not thrilled about the quality. Seems like the plastic battery/memory card slot cover could snap off easily. Not a whole lot of options on this thing, but it seems to take decent pics. Movie quality is okay. Overall, I'm underwelmed.

Reviews.Title: Great features, but.......
Reviews.Author: Sky Sox Wiz
Reviews.Content: I have owned 4 Canon Powershot cameras the latest being  SD1000 which I replaced/supplemented with this new 300HS.I haven't done a lot of technical shooting with it but am very pleased with its ability to shoot low-light pics.  The tiny wrist strap was constantly getting in the picture so I took it off. BAD IDEA.  When I dropped the 300HS the LCD display screen cracked and I now have web lines running through my shooting/review screen.  I looked at the squarish metal case of the SD1000 and saw dozens of dents and dings where I had dropped/banged it with no ill effects.  Maybe this new girl is just too sleek and pretty for a daily driver.

Reviews.Title: Not as good as it looks
Reviews.Author: Nexustoday
Reviews.Content: I like the camera overall.zoom sucks if you looking for a really good zoom this is not the camera you should look for.Picture are shaky not to the canon standardsVideo is amazing but again low light sucks

Reviews.Title: great little camera but....
Reviews.Author: Ron Neupauer
Reviews.Content: The camera is perfect for on-the-go point and shoot photography, good quality images, fairly rapid shutter response, wide range of options, although the menu is a bit cumbersome. Also wish there was a better way to choose ISO/shutter speed/ aperture combinations for special situations. "Kids and pets" doesn't quite cover it.One big problem - after just 2 and 1/2 months usage, the retracting lens cover stopped working. When I turn the camera on, it retracts just slightly, requiring me to manually push the curtain back. Then when I turn it off, the cover does not fully close over the lens, allowing dust and particles to possibly scratch the lens or further interfere with the mechanism of the curtain. I'm going to take it to an authorized Canon dealer to see what if anything can be done about this.

Reviews.Title: Canon Elph 300 = VERY disappointing
Reviews.Author: Di
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was very excited when I read reviews on the Canon ELPH 300 so I decided to replace my Canon SD1000 with the ELPH 300.  After using the ELPH 300 I have to say that I am VERY VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED!  The camera is AWFUL when it comes to action shots = everything is out of focus.  I can't depend on the ELPH 300 to give me GOOD PICTURES.  I am mad at myself for not returning it to Amazon for a refund......shame on me for waiting to return it.  I plan on going back to using my "dependable" Canon SD1000. AMAZON "IF" you read this review - feel free to contact me...........would love my $$$$ back

Reviews.Title: Bad shutter lens
Reviews.Author: Brian B
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera and loved it for the first 200-250 photos.  Approx two months later the shutters that opens and closes to protect the lens stopped working.  Now I'm stuck with a $200 inop camera.  DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT.  I took very good care of the camera and used caution when using it.

Reviews.Title: poor quality
Reviews.Author: thomas m schaller
Reviews.Content: auto mode very inaccurate color and quite blurry. very inconsistent shooting the same subject under same lighting yielded different quality photos. do not recommend this at all

Reviews.Title: Everything excellent except the camera.
Reviews.Author: Hilario Esguerra
Reviews.Content: The canon camera is okay, but it is a pain to hook in that darned wrist strap to the camera..Hilario Esguerra

Reviews.Title: Poor menu design and a lot of features missing
Reviews.Author: Tom Roberts
Reviews.Content: Poor menu design and a lot of features missing from what is called a "digital camera" at this price in my opinion. Get this one if it's all you can afford. Wa wa.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it for the money
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: I was much happier with my cheap Kodak Easy Share camera. This one came to me with a defective battery (the seller is replacing) plus it doesn't take great photos. It is very hard to capture shot of anyone moving-they are all blurry.

Reviews.Title: Canon PowerShot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: troy  stennett
Reviews.Content: THE IMAGES LOOK OKAY , VIDEO RECORDINGS @ 1080P WERE DECENT BUT THIS DEFAULT SETTING OF  THE UNIT THAT STOPS RECORDING AFTER 10MINS  IS ABSOLUTELY  RIDICULOUS .DOES ANYONE JNOW A WAY VIA FIRMWARE TO BYPASS THIS FEATURE ?WISH I'D KNOWN THIS BEFORE I BOUGHT THIS PIECE OF CRAP .

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD CAMERA but BAD BAD PACKAGING!!!!
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: So far the camera takes good pictures and very easy to use . The packaging was very very cheap  I was very dissapointed!!

Reviews.Title: Bad pictures
Reviews.Author: Ralph Mansi
Reviews.Content: The pictures are not sharp as you would expect from a Canon Camera.I have had 1MP cameras that took clearer pictures then this 12MP does.

Reviews.Title: The worst camera of my life
Reviews.Author: Samuel
Reviews.Content: used only for 6 months and lenses present a problem, certainly the brand Canon is bothering customers preferred the brand, now I decide to buy a Panasonic Lumix, which has never given me problems

Reviews.Title: lens cover bends easily
Reviews.Author: Amytris Faus "amytris faus"
Reviews.Content: The,  camera was good, but the lens cover bends very easily!I sent it back, but the replacement also bentThis is in no way covered by the warranty. too bad. waste of money.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Norman C. Bauer "stormincb"
Reviews.Content: This camera was purchased for my wife, who is taking pictures frequently. Her previous Canon failed, thus purchasing this one. She is having a terrible time with "fuzzy" pictures. The action button is held to allow focus to take place, but the resulting pictures don't show a sharp image. Flash, even when selected, doesn't always work either.Probably wouldn't but this product again. It was researched before purchase and seemed like a good camera for her.Here's a link to the camera. [...]

Reviews.Title: nice basic camera
Reviews.Author: barry
Reviews.Content: This a nice basic camera with a 5X zoom. I was looking for a replacement to an older ELPH I was using that belongs to a friend. I realized the higher zoom was what I really wanted. I didn't check all the spec before buying this camera. Yea, it has a greater zoom, but it lacks some of the other features from the other camera such as the ability to take black & white or sephia shots, color swap, etc. Although I rarely used those functions it would have been nice to have them.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, not great
Reviews.Author: akw825
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace a Samsung camera that stopped working.  I've had one Powershot before and never had any problems with it so I thought I'd try my luck with another one.  At first I thought it was a horrible camera, but I only used it on the auto setting.  Once I changed it from auto to manual and messed around with those settings, the pictures instantly got better.  It's still not the greatest camera I've ever owned, but hopefully it doesn't crap out on me like my last one did.Battery life is good, just like my last Canon.  I really like the compact size.  It's really small, but still easy to manipulate the controls.  I was able to get it on sale for $125.  I don't think I'd be willing to pay much more than that.  I'm fairly happy with this purchase, but I'm not expecting this to last more than a couple years before I'll start looking for a new one again.

Reviews.Title: Muy bonita pero algo no convence
Reviews.Author: Michvar
Reviews.Content: No soy experto en camaras, pense que la camara era mas delgada, sin embargo es pequeña y portable, las fotos estan bien y el video en 1080p se nota, lo unico es que algo le falta y no se que es, algo hay que no me deja 100% satisfecho, sin embargo es una excelente camara para toda ocasion y el color rojo esta muy chevere.

Reviews.Title: Good stuff so far
Reviews.Author: Scott H. Hekman "SlowSand"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to replace my Sony Cybershot DSCW170/B 10.1MP Digital Camera after that camera broke from only 2.5 years of use.  I really liked the performance of that camera but was surprised at its fragility.  I really like the simplicity of operation and the quality of pictures this Canon takes so far and really hoping this one lasts longer.

Reviews.Title: Canon Quality Lacking
Reviews.Author: MAGIC KOALA
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I didn't have much time to try it out  as after a few hours I received the dreaded "Lens Error" message, and it stopped working.I purchased the camera from another vendor, and I probably took about 10-20 indoor shots before the zoom lens broke. My observations are: very noisy ISO 400 and above, IS at 1/20 seems to be the threshold, picture quality quite dull and muted.I used center focus, and it did focusing, focus lock, recompose very well. The speed burst mode worked well too. In general, it's very responsive and the controls are well-planned. I'm just surprised how poor the images look. I will say, my other cameras are the 7D and the G11 so perhaps my expectations are too high. However, I did compare other photos I shot with my dinosaur Canon SD200, and they looked much better for a point & shoot. I really think they should continue to match/reduce megapixel count to the resolve power of the sensor.I've also researched the cryptic "Lens Error" message and it looks like it's a very common problem with Canon point & shoots. Canon has a high failure rate amongst point & shoots, while others such as Panasonic (and I don't own any Panasonic cameras) have better quality controls.

Reviews.Title: So disappointed
Reviews.Author: Beej
Reviews.Content: I have owned this camera for over a year now. I wanted to love it. I own a dslr and I just needed a back up for travel and those times when it isn't convenient to carry something heavy and bulky. The only thing that I thought would be better than a camera that fits discreetly in my pocket, would be a dslr that folds up for convenient transport.This camera is not the answer. I have lost so many moments due to its unreliability. This is not user error, this camera is prone to blur. It takes nice HD video, but it was not my intention to buy a tiny video camera. I don't recommend this to anyone for snapping those important moments. I have lost too many smiles in the last year and I'm going back to my dslr no matter how awkward it is to carry around.

Reviews.Title: Exceedingly Poor Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Blair "blair52"
Reviews.Content: Having owned a Canon Elph SD600 (2006 model) which took gorgeous, sharp, clear photos, I was stunned to see the exceedingly poor quality images from this "new and improved", 12 megapixel camera with all its many bells and whistles. Grainy, lack of sharpness or depth, muddy colors -- you would think that pics were taken by a $60 junk camera in high ISO mode. I returned the camera.I think it boils down to the sensors the cameras use and the lens. The older and more expensive "CCD" sensors are better than the cheaper to make "CMOS" sensors you find in many compact cameras today (note: I am not talking about large CMOS sensors in DSLR cameras). My Elph SD600 has a CCD sensor, as does my newly acquired Canon SD850 (2007 model). The lens may be better in the older models as well, but that's just a hunch.As to another owners favorable review, I would disagree as to the concept of requiring a DSLR for "professional pictures" (the suggestion being that if you wanted great images you had to buy a DSLR -- you couldn't get them in a compact camera). I think many of the earlier Elph models are outstanding cameras and so does Ken Rockwell and most of the other camera review sites. The SD850, for example, shoots superlative images. Indeed, some so good that when looking at various images shot on holiday, with the Elph or with my Lumix (with Leica lens) I sometimes can't tell which camera shot which image.  On Ken Rockwell's site, photos taken with the Canon PowerShot S95 are absolutely DSLR quality.Another issue:  for those who plan to buy the black color version of this camera: the exterior finish is very rough, bordering on uncomfortable. The texture is almost prickly sharp to the touch. I hated it (in the store) and bought the smooth, silver model instead.DO YOURSELF A FAVOR: Read through the 2 star and 1 star reviews. Read the "Comments" too. There are too many reviews and comments reporting similar problem issues to be dismissed. In my opinion, this is a bad camera -- avoid it.

Reviews.Title: new camera.
Reviews.Author: Douglas Anthony
Reviews.Content: We just got this new camera so we are still learning how to use it. We are excited to learn all the features of this new unit.

Reviews.Title: GREAT LITTLE CAMERA.
Reviews.Author: Mr. Samuel W. Sisson
Reviews.Content: I purcchased this camera for my 84 year old mother. I wish it had a neck chain. I don't think she would lose it so often then!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures, poor craftsmanship, worse customer service
Reviews.Author: Jamie Zeitzer
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Canon ELPH 300 HS less than a year ago. Loved the still pictures and videos it took. After three months of ownership, the front lens cover got dented because I placed this "pocket" camera in my, you guessed it, pocket. Unfortunately the keys that cohabited this front pocket dented the flimsy lens cover. No matter, a cosmetic flaw. Three months later, however, the lens would not extend and the camera would immediately switch off (dreaded "Lens Error"). From a variety of news postings, it seems that this is not an uncommon problem in the ELPH because sand or dirt (you know, things that might end up in small amounts in your pocket) can get into the zoom assembly and cause it to jam. I sent in the camera, paperwork, and warranty to Canon. Canon then sent an email informing me that (1) they don't fix this camera, ever and (2) because of the unrelated damage, they won't offer a replacement (they would be happy to replace it with a refurbished unit for full price!). I then called the service number and spoke with two incredibly unknowledgeable and unhelpful customer "service" representatives who read to me from a script and who continued to refuse to honor the warranty. I cannot recommend strongly enough against buying this camera - you are buying something that is poorly made from a company that has no intention of honoring their warranty.

Reviews.Title: yellow pictures--no thanks!
Reviews.Author: Scott Morgan
Reviews.Content: If you plan to ever take pictures in dim lighting then this is not the camera for you!  You will get a sickly bright yellow light to all your pictures and Cannon will do nothing to help you with this.  When I called them they said I could change about 62 settings to make it just right--yea, like I have time to do that when my child is doing something adorable for 2 seconds.  They did not even offer to take a look at it or exchange it for another model.  So, I am stuck with a costly mistake and will definitely never purchase another Cannon product due to their insanely unstellar assistance.

Reviews.Title: disappointed in canon
Reviews.Author: linda newcomb
Reviews.Content: after walking into the gulf of mexico with my old olympus stylus in my pocket i was devastated. it was the best point and shoot i've ever had. my mom surprised me with the elph 300. she looked at reviews and researched and decided to go with "quality". this camera is the biggest disappointment! first i was surprised by the bad design. its small and heavy which is good but the flash is on the corner right where your fingers go. yes you can hold it differently to get your fingers out of the way but then you have an insecure grasp on the camera. the video is a nightmare. i haven't stumbled on the secret of a decent video. sometimes you get one sometimes you get nothing but pixels. if you set the camera on auto you will get the camera shake symbol for every situation. does a point and shoot really have to be on a tripod for any and every shot? so the only thing to do is set it on manual and put it on the scene you want. bright sun dim indoor what ever. and then you hope for the best. when you get it its great but its a dice toss... i need a dependable camera. many of my photos are used at a professional level and i wont be getting anything salable out of this canon.... keep on looking if you're considering this camera

Reviews.Title: Ok Camera
Reviews.Author: Paris C
Reviews.Content: good price but the pictures at night aren't nearly as good as my nikon point and shoot camera. Figured the 12.1 mp would help but it just makes the picture size look bigger. good battery life though.

Reviews.Title: A good camera for the guy that wants good pics
Reviews.Author: J. Rynderman
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and i couldn't be more satisfied with it. But, you get what you pay for and the image quality is no where near that of a DSLR's. I know to compare the two is wrong, but if you want great image quality, i would cough up a few extra hundreds and get a DSLR.

Reviews.Title: Canon Power Shot
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Was not new as promised. Received camera and it looked like a floor model. Back glass was scratched and camera would not power up. Seemed broken or electronics not right, highly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Defective Camera
Reviews.Author: Kristina
Reviews.Content: I had this camera 5 months ago but it was stolen. I recently bought another one off amazon on Black Friday and have been playing around with it for a week. I was disappointed to learn that the video playback on my computer was NOT clear; there were squiggly lines in it as if the camera was defective. In addition, the screen on my camera would randomly have squiggly lines too.Also, when I tested the zooming, it was much louder than my first camera. I have read some reviews about the quality difference between cameras that are made in China vs. made in Japan. My first camera was made in Japan; the one from Amazon is made in China. I was hoping this wasn't the case but I believe that's the reason my product is defective. I truly love the Canon 300 but am disappointed that I will have to return it.

Reviews.Title: Some are made in China, some in Japan
Reviews.Author: Freedom Fish AK
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera since upgrading from a Canon SD1100 IS.  Hd video is a much needed upgrade however if you do alot of video you would still be better off with a dedicated camcorder.  The HD quality is way better than on my SD1100 which was only low quality SD.The black color looks good and the gritty feeling on the paint job makes it less likely to slip out of your hand.  The red color is very slippery in comparison.  I ordered the black and red and found out I like the black better.  Red was too slippery and bright but thats just a personal preference.  I found out that both the black and red were made in China.  However I seen the same camera at a Target and Best Buy and both the black and red were made in Japan.  I would rather have Made in Japan.  My old SD1100 was also made in Japan. So unless you buy it from retail store you won't know for sure.  However, Amazon's price is usually better..There are many new settings for taking pictures and the menu and feature layout is very familiar to the SD1100.  The changes that were made I like better.  Overall satisfied with this camera so far except for being made in China. Maybe Amazon could start adding where the product is from or manufactured so customers can have one more piece of information before deciding to buy.  I think for the price and features this is a great camera for a good price.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy This Camera
Reviews.Author: Value Shopper
Reviews.Content: The battery on this camera is a disaster. You cannot leave it in the camera. It lasts just a few hours. You have to take it out and store it separately from the camera or it will drain out in a matter of hours. The owners manual also says not to leave it in the charger for long periods of time or it will reduce battery life as if that matters on a battery that barely makes it through a dance recital! Cannot believe I wasted over $200 on this camera. Absolute waste of money.

Reviews.Title: A bit cheap-looking
Reviews.Author: dc_x
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a small, good-quality digital camera, so I did some research and bought the silver Canon 300 HS. My wife tends to put aesthetics before technical features and she didn't like the look of the camera. I have to admit, the black plastic buttons did look quite cheap-and-nasty.Also, she wanted a panoramic mode like my more expensive Sony camera. Although the description does say that there's a panoramic mode, it just means that the camera will help you take consecutive pictures that can later be combined into a panoramic mode using some PC software. The camera itself doesn't create a panoramic picture (unlike my Sony).In the end we swapped the Canon for a similar-priced Sony camera (DSC-W570) which looked much nicer and had a panoramic mode. This camera seemed to be simpler to operate too, compared to the Canon.In summary, we didn't actually use the Canon camera so I can't comment on the quality of the pictures, but this review is just to highlight a couple of things that I didn't see in other Amazon reviews.

Reviews.Title: My Camara Order
Reviews.Author: Monika
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in the fact that one of the cameras I ordered does not work.Shouldn't the products be in functioning order when sold?

Reviews.Title: pretty in pink
Reviews.Author: chase b
Reviews.Content: Everything about the silver one blows the black out of the water; smooth finish feels very nice, looks nice, doesn't act like a lint brush, and the entire camera has a much sturdier, more solid feel to it in general. In fact, one of the first huge things I noticed was the quality of the battery door.

Reviews.Title: Poor SD card management
Reviews.Author: Joe Stewart "Live united !"
Reviews.Content: After full day of taking picutres they suddenly disappear from SD card. Only older one stay. After this happens for first time I blamed myself and re-format the card using feature in photo menu. Today it happened again ! Can you imagine spending full day with your kids and loose all photos / videos at once ? SD card I use are new Transcend SDHC 32GB.

Reviews.Title: USED PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: Cheryl McManus "YiYi"
Reviews.Content: I originally ordered and expected a new camera but unfortunately this one is clearly used.  The box has material that has been scratched off and looks like it had been opened a hundred times and the camera was just placed in the wrinkled white paper that has clearly been used before.  I paid for a new camera so this one is going back and I am asking for a full refund.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures IF the camera worked!!!!!
Reviews.Author: G. Gavitt
Reviews.Content: I am returning my second Canon PowerShot Elph today.  Both had issues with the lense.  The first time, the lense cover would sometimes open all the way, and sometimes not.  We were in Europe and traveled with it and it had issues at about 3 weeks.  Luckily we were within the time frame to return it, so did.  I liked the pictures it took, and thought the lense issue was a fluke, so ordered another one.  This time we got a "lense error" where the camera would just shut off.  Again, luckily this happened within the 30 day period, so I am returning it and NOT getting a new one.  Love the photos it takes, but if it doesn't work, than the photos do not matter.  DO NOT RECOMMEND!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: photo happy, owns SLR and old canon 890 both superior quality to this in regard to photo compression
Reviews.Author: J. Berger "Liberals destroyed my education I ...
Reviews.Content: FirstMuch like the Canon PowerShot SD890 IS the build is GREAT!!!!!  Better in my opinion ( this from someone who has repaired her 890 after dropping to get it to take photos again, ya OPENED and it works perfectly :)  )it is smaller and thinner then previous PowerShots and even some of the 3000 and 4000 range which I tested and returned  the same day due to a similar issue that this model has.  LACK OF DETAIL in laments terms and for others the compression and more so I feel the digic 4 processor makes the camera for those who will need to take photos and edit USELESS.  HOWEVER, if you want a simple point and shoot and will never edit your photos then get it.  If you want something that allows you to lets say take shot where someone has closed their eyes and edit their eyes from another photo where they are open THIS IS NOT THE CAMERA FOR YOU!  (or me as I have done this with my Canon PowerShot 890 IS for a photo from a bridal shower of a friend)The video zoom is great, grainy but better then my 890IS my SLR does not have video which makes me peeved but the fact that it has a digic III processor every photo comes out fantastic.I want to keep this camera because the build is great and it does take web posting worthiness photos when there is good lighting aka indoors in a kitchen but with the lights on and natural light from outside HOWEVER the loss of detail is there on zoom and not suitable for large prints or editing only for "as is" shots etc.I am a Canon user/fan for years and upgraded and upgraded from one Canon to the next and after trying theCanon PowerShot Elph 1400 and SD1300 and now this model....I think I am going to have to abandon a brand I loved for over a decade.  I am so sad that despite consistent complaints that canon has not rectified the compression issue.  My 10 megapixel old Canon PowerShot takes better photos then this and the other aforementioned NEW models then there is a problem.  I had my Peterbald sit in his bed in low light conditions using flash and full auto on both this model the 300 and my old model the 890 and the loss of detail on this model was abysmal compared to my 890 using same subject same lighting conditions and same distance and same sd card.So I am back on the hunt for replacement still and every camera that has the digic 4 and regardless of cmos or ccd because they have such a high pixel count the cameras just do not cut the mustard and this issue is I need a point and shoot that has video for when I am taking pictures of my Peterbalds or my baby cousins or anything to have to lug my slr and my video cam (which is a canon btw which is great) is ridiculous.signed really ticked and hoping Canon comes out with something better...:(

Reviews.Title: Very rough finish to touch
Reviews.Author: Ganesh
